loans.name: Kaing

texts.en: V., 26, is a widowed mother who has two children. Both of her children are still young and she cares for them. The family lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. V. sells grocery items in the village and raises pigs in a stall next to her house. Pig raising is V.'s main source of income. Right now, her pigs are mature enough for slaughter.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $300 to buy pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Nawaf

texts.en:
Nawaf, 33, lives with his wife in Aley, Mount Lebanon, where he has owned a bakery for a year. He makes bread, “saj”and “mankoucheh.” The “saj” is the metal oven where the saj bread is made, and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and its most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). It can be eaten at any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. 

Nawaf is special in his work because he does it well and is known for the quality of his mankoucheh. His clients are friends, neighbors and people from the region. He embarked upon this business to improve his family’s income and is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw material for his bakery. This is his first  loan request, and in the future he plans to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his bakery.

loans.name: Mrs. Surn Oum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people living in Kab Leav village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Surn O. is a forty-one-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Ros Torn, is a commune chief who has a small salary. This couple has three children, two of whom are attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Surn O. is requesting a loan to buy a bicycle for her children drive to work.  

Fifteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for her children drive to work.

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.en:
Huyền Hồ Thị (656071591) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Hưng nguyên. She is married and has two school-aged children. Huyền owns and operates a business raising livestock for sale, primarily cattle. Huyền has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Huyền joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand the shelter of her livestock.

Huyền is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 2nd loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Prossie Nagawa ‘S Group

texts.en:
Prossie is a leader of five members of a group.  She is 27 and married with four children between 6 and 12 years of age. All of her children go to school. She resides in, and owns, a two-room house where she stays with six people. Prossie takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Prossie operates a ladies salon in Ndeeba, one of Kampala suburbs. She works an average of 15 people a day and sells to all categories of people.  She works seven days a week. Prossie buys cosmetics and hair relaxers from Kampala city shops. She uses public transport to and from shopping.  Her major monthly expenses include medication for the business premises, school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last four years . Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her. Prossie has been with MCDT for over two years and is servicing her fourth loan, working all along with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cream relaxers and a Hair Dryer.  Prossie aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise.
.

loans.use: To buy more cream relaxers and a hair dryer

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia B. is from the village of Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, married, and has seven adult children. Lilia owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally P. is already 41 years old. She is married to Francisco P. and both of them are thankful for they are blessed with three loving children. The eldest is Johnny - 21 years old, who is now in first year college, followed by John Carlo - 12 years old and Princes - 9 years old who are both in grade school. 

Sally offers home service manicure/pedicure and at the same time she is also a beautician. She doubles her time in order to have a bigger income to improve their way of living and sustain their basic needs as well. Aside from that, Sally also manages a hog-raising business.

In order for her to provide a better service for her customers, Sally wants to purchase more beauty products that she can use in her home service. For that, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan from Kiva. She can also use some of the amount for buying feed for her hog.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products and to buy feed for her hog

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke, from Ibadan, is 53 years old and married with three children. A seller of provisions and gift items, she is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and gift items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and gift items to sell.

loans.name: Bulubandi 1 West Mukaya Olivia Group

texts.en:
M. Olivia is twenty-eight years old and married with four children, three of whom are going to school. She is also looking after two dependents.

Olivia has owned a retail shop since 2005. She is requesting the loan to purchase retail items; that is, adding stock to her business such as flour, rice, salt, sweets (candies), biscuits (cookies), soap, juice, air-time, etc.

Olivia is planning to work hard so that she improves her retail shop. Her future hope is to educate her children and obtain another business which will help her generate extra daily income to cater for her family.

loans.use: To purchase items for her shop

loans.name: Berta Luz

texts.es: Berta Luz R. C. de 40 años de edad, reside en Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a sus tres pequeños hijos, los cuales dependen en absoluto de ella. Berta se dedica a la elaboración de especias las cuales se utilizan para darle sabor a los alimentos, así mismo se encarga de venderlos de manera ambulante en diferentes ciudades de Sonsonate. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de las especias y de esta manera tener una mayor cantidad de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Berta desea mucho obtener mayores ganancias, ya que debe suplir todas las necesidades básicas de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Berta Luz R. C. is 40 years old. She lives in Armenia in the state of Sonsonate. She lives there with her three little sons who completely depend on her. Berta produces spices which are used to add flavor to food. She also sells the spices in an ambulant fashion in different cities in Sonsonate. She is asking for a long to be able to buy additional supplies to increase her spice production and offer greater quantities to her clients. Berta very much wishes to increase her profits since she must meet her sons' basics needs.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to produce food spices

loans.name: Lelane

texts.en:
Lelane B. is from the city of Dapitan.  She is 41 years old.  Lelane is married and has 5 school-aged children.  To make a living, Lelane owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a specialized store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks such as bread and noodles in the local community. 

Lelane has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lelane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lelane has successfully repaid her previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lelane is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. 

This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lelane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina G. is from Gango, city of Ozamiz. She is 50 years old and married to Olympio G.. They blessed with 3 adult-aged and 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Fedelina raised a small piggery to sustain their daily expenses and to support the education for their children. She has been engaged in this production for 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.


In March 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial and other services of Paglaum to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000. PHP which will be used to buy more feeds for her swine production. This loan will be her 2nd loan taken out by Fedelina G. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve their living situation and to live a healthy life.

loans.use: Use to buy more feeds for her swine production

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 47 years old and married to Manuel Rodriquez, a tricycle driver in their village at Larion Bajo, Tuguegarao City. The couple is blessed with four children and they are helping one another to support the needs of their family.

Elvira manages a vegetable-selling business, and does her best to meet her family's needs through the income she generates.

Due to the growing needs of her family, Elvira noted that she needs to double her income. To have additional capital, Elvira is requesting PHP10,000 from KIVA lenders in order to improve her business and eventually increase her daily income.

Elvira has a strong determination to fulfill her dreams in life. She wants to be able to improve her family's poor way of living by improving and expanding her business.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive T. is 30 years old and is married with three children aged 6, 9 and 12. Olive and her family live in Musanze district in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

In 2008, Olive opened a restaurant and employs three people in her business. Her restaurant is open every day from 6 in morning to 10 in evening.

Olive is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to have sufficient working capital to purchase modern equipment for her restaurant. With this loan she hopes to increase her business, which will help her to serve more customers.

loans.use: To purchase modern equipment

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa B. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 30 years old, is single and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Clarissa owns and  operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies to the local community. Clarissa has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Clarissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarissa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make additional items for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Clarissa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sandra Margot

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Margot, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín,  Es Conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de  02 hijas, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Sandra Margot, lleva 02 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos y manualidades, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. En la actualidad, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sandra Margot, 42, is a member of the "10 de Agosto II" communal bank which is in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She has a life partner and is the mother of two daughters who are in school and still dependent on her. Sandra Margot has been a dressmaker and craftsperson for the last two years since, having knowledge and skills in these areas, she didn't hesitate to set up her own workshop in her home. This is a well-equipped area where she daily tends to her regular customers who know her and require her services. She works based on prior orders from her customers. Currently, she is happy and proud of what she has accomplished. With this 600 sol loan she will buy bolts of fabric of various kinds and colors, tools like scissors and large spools of thread, sewing needles for machine and for hand use, pins, buttons, etc. Today she feels herself to be an actualized woman with even more desire to reach her goals and see her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and also the many other women who want to grow in business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu C. on the left of the photo above is the leader of this group. This group of borrowers named their group 'Hope to God'. They are residing and doing business in Waterloo, a small town. They have come to SMT, a partner of 'Shine on Sierra Leone' in Waterloo to apply for a loan of SLL 1,400,000. With this loan, this group of borrowers will buy more goods to expand their businesses.

The leader of the group was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. But she now lives in Waterloo, together with her husband and children. Her husband too is a businessman; three of her children are attending secondary school and four are adults. The forty-nine-year-old sells ginger, fertilizer, green seeds, beans and several items common to West Africans (what we call here Yoruba market).

Kadiatu has been doing this type of business for three years; prior to this she was selling peppers. With her share of this loan, Kadiatu will buy one bag of fertilizer, three bags of salt, and two bags of ginger.

loans.use: Buy one bag of fertilizer, three bags of salt, and two bags of ginger.

loans.name: Abdusharif

texts.en: Abdusharif is a hardworking and responsible married father of three. He works for a business, but he felt the need to earn extra income to cover all the family expenses and pay for his children's education. So, 11 years ago, Abdusharif started processing and selling dried apricots. The demand for his products increased and he gained many more customers. To cover all of his customers' orders, he is asking for a loan of US$1,500 to buy the food supplies he needs to continue growing his business. Abdusharif is making the effort to move his business and his family forward but he needs your help to do it. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Alberto Jose G. U., de 49 años habita en el Barrio Pilas Orientales es acompañado por su mujer la cual se dedica  al comercio, el tiene 7 hijos,  3 de ellos son mayores de edad los otros 4 viven con él y le apoyan en los mandados y quehaceres del hogar, uno de los planes principales del Sr. G., sería el obtener los recursos necesarios para poder apoyar a sus hijos a prepararse académicamente, para esto el señor Alberto desde hace 10 años que se dedica  a la agricultura principalmente  a la producción de Granos Básicos y Hortalizas, el problema primordial del cultivo es el ataque de los roedores en sus plantíos que le dañan considerablemente su producción, es por esta razón que solicitó este crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de siembra, la venta de esta cosecha a un buen precio para la calidad de la misma, le traerá la posibilidad de poder diversificar sus cultivos pudiendo mejorar estabilidad  económica de  la familia.
texts.en:
Señor Alberto Jose G. U., of 49 years, lives in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood. He is accompanied by his wife, who is dedicated to commerce. He has 7 children, 3 of whom are of legal age. The other 4 live with him and help him with the errands and tasks of the home. One of the main plans of Señor G. would be to obtain the necessary resources for his children to be prepared academically. For this Señor Alberto has been dedicated for more than 10 years to agriculture; chiefly to the production of Basic Grains and Vegetables. The fundamental problem of cultivation is the attack of rodents in his fields that damage his production considerably. For this reason he has requested this loan for the purchase of fertilizers and seeds for sowing. The sale of his harvest at a good price because of it's good quality will give him the possibility to be able to diversify his crops, enabling him to improve the economic stability of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina C. is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Fatima Village, Barangay Riza, San Carlos City. She earns her living as a wholesaler and retailer of Pepsi products, running a general store, and renting out gowns and accessories. Florentina’s husband, Escolastico, is a Pepsi sales agent and they have four children who are between 20 and 26 years old. Two of their children are already working and the two younger children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Florentina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income with the earnings from her three businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 19,600 from her business activities. Florentina is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 17,000 was used to fund operations of her businesses and it had a positive impact on both the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 20,000 for her 17th loan which she intends to use as working capital for her businesses. Florentina is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr: Y. Nafissatou est née le 16 Février 1987 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DJIVO Ignace, un plombier, Nafissatou est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Dégo à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Nafissatou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer les différentes charges, Nafissatou vend divers produits de mercerie et des sachets à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Nafissatou s'approvisionne. Nafissatou exerce cette activité depuis sept ans et a déjà bénéficié de crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Très sollicitée par sa clientèle, Nafissatou  n'arrive plus à faire face à toute la demande de sa clientèle. Nafissatou sollicite donc un autre cédit auprès de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Nafissatou Y. was born on February 16, 1987 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Ignace Djivo, a plumber, and is the mother of three children, a few of whom attend school. The family lives in the neighborhood of Dégo in Cotonou. Both parents provide for their family. Nafissatou did not attend school. To pay for the expenses, Nafissatou sells various haberdashery articles and bags, both at home and hawking. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this trade for seven years and was granted a few loans by Alidé, which she repaid on schedule. Her products are in high demand and she is unable to fully meet her customers' demand. This is why Nafissatou came to Alidé and applied for another loan, which she will use to bolster her business and better meet her customers' demand.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various haberdashery articles and bags

loans.name: Noyolot Group

texts.es:
GRUPO NOYOLOT (FLAT)
     El grupo se llama noyolot, y significa amor mió en náhuatle, esta localidad esta situada en los altos de Morelos en el municipio de Tétela del volcán donde se cosecha fruta de temporada casi durante todo el año.

     Las 5 integrantes del grupo son: Flor E. Pérez, Yolanda Alonso Domínguez, Herlinda N. Domínguez, Eduviges A. N., Ernestina A. B., todas ellas son residentes de esta localidad de hueyapan, Flor junto con su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de muebles en madera, Herlinda tiene una pequeña estética de belleza, Yolanda vende antojitos mexicanos lo que son dobladas frutas. Eduviges y Ernestina venden fruta de temporada y también hace  velos tejidos a mano.

     Flor es la representante del grupo, esta casada con el sr. Fausto  tienen 2 hijos uno se llama: Néstor Arturo el únicamente curso la secundaria y Martín que y  no quiso estudiar y prefirió irse a trabajar al campo, y el Sr. Isaías que es el papá de la Sra. Flor. 

Ella necesita un préstamo para que su negocio tenga una mejor presentación, necesita construir un espacio dentro de su casa para que ahí pueda guardar  los muebles y no se dañen con el ambiente, ella ya comenzó a constuir este espacio, sin embargo aún le hace falta mucho para poder terminarlo. Aunque en su comunidad existen negocios como este, sus clientes la prefieren a ella por que los muebles que ella vende son de mejor calildad y duran mucho más. 

Ella junto con sus compañeras trabajarán muy duro para salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
NOYOLOT GROUP (FLAT) The group is called noyolot, which in the Nahuatl language means “my love”. The town is situated in the highlands of Morelos in the municipality of Volcano Tétela where seasonal fruit is harvested almost year-round. The 5 members of the group are: Flor E. Pérez, Yolanda Alonso D. D., Herlinda N., Eduviges N. A., and A. Ernestina B.. All are residents of this town of Hueyapan. Flor and her husband make wood furniture, Herlinda has a small beauty salon, Yolanda sells Mexican snacks of pressed fruit. Hedwig and Ernestina sell seasonal fruit and also make hand-woven veils. Flor, the group representative, is married to Mr. Fausto and they have 2 children. One child, Nestor Arturo, has just started high school and the other son, Martin, would rather go to work in the fields than study. Mr. Isaiah is Ms. Flor’s father. She needs a loan to improve the presentation of her business. She needs to build a space inside her home so they can store the furniture there without it getting damaged by the weather. She already began to construct this space, but there is still much to be done. Although there are other businesses in her community like this, her customers prefer the furniture she sells as the quality is much better and it last much longer. She and her colleagues work very hard to get ahead and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material to construct the storage hall for the furniture they sell

loans.name: Faaiu

texts.en:
Faaiu P. is 66 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Faaiu has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faaiu needs a loan of WST $1300 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faaiu joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faaiu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faaiu P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ANDRES VIVE EN CASA DE SU TIA DONDE VIVE CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS DOS HIJITAS EL COMENZO A TRABAJAR EN UNA  FABRICA DE CEMENTO HACE CUATRO  AÑOS ATRÁS DONDE VIO QUE VENDIENDO CEMENTO COLA ERA UN BUEN NEGOCIO E INGRESO , ACTUALMENTE A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CEMENTO COLA DE LA FABRICA YA QUE LE DAN EN UN MENOR PRECIO Y EL LO VENDE DOS BOLIVIANOS MAS ,ASI ES COMO EL SE GANA LA VIDA  PARA LLEVAR UN PAN DE CADA DIA A SU CASA COMO MUCHOS OTROS EL A IDO PROGRESANDO POCO A POCO Y A LO LARGO DEL TIEMPO  DICE QUE SE COMPRARA UNA CASITA PARA EL Y PARA SU FAMILIA YA QUE ES UN POCO INCOMODO YA QUE VIVE EN LA CASA DE SU TIA AHORA EL ESTA AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION Y CON KIVA POR DARLE UNA TAZA PREFERENCIAL Y REDUCIR EL MONTO DE SU CUOTA. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Andres lives in his aunt's house where he lives with his wife and his two little daughters. He began working in a cement factory four years ago where he saw that selling cement was a good business and entrypoint. Currently, he buys and sells cement from the factory since they give him a lower price and he sells it for two bolivianos more. In this way he gains life to bring bread home every day. Like many others, he has progressed gradually and after some time he says he will buy a little house for him and his family since it is a little uncomfortable since he lives with his aunt now. He is thankful to the institution and to Kiva for giving him a preferential cup and reducing the amount of his fee. He is appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence granted by providing the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement at wholesale.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie E. is from the city of Sta. Cruz, Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old. Winnie is married and has 2 school-aged children. Winnie's picture was taken in her mini-office.To make a living, Winnie operates a family member's business venture making and selling food products. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling food like cassava cake, torta, pastries, etc. to local community members. Winnie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Winnie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Winnie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Winnie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Winnie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca G. is from the village of Calaran. She is 44 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business making and selling camote (sweet potato) bars in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. 

In 1999, Rebecca joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to provide additional capital for her business. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for her daughter's education. This loan will be the 19th loan taken out by Rebecca from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for daughter's education.

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana S. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Taciana is married and has 3 adult children. Taciana owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products such as noodles, eggs, milo, juice pack, shampoo, soap and salt. Taciana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Taciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Taciana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Taciana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old carpenter who has been in business for two years and now has two employees. He is married, has three children, and his wife is a dairy farmer who helps him support their family and meet their household expenses. John is a member of the Prosper group. whose members guarantee each other's loan.  He has applied for his first loan, for Kes. 50,000, to buy more timber to use in making furniture.

loans.use: To buy timber for making furniture

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga G. lives with his wife and two teenage children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He drives a cab in the town. His oldest children attend secondary school, while his youngest daughter stays at home with his mother. His wife Saruul is a professional hairdresser.

He has been doing the taxi business since 2005. Gantulga is a very hardworking person and is known for his good character. He is working hard to maintain his success and has much hope for the future. He needs to keep his car in good condition so that he can continue to earn a living. Therefore, he is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug loan in order for him to make the necessary repairs and to replace parts on his car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Mrs. Marilou B. is from Barangay II in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is a 51-year-old wife to Victoriano. They are blessed with 1 child who is now school age. To make a living, Marilou has been selling “ukay-ukay” or secondhand clothes for over 16 years, earning about 3000 PHP per month. Her husband helps support the family working as a water drill contractor.

Marilou joined PMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP and is now requesting her fourth loan, for 5,000 PHP, to support her “ukay-ukay” activity.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy and sell secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is a single mother of four children and all her children go school. She also takes care of her old parents. She owns a stall in Bwaise selling second-hand clothes which she buys from Owino market — one of the busiest markets in Uganda. Jesca uses public transportation for shopping trips which she makes once a week.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She has been in the clothing business for many years. She also gets additional income from knitting table clothes. She sells to all categories of people but mainly women and girls. Her business challenges include  seasonality and transportation of bales of clothes from Owino Market to Bwaise.  She hopes to see her business grow big and start importing clothes and later selling wholesale only. Jesca joined MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She lives in, and owns, a three-roomed house. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang H. N. is 51 years old and has three children who are attending at high school and secondary school.

Giang is a builder but the salary is not stable. Therefore, he manages a range of houses for rent to earn more income to cover family expenditures and school fees.

Giang is a good client of SEDA. Currently, he wants to obtain a loan of 6,322,000 VND to pay school fees because the new school year is coming.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl tiene 41 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de restaurante. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, el inicio este negocio vendiendo mariscos en rio San Juan por lo que aprendió a elaborar diferentes platillos pues siempre está pendiente de complacer a sus clientes, pues él es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de realizar esta actividad, lo que más le gusta es complacer a sus clientes. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras, carnes, pollo, pescado entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración de sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Saul is 41 years old and has had a restaurant for more than 10 years. He started the business selling shellfish by the San Juan River, learning to prepare different dishes. He is always looking to please his customers, for he is a very responsible man who enjoys his work. What he likes most is to please his customers. He is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, oil, produce, meat, chicken, fish, among other things needed to prepare his succulent dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Denis Antonio

texts.es: El  Sr. A. es originario del municipio de Achuapa, se desempeña como maestro de primaria con 16 año de experiencia en cuanto al financiamiento es el primer crédito el cual lo  utiliza para gasto universitario de un hijo que está sacando una especialidad en Guatemala en ingeniero civil.  .
texts.en: Mr. A. is from the Achuapa municipality.  He works as a primary school teacher, a field in which he has 16 years of experience.  As far as the loan, this is his first credit, which he intends to use for the university expenses of one of his children who is studying to be a civil engineer in Guatemala.

loans.use: For university expenses.

loans.name: Maura Balios Group

texts.en:
Maura B. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Maura is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Shine'.

Maura is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maura owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Maura has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maura joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maura is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This  will be the first loan taken out by Maura from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Draft;wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are transportation and food for the family.

He has operated a poultry business and charcoal selling, both retail and from door to door, his potential customers being butcher operators and food vendors. He faces the challenge of seasonality, chicken diseases and food vendors. He decided to join Yehu to have four branches to supply frequently. 

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to pay school fees for his children. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio B., age 59, operates a transportation services business. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. He and his wife live in the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental, and have seven grown children.

In 2006, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He wished to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Rogelio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle for better transportation service

loans.name: Barshad

texts.ru:
Barshad M. 54 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Barshad yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli, i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione ,posolok Akhmedbeyli vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Barshad uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom skotovodstva. Ranshe on imel maqazin qde prodoval pisheviye produkti no potom on reshil pomenyat bizness. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Barshada v perviy raz on bral 725$ chtobi kupit vesi i produkti , on ochen blagodaren lenderam za ssudu. Seycha on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo novoqo biznessa.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/12030
texts.en:
Barshad M. is 54 years old.  He is married and has three children.  Barshad is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).   He is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives with his family in the Fuzuli region in the village of Akhmedbeyli.  

Barshad has been a herdsman for two years.  Before that, he owned a store where he sold foodstuffs.  Then he decided to change businesses.  This is his second loan.  The first time, Barshad borrowed $725 to buy scales and groceries.  He is very thankful to the lenders for the loan.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to expand his new business.

Here is a link to his first loan: http://partners.kiva.org/lend/12030

loans.use: Buying cows

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 50-year-old married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the last six years.  He started with small scale farmingand now farms on a large scale.  William wants a loan to cultivate more land for farming (planting irish potatoes, bananas, and sugarcane).

loans.use: To plant more crops

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S. was born in 1983; she is a married woman and has been blessed with two children. Both of them are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Kong Phon. He is 26 years old, and he is a partner who helps her conduct the business. Presently, S. grows vegetables to sell and raises pigs, which she will sell when they mature. With her loan with HKL, they will purchase two buffalo to alleviate their hard physical labor on the farm field.

loans.use: To purchase two buffalo for farming business.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame N. is married and has 6 children. She has no formal education. Maame has been selling palm oil in Abrafo, near Abura, for 4 years. Her husband is a mechanic. Maame uses her income to pay for sending her children to school. This means that she and her husband have to pay for school fees, books and uniforms. Any leftover money is used for the family's sustenance.

Maame will use this loan to purchase larger quantities of palm fruits in order to produce more oil to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to provide a solid financial foundation to enable her children to enjoy the best possible education. She will reinvest part of the money in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of palm fruits

loans.name: Jane Warigia

texts.en:
Jane Warigia M. is 29 years old and married to John M.. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a mini wholesale shop in Shaurimoyo for a period of 12 years and earns a profit of KES 10,500 per month. Shaurimoyo is a densely populated estate just few kilometers from Nairobi city centre, and she has many customers.

Jane was introduced  to KADET Ltd. by an existing client of KADET, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 70,000 from KADET. She intends to use the loan to add more stock such as maize flour for KES 20,000, cooking fat worth KES 10,000, wheat flour worth KES 20,000, and rice worth KES 20,000. 

She will save the anticipated profit  to pay school fees for her children.

In the future Jane plans to grow her business and eventually open a complete wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock to the mini wholesale shop

loans.name: Ba

texts.en: Ba T. N. is 47 years old and has 2 children, one of whom is attending a  training course on driving. Ba T. N. is a farmer. Her main activities focus on growing rice, corn and vegetables and raising pigs for meat. She has operated this business for ages and it provides food to support herself and her family. She also sells her products in order to have cash to pay for daily expenses. Ba T. N. has been a client of our credit program since 2006 and has been a good group leader. She now wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Kihinet Group, Kihihi

texts.en: K. Eunice is the leader of Kihinet group in Kihihi. She is 43 years old and married with 4 children, all in school. Eunice has a poultry business in Karere trading centre where she keeps layer chicken that produce eggs for sale. She has been in this business for 10 years and she is able to make 100,000/= as weekly profits. Eunice is also involved in the sale of produce like coffee, bananas and millet which also contribute to her monthly income. She started her poultry business with capital from selling produce. Her dream is to see her business as well as her family expand in future. In the meantime, she has bought land for agriculture and now needs a loan to be able to buy more chicks for farm expansion.

loans.use: Purchase more chicks for her business

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is 28, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 7. Both of her children are enrolled in school. 

Aline's husband is a seller of building materials, and Alien sells beans, sugar, rice, tomatoes, and other vegetables at her shop. Aline has been in this business for two years. 

With this loan, Aline will buy additional inventory for her shop, and with the profits, she hopes to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy additional beans, sugar, rice, tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda, de 39 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Andrés de 41 años y sus 3 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor educación. Trabajando arduamente, Lucinda ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora y media para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa, arveja, habas y olluco, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelamente a esta actividad, ella tiene un restaurante, negocio que le ayuda mucho en sus ingresos, puesto que su establecimientos es muy concurrido por sus vecinos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 31 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, las cual les pueda ayudar a mejorar su economía. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas semillas para sembrar, además comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 39 years old.  She is a very loving and hard-working mother who lives in her own home together with her husband, 41 year-old Andrés, and her three children who she would like to provide with a better education.

Through hard work, Lucinda has ensured that her farm provides her with the products she needs to support her family.  Before the first rays of sun are visible, she leaves her home and walks for nearly an hour and a half to reach her farmland where she grows potatoes, peas, beans and olluco (a native tuber), crops which she then takes to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma to sell.

In addition to this, Lucinda owns a restaurant.  This business helps her a lot in terms of income since her establishment is very popular with her neighbors.  What Lucinda most likes about her work is cultivating her land because she feels that she is putting it to good use.  She has been in this business for 31 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce to Tarma since the sacks she carries are very heavy and make her very tired.

Over time, Lucinda would like to set up a grocery store which will help her to improve her financial situation.  This is her tenth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to be able to access this loan and she would like to thank all those people who will make it possible for her to receive the money that she needs.  Lucinda is a very well-respected member of her community bank because of the order that she brings to the meetings.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy new seeds to sow.  She will also buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy potato and pea seeds, and sacks of manure

loans.name: Trey's Group

texts.en:
Four people form this group loan. Mrs. Trey is the group leader selected by the other members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Trey, who was born in 1975, is a widow with three children who all are students and also help with their mother's business.

Mrs. Trey is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to support this business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food. Aside from pig breeding, she also works as a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Doña Vicenta R. S., tiene 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos, 3 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración de canastas de plastico, lleva 6 años de experiencia en este oficio, cuenta con el epoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la artesanía también a la satreria y la confección de tejidos.

Deciden solicitar un prèstamos para compra de terreno, el préstamo será para ajustar el precio que tendrá el predio que van a adquir, lo cual no dudan que es una inversión rentable. Ya que de esta forma de incrementar su patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Doña Vicenta R. S., age 46, did not have the opportunity to get an education.  She has five children, three of which are in school.  She makes plastic baskets for a living and has been in this business for six years.  Her husband, who produces fabric and is a tailor, also helps her with her craft.

They decided to request a loan to purchase land.  The loan will be used to adjust the price for the property they buy, which they believe will be a profitable investment.  They hope to increase their family assets in this manner.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 36 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Ella desde algunos años se dedica al bordado de vestidos, actividad que le demanda prácticamente todo día, puesto que debe ser muy minuciosa en el acabado. La manera de trabajar de Ana consiste en recibir pedidos de diferentes comerciantes, quienes le dan cierta cantidad de prendas para que Ana pueda adornarlos con diferentes y novedosos bordados y hacerlos más llamativos. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite poner toda su creatividad en los trabajos, realizándolo a su propio gusto, sin embargo la parte difícil radica en esforzar su vista para ensartar las mostacillas con las que adorna sus prendas,  puesto que estas  son muy pequeñas. Es su quinto crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales para el adorno de las prendas que le dejan y así lograr mejores resultados.
texts.en:
36 year-old Ana is a very humble and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home and what she wishes for more than anything is to do well in life.  For some years she has been embroidering dresses.  This is an activity that takes practically all day since she must be very meticulous in putting the finishing touches to her work.  The way Ana works is that she receives orders from different salespeople who provide her with a certain quantity of garments for her to decorate with different and original embroidery work.  Her job is to make the garments more striking.

Ana enjoys her work a lot because she is able to put all her creativity into it, doing the work according to her own taste.  However, the difficult part of her work is having to strain her eyes in order to string the beads with which she decorates the garments because they are very small.

This is Ana's fifth loan from MFP and she has always been very punctual in making her repayments.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy materials for decorating the garments that she is given, so that she can obtain better results.

loans.use: to buy materials for embroidering garments

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala, 21, is a very ambitious mom who lives with her two kids and her husband Rami who is a carpenter in Al Zarqa. 

Hala turned a part of her house into a small grocery store three years ago. Most of her neighbors comes to buy from her since she is the closest to them, and she has been providing them with the products they need. She uses kindness in dealing with her customers. 

Hala has applied for a loan to buy more products that people are asking for, so she can get the profit she needs to open a bigger grocery store outside her house.

loans.use: To buy more products that people are asking for

loans.name: Mujeres Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Mujeres al Desarrollo se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Canaria, Distrito del mismo nombre, inicia su sexto ciclo con 13 socias, las cuales tienen diversos negocios. Luisa, es socia del Banco Comunal, esta casada y tiene 02 hijas D. 24 y 26 años quienes son estudiantes universitarias en la capital. Si bien su familia se encuentra establecida en Lima, Luisa se dedica a la venta D. comida hace varios años en Canaria, para poder acompañar a su padre que tiene una avanzada edad y se reúsa a viajar. Luisa pese a estar separada D. su familia y extrañarla constantemente, lucha para salir adelante y se siente apoyada por los créditos que obtiene a través D. Finca Perú. Luisa solicita un préstamo para comprar víveres para su negocio D. comidas. Luisa tiene como sueño que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en: The Mujeres al Desarrollo ("Women Development") Community Bank is found located in the Canaria community, in the district of the same name. It's beginning its sixth cycle with 13 member, who have diverse businesses. Luisa is a member of the community bank, is married and has two daughters who are 24 and 26 years old and study at universities in the capital. While her family is based in Lima, Luisa has been dedicated to selling food for various years in Canaria so she can accompany her father who is elderly and refuses to travel. Luisa hates to be separated from her family and misses them constantly. She fights to get ahead and feels supported by the loans that she obtains through Finca Peru. Luisa is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her food business. Luisa's dream is that her daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale products.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a dairy farmer who lives in the west Kenyan town of Kitale, where he has made a living as a farmer for the last 10 years. His farm produces milk, maize, vegetables and beans, all of which he sells in the local market. He mainly depends the income he earns in this market to meet the needs of his family. He is applying for a loan for 83,200 Kes from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure two dairy cows. His goal is to increase his income by having more milk to sell. A higher income will also allow him to buy more animal feed and treat the diseases which affect his farm's output. Gilbert is 37 years old,  married and has seven children, all of whom attend school.

loans.use: To buy and insure two dairy cows.

loans.name: Sarita Noemí

texts.es:
La señora  Sarita Noemi vive en la cuidad de Managua se desempeña 
Es madre de familia de dos menores doña Sarita visito nuestras instalación para solicitar un crédito para  ya que necesitaba el crédito para completar el dinero para la compra de un terreno. 
La señora agradece a ceprodel por el crédito que le dieron por que gracias a el va a poder hacer la compra de su terreno.
texts.en:
Sarita Noemi lives in the city of Managua.  She is the mother of two minor children.  

Sarita visited our office to request a loan.  She needs this loan so that she can pull together enough money to buy a piece of land.

Sarita is grateful to Ceprodel for this loan, because it will enable her to complete the purchase of this land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 35, is the married mother of four children. She is a boutique owner and a tailor in Mariakani and her business has been in operation for the last eleven years. Her business has been doing well.

She is a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase an overlock and zigzag machine for her tailoring business.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady and to offer the best life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock and zigzag machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Wladimir Ivan

texts.es: El señor Wladimir es transportista propietario y tiene mas de  20 años con esta actividad, el vive en la ciudad de el alto con toda su familia, su trabajo es muy sacrificado, puesto que trabaja desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta las 22:00 pm, todos los días, junto con su esposa se dividen los gastos familiares, con mucho esfuerzo han logrado sacar a su familia adelante ahora la mayoría de su hijos son profesionales y ayudan con los gastos familiares, don Wladimir sueña con que todos sus hijos puedan ser independientes y tener una profesión, por eso se esfuerza todos los días para que no les falte nada. Don Wladimir solicita crédito en la institución para el mantenimiento de su  movilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Wladimir is an owner and transportation services provider with more than 20 years in this business. He lives in the city of El Alto with his whole family. His work requires much sacrifice given that he works from the early morning hours until 10 p.m. every day. He divides up the family expenses with his wife, and with much effort they have been able to get their family ahead. Now the majority of his children are professionals who help with household expenses. 

Don Wladimir dreams that all his children may be independent and have a profession. To that end he makes the effort every day so they may not lack for anything. 

Don Wladimir seeks a loan with the institution for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es: Marlin, tiene la edad 25 de  años, está casada y vive con su madre y tres hijos. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de novillos para el engorde. Ella cuenta con un potrero a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con pasto  para su engorde más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de novillos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marlin, who is 25 years old, is married and lives with her mother and three children. With this loan she hopes to buy young bulls to fatten up. She has a pasture in her possession and she expects to feed them grass to fatten them up more quickly. She wants her animals to have the ideal weight for their later sale at the local market or in other areas in the region. 

She wants to generate the majority of the profit for her well-being and that of her family, in addition to growing her business of raising young bulls. This is the first loan that she's received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy young bulls.

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Aizada is the leader of this group. She is 36 and married to a car electrician. Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and a son. Her daughter studies at school and her son is preschool age (under seven). Aizada works as a cook in the poultry factory, but at the moment, she is on maternity leave. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase building materials to repair the house. In the future, Aizada wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe de 47 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto con su familia la cual está conformada por sus 2 hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica a la venta de deliciosas pupusas. Ha trabajado duramente para sacar adelante a su familia. Para Morena lo más importante es que sus queridos hijos puedan tener lo necesario en educación y alimentación. Su familia es la que la impulsa a seguir  trabajando duramente para poder darles el pan de cada día. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pupusería en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, queso, chicharon, etc. para contar con suficiente materia prima a la hora de realizar las deliciosas pupusas y poder ofrecerlas a los clientes que frecuentan el negocio de Morena. Tiene plena confianza que su esfuerzo valdrá la pena y podrá lograr su objetivo. Cabe mencionar que Morena está muy agradecida con  INTEGRAL ya que en el pasado le brindo su ayuda para poder invertir en el negocio y gracias a Dios los resultados fueron muy buenos, espera en ésta ocasión superar esa experiencia
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe is 47 years old.  She lives in her own house with her family, which is comprised of two children.  The children are 10 and 5 years old, and they go to school.

She sells delicious “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans).  She has worked hard in order to get her family ahead.  The most important thing to Morena is that her beloved children are able to have the necessary education and nourishment.  Her family is what drives her to keep working hard in order to be able to give them their daily bread.

This has motivated her to request this loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan is to invest in her pupusa business by purchasing the needed ingredients like corn, rice, beans, cheese, and fried pork rinds, etc.  Morena is then able to sell the pupusas to the customers that frequent her business.  She has every confidence that it will be worthwhile, and she will be able to reach her objective.

It needs to be mentioned that Morena is very grateful to INTEGRAL because in the past they gave her help in order to be able to invest in the business.  Thanks to God, the results were very good.  On this occasion she hopes to surpass this experience.

loans.use: to buy  the needed ingredients like corn, rice, beans, cheese, and fried pork rinds, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 51-year-old farmer who lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She hires farmers from her town to help till her land. Rice is her main crop. 

She also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Maria has requested a loan to purchase feed, fertilizer and other farm supplies. Maria hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase feed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado San Blas, es D. la Ciudad D. Caacupé, está integrado por 14 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que día a día luchan por poder darle a sus familias todo lo mejor. Ellas son todas vecinas y amigas D. esa ciudad, todas son muy conocidas en el barrio por el trabajo en conjunto que realizan.
La señora Irma es la presidenta D. dicho comité, vive con su marido e hijos, se dedica a la venta D. ropas. Formó parte D. su grupo ya que es la primera vez que alguien se acerca a ofrecerle una ayuda para aumentar sus ingresos. Comenta que por medio D. su trabajo logra ayudar a su familia con los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para el abastecimiento D. su negocio por medio D. la compra D. ropas, con lo cual podrá cumplir con sus clientes y tener más variedad.
texts.en:
This committee is named “San Blas” and is from the city of Caacupé. It consists of 14 hardworking and determined women who strive day after day to proviD. all the best for their families. They are all neighbors and friends who live in the city. All of them are well-known in their neighborhood for the work they perform together as a group.

Sra. Irma is the president of this committee. She lives with her husband and children. Irma sells clothes. She joined this group because someone, for the first time, offered her assistance with increasing her income. Irma says that through her work, she has been able to help her family with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan for restocking her business, so she will buy clothes in order to complete the orders from her customers and offer them more variety.

loans.use: to buy clothing for eventual resale.

loans.name: G.s. Los Amigos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Amigos lo conforman  Jorge Luis, Mariela, Ana y Francisco. El señor Jorge tiene 27 años. Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio que es la venta de huevos al por mayor y al detalle, sus ventas las realiza en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante, tiene 6 años de tener este negocio. Mariela tiene 28 años se dedica a la venta de artesanías de manera ambulante, sus compras las realiza en el mercado. Ella dio inicio con el negocio desde hace 2 años, fue con ayuda de sus familiares que la apoyaron con el capital inicial para que saliera adelante y además recibió ayuda de otros comerciantes que tenían experiencia en este medio. Ana Patricia tiene su negocio que es la venta de nacatamales, frijoles y elabora sopa, esto varia diariamente buscando lo que el  cliente quiera. Su mayor desafío es realizar la compra de equipos para el negocio debido a que actualmente no tiene y tiene que usar los utensilios de su casa. Ella inicio el negocio con ayuda de su papa que le aparto capital de trabajo para que ella trabajara y saliera adelante debido a que en nuestro país es difícil conseguir empleo. Francisco el señor se dedica a la venta de huevos de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación. El señor solicita este nuevo crédito para invertirlo en su negocio y surtir mas el mismo, además que al realizar compras grandes obtiene descuentos que no tiene cuando compra al por menor.
texts.en: The communal bank "Los Amigos" is made up of members Jorge Luis, Mariela, Ana and Francisco. Jorge is 27 years old.  He requests a loan to invest in his business selling eggs at wholesale and retail. He makes his sales from his house, and also in an itinerant manner.  He has had this business for 6 years.  Mariela is 28 years old and has a business selling handicrafts.  She buys her products in the market and sells from place to place.  She started up this business 2 years ago; her relatives helped her  by contributing the startup capital so that she could get the business going.  She also received help from other merchants who had experience in this line of work.  Ana Patricia has a business selling nacatamales (a traditional Nicaraguan tamal), beans and soup.  Her menu varies daily in order to accommodate the demands of her customers.  Her main challenge is to buy equipment for the business.  At this time, she does not have this equipment and so she uses utensils from her house.  She started this business with the help of her father, who set aside working capital so that she would be able to work and get ahead, since in this country it is difficult to find work.  Francisco has a business selling eggs from place to place, and also from his house.  He requests this new loan to invest in his business and stock it with more eggs; the loan will also allow him to make a big purchase and obtain a discount that he could not get if he buys the eggs at retail.

loans.use: to buy eggs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
