Grace is 41 years old and is married to Michael. They live in Kakamega and have one grand child.  Grace has a charcoal business, which she has been doing for the past six years. 

She has applied for a loan to enable her to buy materials for making the charcoal burners.  She hopes to be the leader charcoal dealer in her town.

loans.use: To buy materials for making charcoal burners

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es: María, solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda como aceite, gaseosas, jugos, refrescos, dulces, churros, estos productos le ayudan para atender la demanda de los clientes. El préstamo anterior se noto bastante que el inventario de María aumento, cambiando la manera de atender a los clientes, y el movimiento en las ventas fue mayor.
texts.en: María is asking for a loan to buy stock merchandise for the store like oil, soft-drinks, juice, refreshments, candy and snacks which will help her meet customer demand.  It was quite noticeable that María’s stock inventory increased with the previous loan and sales were better.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor sigue participando en el banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Victor nació en la ciudad de Chinchero de  la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y tiene 44 años edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Victor sigue dedicándose al brindar servicio de transporte urbano en su propio taxi. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio y le va muy bien. Victor requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. 
 
Victor se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victor continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Las Palmeras” (The Palm Trees), which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. He was born in the city of Chicero in Urubamba Province in the Department of Cusco. Victor is 44 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children.

At the moment, he continues to provide urban transportation services with his own taxi. Victor has been providing this service for several years and has done very well. He is requesting a loan so that he can maintain his vehicle.

Victor is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Clara has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Clara has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Clara hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo ya que necesita comprar dos llantas y repuestos para su vehículo de uso empresarial (taxi), él se decidió por la buena atención de la institución y por la necesidad de dar a su vehículo el mantenimiento adecuado.
Los efectos que Carlos ha tenido con los préstamos ha sido favorable ya que le ha permitido mantenerse y apoyar a su familia de una mejor manera, este avance le ha permitido la decisión de adquirir su propia vivienda con el fondo social, aunque por el momento no la habita porque todavía falta los servicios públicos como agua, luz y teléfono.
texts.en:
Carlos is asking for a new loan because he needs to buy two tires and repair parts for his vehicle that he uses in an entrepreneurial way (as a taxi).  He decided to do this because of the attention he got from the institution and out of need to give his vehicle some needed maintenance.

The effects of the loans have been favorable for Carlos and they have allowed him to support his family in a better way and acquire his own home with public funds.  He still does not live there because running water, electricity, and telephone services have not been installed.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca tiene 57 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Zope, ahi vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Francisca se dedica desde hace unos tres años a la compra y venta de pescado y camaron, sus ventas las realiza a vendedores de mariscos del departamento de comayagua, tambien vende a los pobladores de su comunidad, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado y camarones ya que tiene un varios pedidos grandes y no tiene capital suficiente para cubrir dichos pedidos.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para salir adelante con su proyecto, que es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Francisca, 57, lives in the village of Zope with her husband and two children. For three years Francisca has been buying and selling fish and shrimp. She sells to the seafood vendors in the state of Comayagua and also to people in her town. 

She will use the loan to buy fish and shrimp because she has several large orders and doesn't have enough capital to complete them. Her goal is to keep working so that she can move forward on her plans to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who has a business selling fruit and fresh fruit juices. He operates his juice corner in the market where he serves his customers with fresh fruits and fresh juices. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits and another juicer machine that will allow him to offer juices to many customers at one time. 

She herself also works and operates an embroidery and sewing business. She is very passionate about her work and offers good quality work to her clients at reasonable rates. She charges PKRs 150 for each dress. The income she earns helps her pay utility bills and manage other household expenses.
 
She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Due to financial constraints, Robina couldn’t provide education facilities to them. 

Her husband has been operating his business for the past many years. Robina is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for him and that it will increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy fruits and another juicer machine

loans.name: Yhon Oscar

texts.es:
Yhon Oscar  tiene 22 años de edad, él vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.

"Yhon conduce una mototaxi, se dedica a este trabajo 10 horas diarias, en un día Yhon puede atender a 50 clientes  y esto le permite ganar hasta S/. 40 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/.60 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales   y para  invertir en el negocio, el cree que le va bien debido a que es cordial con los clientes.

Yhon está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado el podrá pagar la inicial de su mototaxi, con esta mejora ya no tendrá que pagar alquiler ya que no contaba con una propia y así poder seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir  su gran sueño: Tener una empresa de mototaxis."
texts.en:
Yhon Oscar is 22, and lives in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, close to four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country. It is celebrated by Peruvians as the "The Land of the Sun."

It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007, and 6.9 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps especially, as the source of the traditional national drink of Peru, pisco. The home and business of the client is found in this warm and arid climate.

Yhon drives a mototaxi. He works 10 hours a day. In one day, Yhon can serve 50 customers, and this allows him to earn up to 40 soles a day and on a good day, he can earn up to 60 soles. This helps him meet some extra household expenses, and allows him to invest in his business. He thinks that it's going well due to the fact that he is friendly with the customers.

Yhon is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the support he has been offered, he will be able to make the down payment on his mototaxi. With this improvement, he won't have to pay to rent it anymore, as he didn't have is own.  In this way, he will be able to continue saving to fulfill his great dream, "To have a mototaxi company."

loans.use: To make a down payment to purchase his mototaxi.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 45 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children. Lorna works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 2,500 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Lorna has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Joseph. He is married, and has 4 children aged 14, 11, 6, and 2yrs. Joseph established his  provision business. He began his business because he wanted to get a reliable source of income which he can use to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.Joseph now requires a new loan in order to purchase more provision for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Joseph plans to open stores in different market areas and educate his children to university level. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Delia has a shop that sells charcoal. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more firewood to make charcoal.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy firewood to make charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nonvigbe Group

texts.fr: NONVIGBE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Lydie Claire (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 47 ans. Lydie Claire a arrêté l'école. Lydie Claire est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Dominique. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Lydie Claire et son mari. Pour cette raison, Lydie Claire vend des tissus par la technique de distribution, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Lydie Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Lydie Claire sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIGBE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçu antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine aged 34 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 11 years.2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children and to buy a cow.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: She trades in dried pepperand other farm spices. She purchases pepper and other perishable farm produce from farmers. She dries them and then sell them to institutions including hospitals, clinics and schools. Her activities are very helpful to the farmers as she assist to address the post harvest losses of her client farmers by given them prompt incomes and also support the chain of distribution as a key link between the farmers who are the producers and the institutions who are the consumers.She therefore has a ready and availble market and constant cash flow in her business. Rebecca has also participated in the TEACH lending skills programme and has developed a simple marketing plan that enables her to market her wares easily.She therefore needs KIVA loan funds to further improve her business.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda began selling perfumes and cosmetics two years ago for another person, who paid her a small percentage of the sales she made. She decided to apply for a loan to acquire credit for the purchase of products by Yanbel, a line of cosmetics and perfumes. She has been running her own business for a year as a microentrepreneur. The business has allowed her to generate more income for her family. Now she sells all types of cosmetics, fashion accessories and perfumes, particularly to the ladies of her neighborhood.

Glenda is applying for credit so that she'll be able to expand her business by buying products wholesale. She has noted an increase in demand and wants to be able to satisfy her clients by offering more products, and a greater variety of products.

Glenda is 48 years old. She is raising three children; only two are still in school. Her husband works as a mechanic and helps her in her business. With this investment, they hope to increase the profitability of the business, and as result, to further improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Glenda se inicio vendiendo perfumes y cosméticos desde hace 2 años para otra persona que le proporcionaba un mínimo porcentaje de utilidad. Ella decidió solicitar un préstamo para obtener crédito en productos de la línea Yanbal, que es una proveedora de cosméticos y perfumes. Ella ha manteniendo su negocio propio desde hace un año como microempresaria, el mismo que le ha permitido generar mayores ingresos para su familia. Ahora vende todos tipos de cosméticos, bisutería y perfumes, particularmente a sus vecinas de la comunidad.

Glenda solicita crédito para poder incrementar su negocio con compras al por mayor. Ella ha notado que su demanda ha aumentado y quiere poder satisfacer a sus clientes con más variedad y productos.

Glenda tiene 48 años y tiene 3 hijos que están a su cargo, pero solo 2 que estudian. Su esposo labora como mecánico y la apoya en su negocio. Espera con la inversión realizada mayor rentabilidad y así mejorar mas su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau works as a day laborer and his wife plants vegetables to sell. They have two young children, and their income is $12.50 per person per month. They want to borrow $75 to buy one more cow to raise.

loans.use: Sau would like to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Rosalba Irene

texts.es:
Rosalba comes from Escobedo in Nuevo León. She is married and has a 20 year old son and a four year old daughter. It was because of them that she started her own business 15 years ago, selling hamburgers and tacos. Her husband is a taxi driver but his earnings are not enough to cover all the household costs. Rosalba started selling food from her house and then she got a cart which she can move around and sell food from.

Rosalba would like a loan of $750 which she will use to buy tables, chairs and some metal poles which she will use to refurbish her business. She hopes it will keep growing and that with this refurbishment she will have more space in which to serve her clients better. She will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Help Rosalba to improve her business. She and her family sincerely thank you for any help you can offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalba es originaria de Escobedo, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene un hijo de 20 años y una pequeña de 4 años de edad, ellos han sido el motivo para iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de hamburguesas y tacos desde hace 15 años, su esposo es taxista pero el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar. Rosalba inició con la venta de comida en la cochera de su casa, después pudo adquirir un carrito ambulante equipado para realizar sus ventas.

Rosalba está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mesas, sillas y una malla metálica con la que remodelara su local, ella espera continuar creciendo y con esta remodelación tendrá más espacio para poder atender bien a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Rosalba a mejorar su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: Refurbishment/Remodelación

loans.name: Nisa

texts.es:
Señora Nisa belongs to the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old, and is the mother of 6 children. Her husband works at a small farm on a mountain, where after 20 days he can be flown down to his family and give them what little money he has earned. But, given the daily needs of her family, Nisa worked herself up to open a small grocery since the block already had a school. For this she solicited her first loan of 300 Sol (US $94 approx.). The recent loan granted to Nisa by Manuela Ramos in the sum of 2,000 Sol. (US$630 approx.). will be used to purchase 6 boxes of soda water, 2 sacs of sugar, 3 boxes of milk, 1 box of treats, 1 pack of biscuits, and 5 bags of water in satchels. Nisa is very happy to be able to contribute economically to her household. In addition, given the fierce heat in her region, that she can attend to the children, who need a lot of liquids to sate their thirst. Now, the grocery provides for the family's daily expenses and they have no trouble waiting for the arrival of her husband. She counts on the help of her children, who without neglecting their studies help attend to the grocery.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nisa pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 61 años, y es madre de 6 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en la chacra en el monte, quien después de 20 días pueda estar alado de su familia y darles el poco dinero que consiguió, pero como las necesidades son diarias, es así que Nisa se anima a poner una pequeña bodega ya que a media cuadra está una escuela. Para ello solicitó un primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.). El reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 630.00 aprox.) será utilizado para comprar 6 cajas de gaseosas, 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 cajas de leche, 1 caja de galletas, 1 paquete de golosinas, y 5 bolsas de agua en saches. Nisa está muy contenta por que también puede apoyar económicamente en su hogar, además, dado al fuerte calor en la zona pueda atender a los niños que requieran de bastante liquido para aplacar la sed. Ahora la bodega les da para los gastos del día y así no tienen ninguna dificultad de esperar hasta que llegue el esposo, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos que sin descuidar sus estudios atienden la bodega.

loans.use: Purchase of essential products

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ms. Ana Patricia, single mother of three, had a job that didn’t bring her much income in order to care for her children, so she began selling food among her neighbors in order to better provide for her children and in this way, little by little, she began her own food business and increased her income. She also took advantage of this opportunity to sell seasonal clothing to her clients. Thanks to this activity she has been able to pay for her children to attend school.

However, Ana Patricia continues to struggle in order to move her children ahead and it is for this reason that she is asking for a loan of $300 dollars to be reimbursed in a 6 month period. With this money Ana will be able to buy a stove and other items in order to offer items sold during a local holiday called “The Day of the Dead” for her clients. With your help, Ana Patricia will be able to have materials to sell and in turn pay for her children’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ana Patricia madre soltera de tres hijos, tenía un trabajo que no le dejaba muchos ingresos como para poder mantener a sus hijos así que empezó vendiendo comida entre sus vecinas para poder mantenerlos y así se estableció poco a poco como un negocio de comidas, e incrementando sus ventas y además aprovechó para ofrecer entre sus clientes ropa de temporada. Gracias a esta actividad a podido costearles hasta hoy los estudios a sus hijos.

Sin embargo Ana Patricia sigue luchando para sacar adelante a sus hijos y por lo tanto hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, Y con este dinero Ana podrá comprar una estufa y enseres para poder ofrecer el día de muertos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ana Patricia podrá tener material para vender y así poder pagar los gastos de su hijo.

loans.use: Buy a stove in order to sell more varieties of food

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroeun K. (age 28) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sroeun and her husband (age 31), have been married for eleven years and have two sons, the older of whom studies in primary school in the village.

She is requesting this, her second loan from Maxima, to prepare a second loom and to buy thread for weaving. She has been weaving, a skill she learned by apprenticing on a nearby island, since she was fifteen years old. She has since taught her husband to weave and he will use the second loom. He also works at construction, farms, and raises cows. As is almost universal for Cambodians, Sroeun’s main goal is to maintain or expand her business so she can support the studies of her children.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and to set up a second loom

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru:
Hakim U. has been selling nuts, garlic, potatoes, turnips and fruit vinegar (circo) for 28 years. He has been a MicroInvest borrower since 2002 and has shown himself to be a responsible borrower. Hakim learned about MicroInvest from a loan officer. Due to the loan he was able to increase his purchases from wholesalers and increase his profits. Sometimes he travels to Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan to purchase products.

Hakim is a family man and has 3 children. His son helps him in his business. In the future he plans to pass on his business to his son. Hakim will use his Kiva loan to expand his inventory and support his fast product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Умаров Хаким, продает орехи, чеснок, картошку, репку и фруктовый уксус. (сирко) на протяжении 28 лет.В Микроинвесте он кредитуется с 2002 года и проявил себя как ответственный плательшик. О нашей организации услышал от займового офицера.Благодаря кредитам он смог закупать больше товара у оптавиков и соответственно иметь большую прибыль. Иногда он сам ездить за товаром в Узбекистан и Киргизистан. Он человек семейный и имеет 3 детей.Сын помогает по бизнесу. В будушем он прланирует передать совй бизнес сыну. На займ с КИВЫ он хочет увеличить объём товара потомучто сейчас он имеет быстрый оборот.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Selling food is a very common business in the city of León, Nicaragua. There is a lot of competition and the great majority of places that sell food are of excellent quality. Conscious of this, Mrs. María Isabel Millón has dedicated herself to the job for the past 30 years in order to support her son. Through this work María has been able to pay for her son's schooling and his home needs.

She began the business with 4,000 córdobas (approximately $200 dollars), and she has worked with Ceprodel in order to obtain loans that have greatly benefited her locale. Through these loans María has increased her earnings and purchased raw materials in larger volume in order to make food. As of date she has repaid 14 previous loans through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de comida es un negocio muy común en la ciudad de León ya que existe mucha competencia y la gran mayoría de los lugares donde se vende la comida son de excelente calidad. Consiente de esto, la señora Maria Isabel M. se dedica desde hace 30 años a este negocio para apoyar a su hijo en las necesidades del hogar y el pago de los estudios

Inició su negocio con un capital de C$ 4000 (Cuatro mil córdobas) y ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que han beneficiado grandemente su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y adquirido mayores volúmenes de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 14 créditos con Ceprodel

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food

loans.name: Elias Jose

texts.es:
Elias P., is a 25 years old young man, who got married at a very young age and who lives with his wife and two children in Ticuantepe. To support his family, Elias works the land with his father-in-law who yielded a portion of his land sp Elias could harvest pineapple and thus to support them to do well and advance in life. As a good son-in-law, he works on his crop and supports his father-in-law, as his wife takes care of the children and the home. In order to have another source of income, Elias works with wood in a carpentry. He needs the loan to buy supplies to maintain his crop, which is important to harvest a high-quality product and therefore, ask for a better and more competitive price. A successful crop will allow him and his wife to buy school supplies for their children and some household goods for his wife and the home.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Elias P., es un joven de 25 años, que a muy temprana edad se caso y habita con su joven esposa y sus dos niños pequeños en Ticuantepe, para mantener a su familia trabaja la tierra con su suegro quien le cedió 2 manzanas de tierra para cosechar piña y así apoyarlos a salir adelante, como buen yerno trabaja su cosecha y apoya a su suegro ya que su esposa se mantiene al cuido de los niños y el hogar. Como otro ingreso trabaja con madera en una carpintería ahora necesita su préstamo para comprar insumos de mantenimiento de la cosecha que es importante para lograr un producto de alta calidad y le puedan pagar un mejor precio por su cosecha que le permitirá comprar a sus hijos los materiales escolares pendientes y algunos enseres para su esposa en la casa.

loans.use: To Buy Supplies for Crop Maintenance

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina has a tailoring business on Kampala Road that has been running for 15 years. She sits just outside in the corridors with her colleagues, where their customers meet them. She is 39 years old and married with 3 children, as she caters to her sister who is in Form 2. Her husband, a water engineer, has been a great help, mostly in those times when she did not have access to loans, but still he is supportive. She needs a loan to enable her to buy more materials for sewing that she can sell to her customers.

loans.use: Georgina needs a loan to enable her to buy more cloth material for sewing that she can sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Mariam M.. She is married and has 3 children aged 2, 7 and 15. She has 4 more dependents who live with her because they are street children. In 1996, Mariam established her café business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more kitchen utensils. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot, sticky dough, made from maize flour), a plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensil.

loans.name: Luz De Lourdes

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz lives in the "14th of February" neighborhood, is 35 years old, married, and has three children in school. Her husband works at a business as an accountant and supports the household's income needs.

Luz has a general store and also sells clothing and other articles. She has four years of experience and began with her own money. The loan that she is requesting is for cash to invest in whole grains and purchasing clothing that will fill her general store. That way, she will be able to offer her customers a wider variety of products that are useful to them. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, gaining more customers, and provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Luz habita en el barrio 14 de Febrero, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, con tres hijos que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como contador y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Luz tiene una pulpería y también vende ropa y otros, ella tiene cuatro años de experiencia y comenzó con fondos propios, con el préstamo que le otorguen es para capital de trabajo en la inversión de granos básicos y comprar ropa para tener llena la pulpería y poder ofrecer a sus clientes diversos productos obtener mas utilidad. A futuro es incrementar el negocio y captar más clientes y brindar a sus hijos estudios.

loans.use: Purchase whole grains and undergarments for her shop

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Born in 1961, Mama Beatrice was married to the late Pa Peter Zongcho.  While in her marital home, she successfully gave birth to seven children, two of whom are still below the age of fifteen years. Before she was able to access business capital, she felt incapable of assisting her husband to care for their family. These circumstances motivated her to join GHAPE in 2002. Since then, she has received and repaid five loans, totaling $550, from GHAPE.

Given a loan, she plans to buy yams and cassava seedlings for planting, and purchase fresh tomatoes and groundnuts in bulk for retail. She thinks her business will succeed because she already has a piece of land to cultivate and her many neighbors will provide a ready market for her fresh tomatoes and groundnuts. Moreover, she will help her neighbors, who previously had to trek long distances to acquire these basic commodities.       

Mama Beatrice plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: To purchase cassava and yams seedlings, fresh tomatoes and groundnuts

loans.name: Habibi's Shukrani Group

texts.en:
Habibi is 29 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children aged 12, 10, and 2. She became a tailor and juice seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Habibi now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who also has a business selling juice.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang H. was born in 1955 and she is a farmer in Svay Chuor Village in Kandal Province. She grows only cabbage in the field. Her husband, Mr. Tun Khnong, assists her on the plantation. They have five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The remaining three are attending school. Although these family members have different business activities, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Seang H. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a breeding business, and she would use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food to feed her pigs. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a breeding business and pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: La Unión Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El Grupo denominado LA UNIÓN HACE LA FUERZA; se conformó en fecha 25 de agosto de 2008, dicho grupo fue organizado gracias a que la actual Presidenta María Rossana C., quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, se acercó a la asesora en una reunión semanal que tenia la misma en la zona, para informarse de como funciona el programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. La Sra. María habló a sus vecinas y amigas y logró juntar a 15 mujeres las cuales integran hoy día este comité.

Las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de ropas, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comidas, venta de carbón, ventas de artículos de plásticos, venta de bijouteri, venta de sábanas y manteles, venta de carnes, panificados, azúcar, yerba, arroz, etc. y a la venta de artículos de mercerías como remeras, medias, lencerías, binchas, etc.

El grupo trabaja en forma conjunta, demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad. Todas las integrantes del grupo asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo.

Las actividades que desarrollan cada una se especifica a continuación: 1. María C.. Venta de ropas.

2. 2-Juana R.. Venta de comidas.

3. 3-Elodia V.. Venta de artículos de plásticos.

4. 4-Jorgelina Sánchez. Venta de bijouterie.

5. 5-Marina G.. Venta de sábanas y mantel.

6. 6-Dora F.. Despensa.

7. 7-Herminia R.. Venta de carbón y despensa.

8. 8-Antonia R.. Venta de miel y chipa.

9. 9-Nery S.. Venta de bebidas.

10. 10-Sonia D.. Venta de carne.

11. 11-María R.. Venta de frutas y verduras.

12. 12-.Diana M.. Venta de sábanas.

13. 13-Amelia T.. Venta de frutas.

14. 14-Cinthia C.. Venta de mercerías.

15. 15-María I.. Venta de comidas.
texts.en:
The group LA UNION HACE LA FUERZA was founded on August 25, 2008. It is said that the group was organized thanks to the current President Maria Rossana Cespedes, a woman with a career in selling clothes. She contacted the adviser of a nearby weekly meeting that informed people about the program called “Committee of Women Entrepreneurs”. Maria talked to her neighbors and friends and put together a group of 15 women who now make up this committee. The committee members take part in various activities such as the sale of clothing, fruits and vegetables, carbon coals, plastic products, trinkets and jewelry, sheets and blankets, meat, pastry, sugar, herbs, rice, etcetera as well as the sale of clothing like T-shirts, stockings, lingerie, hair bands, and etcetera. This group works together as a team, demonstrating camaraderie and solidarity. All of them help with the weekly meetings and with the fulfillment of duties in order to raise money for the common wellbeing of the group. The activity that each woman performs is specified as follows: 1. María C.. Sale of clothing 2. Juana R.. Sale of food. 3. Elodia V.. Sale of plastics 4. Jorgelina Sánchez. Sale of jewelry and trinkets 5. Marina G.. Sale of blankets and sheets 6. Dora F.. Household items 7. Herminia R.. Sale of carbon coals and household items. 8. Antonia R.. Sale of honey and chirpa 9. Nery S.. Sale of drinks 10. Sonia D.. Sale of meat 11. María R.. Sale of fruits and vegetables 12. Diana M.. Sale of sheets. 13. Amelia T.. Sale of fruit 14. Cinthia C.. Sale of clothing. 15. María I.. Sale of food.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, fruits and vegetables, ingredients for food preparation, plastics, jewelry and trinkets, sheets and blankets, groceries (rice, sugar, pastries, candy, herbs, meat, etc.), drinks, carbon coals, clothing (t-shirts, lingerie, wallets, hair bands, etc.)

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang H. was born in 1979 and lives in Phdao Chukiet Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children who all attend the local school. She is a poultry breeder who raises ducks. Since her ducks have recently delivered a lot of ducklings, she does not have enough money to buy enough duck food for them all. Thus she is requesting a loan to buy duck food. Her husband, Mr. Hoar Hoeurn, is a pig breeder. He is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more duck food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina H. is 40 years old. She is married and has five children who are currently in school. She has manufactured palm oil and palm kernel oil for six years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts, and palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel. These oils are used to prepare many local dishes. She produces the oils and supplies them to food vendors to prepare their meals. She normally switches her production between the two products. That is, after producing palm oil she automatically obtains the raw material to produce palm kernel oil. 

Georgina will use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine so she can produce the oils in larger quantities. She believes this increased production will augment her income so she can better provide for her family and finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called “Tumi wura” (Almighty) Trust Group. Her picture was taken at a group meeting. In this group, members provide social collateral for one another to guarantee the repayment of loans.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Chín  năm nay 38  tuổi,  gia đình chị có 3 con đang tuổi đến trường . Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại công việc đem lại  nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà và kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Chín mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng kẹo, bánh... phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Chín is 38 years old. She has three school-aged children. Mrs. Lê has been participating in TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, the family's main source of income is raising pigs, chicken and a general goods store amounting to 4,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, Mrs. Lê hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to purchase more products such as candies, snacks and other such products desired by customers for the upcoming Tết (Lunar New Year) festivities.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Groceries/General Goods Shop

loans.name: Pasos Firme Group

texts.en:
“Pasos Firme” is a group of five, all but one illiterate, entrepreneurs seeking additional loan funds from Esperanza International. The group’s past loans have been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize an additional loan for further business expansion. Luisa is the coordinator for this group in El Seybo.

Luisa, mother of a ten-year-old child, operates three notably different entrepreneurial sales. Luisa sells vegetables, cellular phone recharge cards, and gas for stove-top cooking and lamps. Recently, Luisa’s husband has fallen ill, leaving Luisa to care for her ill husband and child, and continue to work for prosperity within her business. However, Luisa is dedicated and dreams of one day owning her own home.

Other members of Luisa’s bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including selling chicken, clothing, and undergarment sales. The bank as a whole is committed to successful completion of this additional micro-finance loan and past performance demonstrates competence and commitment.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase additional materials for re-sale

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a simple wife to Nick B.. They have four children. The eldest child is 16-year-old Nicky, a first-year college student in a state university. The next child is 14-year-old Riza, a second-year student in high school. Riza is followed by 9-year-old Liezel, who is in fourth grade in elementary school. The family lives in a rural area of Sto. Tomas (part of Alicia, Isabela). They live in a small community with good road conditions. By their house, a Catholic chapel is located where Rowena’s family used to visit every Sunday for their spiritual growth.

Rowena also maintains her village store business situated in front of their house. She wants to improve more of her business. Thus, Rowena is looking forward to borrowing a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 from the lending programs of ASKI. Rowena will pay her loan on time so that she will be able to repeat the loan for her store working capital at present. Also, in the coming days, Rowena wants to be able to increase her estimated monthly income of PHP 3,000 in the business. Her estimated monthly income is not enough to sustain both her business and family’s daily needs. Also, her children’s educational needs in the future will increase.

But despite those hopes and dreams in life, Rowena believes that putting God first in everything you do is better than anything else for as said in the Bible, there is nothing impossible with Him.

loans.use: Improvement of village store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a moto

loans.name: Nawfal

texts.en:
Nawfal, a 40 year old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon, has owned a garage for twenty years. He has been working as a car painter. Nawfal does this work well. His clients are people from his region.

Nawaf decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation as well as work independently. When he first started, he had to face competition. This is the first time that Nawfal is requesting a loan. He wants to borrow $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité le commerce de chaussures, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1989 ce qui fait qu’elle maîtrise ce commerce, elle fait son activité au grand marché de Lomé. Elle fait face à une rupture de stock et souhaite se réapprovisionner. Elle s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter son premier crédit afin d’acheter 132 paires de chaussures. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, avec le revenu de son commerce elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady sells shoes. She began this business in 1989 so she is very knowledgeable. She makes her sales in the big market of Lomé. She is presently out of shoes and wants to replenish her stocks. She has come to WAGES to request her first loan so as to buy 132 pairs of shoes. She is married and the mother of 4 children. With the income from her business, she helps her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: enlarging the area she cultivates and buying fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Shafqat Younas Masih Group

texts.en:
Shafqat baji is a wife of Y. M., who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines.  Shafqat's husband is a delivery man by profession and delivers different items (fruits & vegetables).  He has 3 years of experience in this business. Shafqat baji also runs a soft-toy-making business. She makes different animals (bear, cat, and dog) from cotton. Her toys are popular with kids. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart for her husband's business.  The old cart has become rough and rotted in different areas.

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Razia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business. Najma baji wants a loan to buy supplies (wires, switch boards and switches and tube lights) for her electric shop. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy iron for her iron-rod-making business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a delivery business

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en: Alfonso P. is from the village of Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 63 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Alfonso owns and operates a business raising and selling pigs. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alfonso joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alfonso is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed for his growing pigs. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig-feed

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen K. is a widowed 53-year-old living in Pursat Province. She has six children, two of whom are single and four of whom are married.

K. earns a living by selling Khmer noodles and raising poultry. She is also a local rice farmer. She earns approximately $10 a day to support her family's living expenses from these businesses which she began in 1979. To further help meet the family's needs, two of her children are employed as electricians for a company.

Due to this coming rice-planting season, K. requested a loan of $1000 to pay for plowing the farmland as well as buying rice seed and fertilizers.

loans.use: To pay for plowing the farmland as well as buying rice seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Safiu

texts.en: Safiu is 31 years old and married with four children. He has a panel-beating shop where he repairs vehicle chassis. He is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more pan and steel for working. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pans and steel for working

loans.name: It's Group

texts.en:
These are four low-income people who are jointly requesting a group loan. One of them, It N., is 31. She was  selected to be the leader by the other members. She owns an old medium-sized  boat that she and her husband use to fish. The family always wakes up when the sky is still dark in order to prepare their equipment to fish in and around the Tunle Sap River, which is the best place to catch fish. It N. said that she tries to work hard and never wastes time at her business activities, but unfortunately she recently had to face the fact that some of her fishing equipment was ruined. Because of that obstacle, It N. is requesting a loan to repair her equipment and to buy more essential tools. The family has four school-aged children and they also help with fishing when they are not studying. The other borrowers are:
Chat T., a fisherman, who asking for a loan to add to his saving, so that he can build a new small house; 
Leng O., who will be using the loan to repair and decorate her old house; and 
Leng H., who requests a loan to enlarge her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To repair and buy more essential tools

loans.name: La Fe 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yaquelin is an experienced businesswoman who has been plying her traD. selling clothing (including pants, shirts and hair accessories) and beauty products for five years. Yaquelin is the group coordinator of the Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) L. Fe (The Faith) based in a small community of sugar cane cutters (called a batey) outsiD. L. Romana. Here she lives with her five children, ages 10, 8, 5, 3, and nine months. She is raising her children alone as a single mother. In this community, there is no access to electricity, running water or trash pickup.

Yaquelin's plan with this loan is to increase her stock by purchasing more merchandise at a better price. This is her third loan with Esperanza, and both she and the organization are confident in her abilities as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy pants, creams, polo shirts, T-shirts and ponytail holders

loans.name: Rechael Githua

texts.en:
Rechael Githua is 28 years old. She is married and a mother of one child. 

She has a mobile-phone shop that she has been running for the last four years on a busy street in Narok Town.

She learned about KADET from other women who were already registered as clients. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to use to increase her stock of mobile phones, accessories and other electronic goods. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. She would also like to open up an M-pesa (mobile money transfer) business.

Her future dream is that she will be able to build her own house. Rachael believes that she is hardworking and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buying more mobile phones, phone accessories and other electronic goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foam padding and cloth

loans.name: Venerada

texts.es:
Veneranda es una mujer luchadora, a sus 45 años siempre piensa proyectándose para un futuro mejor. Vive con su esposo (Edmundo), de 45 años, y sus hijos Emily de 21 y Eder de 20 años en su casa propia.

Ella se levanta desde muy temprano para atender a su familia y durante la tarde empieza la preparación de sus salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas), para ofrecerlas a sus habituales comensales. Venerando vende este platillo en un carrito salchipapero que saca afuera de su casa y por la exquisitez de su comida es muy conocida en su vecindario, además a ella le gusta su negocio porque es rentable y las salchipapas son de fácil preparación. 

Para el futuro quiere tener un restaurante de comida en su casa, pues es bastante amplia y ya está pensando dónde podría ir ubicado todo. Esta emprendedora señora también tiene un negocio de venta de discos musicales y día a día se las ingenia para salir adelante 

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y promete ser responsable, como siempre, con todos sus pagos; además está muy conforme con su trabajo en su banco comunal, pues todos se conocen y son puntuales.

Para hacer realidad su sueño del restaurante, Veneranda invertirá el dinero que solicita en implementar su casa y para eso empezará por el acabado del piso y la compra de algunos muebles para poner los CDs que vende.
texts.en:
Veneranda is a hard-working woman who, at 45 years of age, always is thinking of a better future. She lives in her own home with her husband , Edmundo, who is 45 years old, and their two children, Emily, 21, and Eder, 20. She starts her day very early in the morning seeing to her family and in the afternoon she prepares salchipapas (which is a dish made of potatoes and fried sausage) for her regular customers. Veneranda sells this dish from a vending cart which she puts outside her home and, thanks to the tastiness of her meals, she is very well-known in her neighborhood. Besides, she likes her work because she makes good profits and the dishes are easy to prepare. For the future, she would like to have a restaurant in her home since it is quite roomy and she is thinking that she could site the entire operation at home. This enterprising woman also sells records and daily looks for ways to get ahead. This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to be responsible, as usual, with all her repayments. Also, she is very happy with her work with the communal bank since all members know each other and are punctual. To make her restaurant dream come true, Veneranda will invest these funds in refitting her house beginning with new flooring and some new furniture to display the CDs she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her future restaurant.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is the kind and devoted father of two children. He is a farmer and also operates a tricycle passenger service in his village of San Pedro, Roxas, Isabela. As the breadwinner for his family, he does his best to maintain good family relationships. He does not want his family to feel hungry and that is why he pushes himself to work hard and double his time. His dreams are for his family to have good health and a good future.

Noel is very concerned about his children’s education. He wants them to finish their education and have a successful future. Noel's wife takes care of their children and manages the family's wellbeing. As a father, Noel worries about his family's future. His tricycle does not provide a good quality ride all the time. Therefore Noel is kindly requesting the amount of 6,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of his tricycle to make it more comfortable to ride.

loans.use: To repair and maintain his tricycle

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun L. is a villager in Thkov village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sek Theara, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, they also raise pigs.

Since this pig business is going well, they want to expend it. Thus, Mr. Saroeun L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase four more piglets to raise. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family’s standard of living with this loan.

Mr. Saroeun L. is the father of five children, three of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase four more piglets

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi B. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Tangal is one of the busy bazaars of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in handicraft work.
Mrs. Laxmi lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Both her sons are now studying as well as working.
Both Mrs. B. and Mr. B. are engaged in wood carving work. They carve different types of wooden goods. They run their house with the income from their wood carving work.
Now Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of Rs 10,000.00 to buy wood and tools to use in their wood carving work.

loans.use: To buy wood and tools

loans.name: Sama

texts.en:
Sama E. is currently in the business of selling food, beer and sodas in a hotel and is requesting a loan to buy Jerry cans of cooking oil and tomatoes to sell.

Sama is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a carpenter. She has 5 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up another hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy Jerry cans of cooking oil and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu J. is currently in the business of selling fruit and vegetables in the market. She is requesting a loan to buy jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  Dudu is 32 years old. She is married and her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a retail shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is married and the mother of one child; she is twenty-five years old. She lives with her child in a town called Moore in the central region of Ghana. She enjoys commerce and has been selling foodstuffs for over four years in the town where she lives. She sells food items like beans, maize, groundnuts and others. She buys her goods from the farmers in her locality and the surrounding towns. She sells to the people of her locality, most of whom are food vendors. She says she desires to buy the goods in bulk so that she can reach a larger share of the market by trekking to markets in nearby towns. This she says is only possible by increasing her working capital. Basically, this is what she aspires to use the loan for.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, maize, groundnuts, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Zakia Afghan Group

texts.en:
This is the Zakia Afghan Group. Hooma is the loan group leader. This group has four members who are engaged in different businesses. They requested a group loan of 42000 Afghani to complete their inventories. 

Hooma wants a loan for her husband, who has a general store. With this loan, he wants to buy some things like pens, notebooks, and pencils. The second member of Zakia Afghan group is Froozan, who wants to take a loan for her brother, who has a general store. With this loan, he wants to buy more necessary things for his shop. The third member is Laila, who has a beauty salon. With this loan, she wants to buy more cosmetics and other necessary things for her beauty salon. The last member is Zakia, who is a tailor. With this loan, she wants to complete her inventory. 

They would like to thank from all lenders and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pens, notebooks, and pencils for her husband's general store

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie M. is from the town of Alicia, Isabela. She is thirty-seven years old. Gerlie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gerlie owns and operates a service-based business in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing electrical repairs and installing Internet in the local community. Gerlie has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gerlie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerlie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This will be Gerlie's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide her service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers and underclothes for sale.

loans.name: Sisifo

texts.en:
Sisifo F. is 37 and married with 4 children (ages -month - 14).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting cocoa for sale.  Sisifo has 3 years of experience in this business.  Sisifo needs a loan of WST $2200 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Sisifo joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sisifo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sisifo F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 30-year-old married father with one child. He has run a green-grocer shop since 2002. He and his wife work hard to provide for their family. He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standard in the future. John has requested a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena, 28, is into corn farming business. She started her business way back in 2005.  She is now managing a 1/2-hectare corn field in Banga, South Cotabato.  She loves her work in the farm.  She is the mother of a 6-year-old child.  She strives hard in order to provide the basic needs of the family.

She requested a loan of 5,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help in financing her farm.  With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wool,cloth and raw materials for handicrafts

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto. She is 38 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid 6 previous loans  from PMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. Mercy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., 41, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. She and her husband buy recyclable materials to sell for an income of USD 2 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 150 to purchase fish to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fish to raise for sale

loans.name: Dev Maya

texts.en:
Dev Maya D. lives in Chappagaun village with her husband and three children. Her husband's name is Mr. Ramhari D. and he is a farmer. Most of the people in this region are dependent on agriculture and farming. 

Mrs. D. does handicraft work making different types of traditional sandals out of thick cloth. Most of the people in Nepal use these types of sandals in their kitchens and also in wedding ceremonies. She has four years of experience. Mostly people use these sandals in the winter season. 

She sells her products in Asan Market which is one of the very busy bazaars in Kathmandu. Mrs. D. is requesting a Rs 20,000.00 loan to buy the raw materials needed for her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Chan Meak's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Meak K. is 40 years old and is the leader of a group loan, having been selected by its four members located in Preak Ta Pring village, Kandal province. With the loans, the members of this group will support their different purposes.
 
Mrs. Chan Meak K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetable for a living. Her husband, Mr. Than Chhieng, is a vegetable seller in the local market who is able to earn a small income to support his family's living costs. In order to support the farm, Mrs. Chan Meak K. will use the loan she has requested from AMK to buy fertilizer to cultivate vegetables. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy more vegetables to support her husband's business. This couple has four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other three are students and also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate vegetables.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is single and has one child in school. Joice has had a business of selling phone airtime and phone charging for less than one year. To help expand her business, Joice is requesting a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more airtime to sell and chargers to use. Joice plans to use the loan in order to purchase inventory she was lacking, and generate profit in order to help her child. In the future, Joice hopes to develop her business further. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more phone airtime

loans.name: Jemila

texts.en: Jemila A. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables such as cabbages, dodo (plantain), okra and tomatoes at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock fruits such as oranges, guava, etc. to sell. Jemila is 45 years old and is married, with a husband who is an electrician. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

loans.use: To stock fruits such as oranges, guava, etc. to sell

loans.name: Kyogaya Womens Group - Jinja

texts.en: Anna I.’s business occupation for the last 10 years has been animal husbandry, principally rearing cows, goats and poultry.  She operates in Namulesa, Jinja.  She envisages a situation where her weekly profits of 180,000 shillings will be increased if she gets this loan.  She plans on buying more goats, cows and poultry to resell. She also intends to pay for the construction costs of a poultry house she is planning on building.  Anna, 50, a happily-married mother of four school-going children, says constant livestock and poultry diseases have often played havoc with her businesses. Anna was working as an accounts income tax clerk before she took root in this business.  Over the course of time in the future, she is planning on purchasing a Friesian cow that she hopes will produce enough milk for her to sell and get much more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more goats, cows and poultry and pay for a poultry house.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol tiene 23 años, vive con su pequeña hija en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, de la marca más reconocida en el mercado, por lo que es ofrecida a sus clientes por medio de catálogos y muestras. Además el trato que brinda a su clientela es personalizada, ya que siempre los visita a su casa o centro de trabajo, eso le da mucha ventaja para vender sus productos, luego ya realiza los respectivo cobros de acuerdo al tiempo convenido que tuvieron. Le agrada trabajar  en su negocio porque le permite tener las ganancias que necesita para mantener a su hija, sin embargo corre el riesgo de de vender su mercadería a personas que no pagan. Su mayor anhelo es tener un stand de ventas, donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y más servicios como un locutorio, o un estudio de fotografía. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y perfumes ya que al por mayor se están ofertando a un precio bajo, asimismo desea comprar una cámara fotográfica para incursionar en el negocio del servicio de fotografía.
texts.en:
Marisol is 23 years old and lives with her young daughter at her parents’ house. For the past three years she’s been selling a well-known brand of beauty products through catalogs and samples. She offers personalized service to her customers and visits them in their homes or places of work. This gives her a great advantage in her sales. She then collects payment according to the agreed upon terms. She likes working in her business because it allows her to have the income she needs to support her daughter, but she still risks selling to people who will not make their payments. Her greatest desire is to have a stand where she can offer a greater amount of products and more services, such as announcements or photography. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support, now that they know that she is responsible with her payments. She is also happy to be part of a communal bank because she knows all of the members and they are all united and responsible people. She is also grateful to those who make this loan possible, which will be very helpful to her business. She will use the money from this loan to invest in cosmetics and perfumes, because they are being offered at a lower price when purchased in quantity. She also wants to buy a camera so that she can begin her photography business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: María tiene 20 años de edad, ellas es una joven muy emprededora, inicio su negocio hace ya 2 años con un pequeño capital obtenido por sus trabajos anteriores como obrera de planta, este negocio le genera buenos ingresos que le sirven para solventar sus gastos de la casa, ella tiene un hijo que esta aún muy pequeño no se encuentra en edad escolar, es por eso que ella sueña con poder darle lo mejor a su menor hijo y asi salir adelante con su esfuerzo, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderia para incrementar su negocio u tener aún mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 20-year-old, very enterprising, young woman who began her business some 2 years ago with a small amount of capital accumulated from her previous work in a plant.  The business generates good income that serves to cover household costs.

Maria has a son who is still very small, not yet of school age.  For this reason, she dreams of being able to offer the best to her minor child and thus, to get ahead by her own efforts.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and expand her business in order to have even greater earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam is 53 years old, married and the father of two daughters. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in ger a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter Otgonsukh is a beautician at soyol beauty salon. His wife operates a  grocery store on their plot of land.

He started his taxi business in 2007 then purchased another taxi to rent for  10.000 MNT per day.  His family is the most important thing for him and he says, "as a father, I would like to buy a ger(a traditional nomadic tent) for my oldest daughter, Otgonsukh.

He is very hardworking and energetic person and is requesting 1.200.000 MNT to purchase a ger for his beloved daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a ger for his eldest daughter.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin P. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 29 years old. Edwin is married and has three young children. To make a living, Edwin operates a fishing business.The main source of income for the business comes from gathering and selling seaweed to the market.

Edwin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwin has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Edwin is requesting a new loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase an engine for a fishing boat. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase an engine for a fishing boat

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a citizen of a city called Pakpattan in Pakistan. She is a talented lady who owns & operates an embroidery business to financially support her family. She is very creative in her work and crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes. She has a good number of clients in her neighborhood who give her regular orders. 

Her husband, M. B., is a daily wage laborer. Safia has a 3-year-old daughter, who has not yet started to attend school.  Safia’s uncle also lives with them, and he runs a "cold drink corner" in the market. He offers his customers different cold drinks like Pepsi, Coke and fresh juices. Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her uncle’s business. He will utilize the loan money in purchasing cold drinks and juices of different varieties to sell to his customers. He has been in this business for the past 8 years and Safia is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for him and will bring in more profits as a result. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks and juices for "cold drink corner"

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites D. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Marites is married and has 2 school-age children.
