To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 28-year-old married woman with one child.  They live in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a permanent rented house.  She has a desire to own a house in the next six years.  She runs a retail shop and her business dream is to become a wholesale trader.   Ruth wants a loan to buy more soft drinks, salt, sugar, and other general merchandise.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, salt, sugar, and other general merchandise

loans.name: Sjemi

texts.en:
Sjemi is aged 42 years. She lives in Maupoli Village, Oebobo Subdistrict - Kupang District. Sjemi is married and has 4 children: Margito (married), Febrianto (first grade of junior high school), Feby (sixth grade of elementary school) and Julio (fourth grade of elementary school). Sjemi’s husband, Dominggus, works as a pig breeder but they can not rely on his income as his income from pigs breeding is unstable. 

Prior to running food stall business, Sjemi sold vegetables at her house. Sjemi initiated her business as a vegetable trader to help her husband in providing for their life needs and the educational needs of their children. However, the income from the business was not sufficient to meet their needs. She tried to find loans to run a food stall business and then she got information from her neighbor that she could apply for the group loan from TLM. 
She was happy when TLM approved her loan application. 

Sjemi has joined the group lending program for 4 cycles. She spent the loan money to rent a business place in Inpres Market and bought rice and raw materials such as flavors, vegetables, meat, etc. She started the food stall business by selling yellow rice and side dishes. Sjemi plans to improve her business as her current business is running well and she has many customers. She would like to request an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000.

She plans to buy more food stall equipment such as plates, glasses, chairs and tables and some cooking flavors. She also wants to buy a young pig to be fattened for her husband's business. Sjemi expects TLM will give her an opportunity to get this individual loan so she can improve her business and her living standard as well.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and food stall equipment.

loans.name: María Vilma

texts.es: María Vilma C. P. de 34 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a sus cinco hijos, todos menores de edad. María vive junto a su esposo e hijos en  el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el centro de San Salvador, en donde desde hace 12 años que se dedica a vender estos productos, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio, cargando todos los objetos pesados y así mismo a atender a sus clientes, los cuales son varios. María solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de poder aumentar la cantidad de frutas y verduras, ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Vilma C. P. is 34 years old.  She is a very hard-working person who is fully committed to her business.  Her sole desire is to get ahead in life and, in this way, provide her five dependent children with a better life.

María lives with her husband and children in San Salvador department.  She owns a fruit and veg stall in the center of San Salvador where she has been selling her products for 12 years.  Her husband helps her with the business, loading heavy objects and serving her many customers.

María is requesting a loan from Integral as she would like to increase her quantity of fruit and vegetables as this will enable her to sell more which is her priority since, in this way, she can provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: To buy fruit and veg wholesale

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de 6 de agosto, de la ciudad de El Alto, tiene un hijo, la señora es comerciante realiza mantas las cuales las comercializa por las diferentes ferias de  la ciudad de El Alto, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen.
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una máquina de coser para realizar su labor de forma más rápida y efectiva. La señora se encuentra satisfecha con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Lidia lives in her parents' home in '6 de Agosto' district, in the city of El Alto.  She has one son.  Lidia is a saleswoman.  She makes blankets and sells them in the markets of El Alto.  She uses the profits that she makes to support herself and her son.

Lidia will use this loan to buy a sewing machine so that she can carry out her work more quickly and efficiently.  She is satisfied with the loans that we have given her.  Her record qualifies her to obtain a new loan and she is considered a good client.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her business making blankets

loans.name: Mariyln

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: buying and selling nipa, running a general store, and operating a fish pond business. Her husband Francisco, who is 61 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 3 children who are between 31 to 36 years old. 

Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29500, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials and stock her general store so that she can continue to save to repair her fish pond and operate that business. Marilyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To stock general store

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Джалолова Шафоат проживает в районе Яван. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем, имеет 6 детей. Её муж занимается торговлей. Сама Шафоат имеет среднее образование. Она рядом с домом открыла магазин, где продает продукты питания и нужные вещи для хозяйства. То есть у нее магазин со смешенным ассортиментом. В этой области она уже шесть лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Shafoat D. lives in the Yavan Region. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a vendor. Shafoat has secondary education. She has opened a store near her house, where she sells groceries and everyday household goods. That is to say she has a store offering miscellaneous wares. She has been in this business for six years. She is taking out a loan to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Tuzanyumwete Group

texts.fr:
Perpétue M. est une commerçante âgée de 40 ans qui habite  la commune urbaine de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de détails comme les habits (pagnes pour dames) mais aussi des produits alimentaires comme le lait depuis 6 ans. Elle a fait ses études secondaires techniques d’administration avec un diplôme A2 . Elle est mariée a Jonas Minani ,un Consultant dans l’enseignement des métiers, et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 4 sont a l’école. Elle   arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant beaucoup de pagnes pour dames mais aussi diversifier son business en y apportant les produits de boutique dans l’espoir de réaliser de grandes épargnes et ainsi accroitre son business. Elle espère  atteindre le niveau d’une grande commerçante dans l’avenir

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Tuzanyumwete».
texts.en:
Perpétue M. is a 40 year-old shopkeeper who lives in the Kanyosha commune in the municipality of Bujumbura. For six years she has sold items such as dresses (wax cloth robes for women) and also food products such as milk. She achieved the A2 level of secondary education. She is married to Jonas Minani, a skill training consultant, and they have six children together, four of whom attend school. Perpétue is on her fourth loan with the Turame credit association. 

She is seeking a Kiva loan in order to grow her capital by purchasing many wax cloths for women, and by diversifying her business with the aim of putting some savings aside and growing her business. She would like to become a prominent shopkeeper in the future. 

She is a member of the Tuzanyumwete group.

loans.use: to boost her capital by purchasing ladies' pagnes (wax cloth robes), and also to diversify her business

loans.name: Ana Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada hace 11 años y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 8 y 6 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es reciclador.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de material reciclable, compran cartón, hierro, aluminio, plásticos, entre  otros materiales que las empresas recicladoras compran. Trabajan todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 19h00, ellos compra el producto a los recicladores que llegan hasta su casa, para luego venderlos al por mayor a comerciantes los cuales venden a las fabricas recicladoras en Manta.

Este crédito es para comprar más material reciclable como cartón, bronce, hierro entre otros. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace dos ciclos y le gusta todo del banco ya que no le importa a que se dediquen siempre que sea para producir y por el bienestar de los socios.

Su sueño es tener un carro para llevar los productos a Manta directamente.
texts.en:
The San Juan community bank meets every 15 days in the San Juan neighborhood of Manta.  The Ecuadorean city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches and is much visited by both local and foreign tourists at all times of the year.  Most local people earn a living from fishing and other related occupations.  

Our member, Ana, is 35 years old.  She has been married for 11 years and has three children who are 11-, 8- and 6-years old, respectively.  All the children are in school.  

Ana and her husband makes a living from buying and selling recyclables.  They work together, buying recyclable materials--cardboard, scrap metal, aluminum, plastics, etc.--that are ultimately purchased by companies that buy recyclables.  Ana and her husband work every day from 9:00am to 7:00pm.  They buy recyclables locally and deliver what the collect, in bulk, to merchants who sell the materials on to the companies.  

Ana will use this loan to buy recyclable materials--cardboard, scrap metal, etc.--for her business.  She has been a member of the community bank for two funding rounds.  She likes her bank because they don't care how someone makes a living, just that they do something productive and to the credit of all the bank's members.  

Ana's dream is buy a car (or, possibly, cart) that she can use to deliver the materials she collects directly to the recycling companies.

loans.use: to buy paper, scrap metal, etc. for recycling business

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is comprised of four people who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family’s standard of living. The group leader, Mrs. Touch, was selected by the other members. 

Mrs. Touch was born in 1957 and is a widow with three children. Two of her children are seamstresses in garment factories and the youngest is a student. Mrs. Touch sells Khmer cheese to earn a profit and support her family. Her business is doing well and she would like to expand. Therefore, Mrs. Touch is requesting a loan to buy more Khmer cheese to sell.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella vende papa en el mercado de San Sebastian, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LOS ANGELES", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Gregoria, age 28, is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling potatoes.  She sell them in the San Sebastian market where she works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Through her business she has been able to care for her children.  She wants to increase her potato sales and plans to use the loan to buy wholesale potatoes.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale potatoes

loans.name: Nafore Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Naforé est créé le 15 Novembre 2006 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Les membres ont des liens de parenté. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ndoumbé D. (debout en deuxième position à partir de la gauche sur photo, et mise en médaillon en bas et à droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et  mère de deux enfants. 

Elle vend des légumes et divers produits à domicile et au marché. Elle a  une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant environs dix ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra  de financer son activité de petit commerce de légumes.

Elle désire soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge sanitaire et alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
The Naforé group was created on November 15, 2006 upon the inauguration of the Banc Villageois. It is composed of ten women, all from the same neighborhood. The group members share family ties. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs. Ndoumbé D. (standing second from the left in the photo, and shown inset at the bottom right) is the group leader. She is 59 years old, married, and the mother of two children.

She sells vegetables and various items both from her home and at the market. With ten years of experience, she has a good command of her activity. 

This new loan will help to bolster her small business of vegetable sales. She wants to help her husband to provide food and health care for their family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale

loans.name: Sovanara

texts.en:
Sovanara, 35 years old, is married and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  Sovanara sells food, earning an income of $3 per day that helps cover her family's expenses. Her husband is a musician and rents speakers for parties, earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Sovanara and her husband started their businesses. 

Sovanara requests a loan of $500 to purchase musical instruments to start a new business with her musical group.  This loan is her second from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments to start a new business.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel tiene 41 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos son 6 que todos son menores de edad, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir trabajando.

Le gusta bailar en las fiesta sdel recinto.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel is 41 years old.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and their children.  They have six children, and they are all minors.  He lives in the Ventanas Cantón in the Los Ríos province. 

The members of the Señor de la Salud Communal Bank live in the Soloma precinct in the Echeandia Canton.  This communal bank grows short cycle corn and rice.

Segundo grows corn and rice.  He buys supplies in Ventanas and sells his products at the daily markets, especially the Sunday market. 

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure.  The support of the loan will help him financially so that he will have his necessities.  He faces challenges like insect infestations, crop diseases, and climate changes.  

His dream is to buy a piece of land to continue working.

He likes to dance at the precinct festivals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Mercedita provides habal-habal services. (Habal-habal is a motorcycle with extended seating for two to six passengers.) Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Mercedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mercedita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the habal-habal service.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana Lucia, es casada, tiene 20 años D. edad, aun no tiene hijos, se dedica a la crianza D. animales y al comercio a la venta D. ropas, inicio este negocio cuando contaba con un pequeño capital y hasta ahora lleva 5 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR para la compra D. mercaderías: suéteres, playeras, chumpas, bufandas, blusas, etc, y así poder contar con más variedad D. ventas, y cumplir con su sueño D. ver un negocio mejor y más surtido. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la producción agrícola y al comercio.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Lucia is married, 20 years old, and does not have any children yet. She raises animals and sells clothing. She started her business once she had a little capital, and now she has five years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who works in traD..

She decided to organize a group to request a loan through ASDIR, in order to purchase merchandise: sweaters, t-shirts, jackets, scarves, blouses, etc. This way, she can have a greater variety to sell and can achieve her dream of seeing her business improve and diversify. The other group members work in agriculture and traD..

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Melinda works hard to support her family. She has a personal products sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Melinda is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy additional products such as perfumes, body lotion etc. to sell.
Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as perfumes, body lotion etc. to sell.

loans.name: Biter Oscar

texts.en: Biter lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras where he earns a living by running a small general store. His wife helps him run the shop during the day, which allows him to earn extra income by taking to the road to sell vegetables. He is applying for a loan for Lps. 15,000 to buy additional merchandise to sell in his store.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, candy, beans, rice, eggs, cooking oil, cleaning products and other items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es:
María Emperatriz tiene 54 años, Es viuda vive con el hijo de catorce años de edad, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es poder viajar.

En su tiempo libre le gusta compartir con la familia salir de paseo, le gusta las fiestas del Catón ventans, se considera una persona emprendedora y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old. She is a widow with a 14-year-old son. She lives in the Cantón of Ventanas in the Province of Los Rios. 
The members of the “V.R.C. Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) live in the precinct of “Jesús Del Gran Poder” (Jesús, The Great Power), which is in the Cantón of Ventanas (Windows). This area is an agricultural zone that has a short growing season. They grow corn, rice and beans.
María works as a farmer and grows corn, rice and beans. She buys her products in the commercial zone of Ventanas and she sells her products in the wholesale market in Ventanas.
She is requesting this loan in order to grow corn, rice and beans. She would like to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicides, urea, organic fertilizers and corn, bean and rice seeds. With the economic assistance from this loan she can provide for the necessities of her family. She will be able to confront the challenges of plagues and diseases that affect her crops. Her dream is to travel.
In her free time she likes to go out with her family. She likes the fiestas in the Ventanas Canton. Maria is considered a hardworking and enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the leader of this group. She is 48 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has a daughter, who is sixteen and studies at school. Seven years ago with an initial investment of 40,000 soms the family started to breed cattle. They earn their livelihood by reselling cattle after fattening; the monthly profit from this activity is about 5,000 soms. With money received from the loan, Gulmira wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from cattle breeding, she wants to save money for purchasing a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Denis Alexander

texts.es:
Denis, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 6 años de edad, se  dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, desde hace 15 años, aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días, de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Él solicita nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de abonos y herbicidas, pues se dispone a sembrar maíz y frijol, este préstamo le ayudara a obtener todo lo necesario para realizar la siembra y prevenirla de algunos de los riesgos de plagas.
Su propósito es que a través de su trabajo puedan mejorar los ingresos del hogar y la alimentación.
texts.en:
Denis lives with his wife and 6 year old child, and has been growing corn and beans for 15 years, learning from his father, working every day from 6:00AM until 3:00PM.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and herbicides, and as he is preparing to plant corn and beans, this loan will help him get everything he needs for planting, and for preventing some of the risks of pests.

His goal is to improve the household income and nutrition through his hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Berawan Salak Permai Group

texts.en:
The Berawan Salak Permai group received another loan from MUK for Rp 15,000,000. Each of the 10 members gets Rp 1,500,000. These loans are used to support their efforts at raising pigs.

Ni Kadek used this loan to buy two superior quality piglets for fattening. The price today is Rp 450,000 per piglet. The remainder of the loan was used to buy feed. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Kadek is feeding with traditional foods made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves. Ni Kadek pursues this effort to support the family economy, particularly the cost of education for her two children.

loans.use: To buy two superior quality piglets

loans.name: Guy Roland

texts.fr:
Client de 43 ans,célibataire avec 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9 et 19 ans, a l’arrêt de ses études au lycée par manque de moyens, il se lance dans le commerce de la friperie.
Il achète des ballots de friperie de fin de séries, des tenues non portées qu'il va acheter a Kinshasa et parfois dans les dépôts de la place.
Étant a sa quatrième cycle de prêt, il a rembourse avec succès et a eu a faire des épargnes considérables.
Ses ventes ont considérablement augmentées , en moyenne, il a des revenus de 30000 fr a 90000 fr par jour.
Avec le nouveau prêt , il va acheter  des ballots de jupes, des bodies, des chemises  et des pantalons.
Il a fait des bénéfices énormes, et il veut a la longue ouvrir une boutique de prêts a porter.
texts.en:
This client is 43 years old, single, and has three children who are between 9 and 19 years old.  He stopped studying at high school level, owing to a lack of money, and started selling second-hand clothing.

He buys his bundles of second-hand clothes, discontinued lines and unworn clothes in Kinshasa and sometimes in local warehouses.

This is the borrower's fourth loan cycle.  He has successfully repaid his previous loans and has built up substantial savings.  His sales have increased significantly.  He makes, on average, between 30,000 and 90,000 francs a day.

With this new loan, the borrower will buy bundles of skirts, all-in-ones, shirts and pants.  He has made very good profits and, in the long term, he would like to open a store selling off-the-rack clothes.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to providing the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a leso (kanga) selling business for the past three years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of transport charges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop for selling lesos.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase more lesos and boost her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its flexible policies, which favor client’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase more lesos

loans.name: Popoteke Group

texts.en:
Maves is 48 years old, married, and has three children aged 16, 19 and 23. All her three children attend school. Her spouse is a retired soldier. 

For the last ten years, Maves has been in a retail business, selling clothes in Masvingo. Although there is high market demand, her challenge is inadequate capital to fully meet that demand.

Maves has applied for $4OO to purchase clothes for resale. The profit realized from her business will enable her to provide her household needs and improve her standard of living.

In future she plans to have many branches nationwide, creating jobs for others.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the roof.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Pascuala vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Pascuala tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio pero también se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Ya son varios años que se dedica a los negocios y le va muy bien. Pascuala requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras. 

Pascuala se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Pascuala belongs to the communal bank "Las Palmeras," in the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  Pascuala lives in the city of Cusco, and this is also where she is developing her economic activities.

Pascuala has a grocery store in her home, but she also sells vegetables and fruit in the city of Puerto Maldonado.  She has had these businesses for a number of years, and they are going very well. Pascuala needs a loan to buy fruit and vegetables.

Pascuala is grateful for the opportunity that is being provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 39 years old, married and has three children. Fernando dreams of lifting his family out of poverty, so he devotes himself to his farm where he plants and harvests rice which he sells. He earned PHP 15,000 from his last crop. He has also had a hog-raising business for the past three years, and earns PHP 3,000 for each piglet. He is thankful because with the income he generates from his businesses he is able to continue sending his children to school.

Fernando wants to take a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer. He says that he is working tirelessly in order to attain his dream and save money to further grow his business.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdon

texts.es: Abdón, de 50 años de edad, casado con vaciliza de 49 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia. Ubicado en la comunidad de Periavente alta. Abdón es una persona dedicado a la agricultura quien se siente orgulloso al ver que sus plantaciones de cacao producen constantemente, todo esto gracias a la dedicación y empeño  que le pone en sus cultivos. Abdón desde joven estuvo insertado en las labores agrícolas ya que sus progenitores siempre se han dedicado a esta actividad; pues fueron ellos quienes le incentivaron a las labores agrícolas de la que  Abdón agradece de todo corazón por todo lo aprendido de sus padres. Cuando Abdón empezó a dedicarse a sembrar cacao, esas épocas la enfermedad de la moniliasis abundaba en todo el vrae que no les permitía a los agricultores producir un producto de calidad, con el pasar los años los agricultores empezaron a erradicar esta plaga realizando un mantenimiento adecuado en sus parcelas, fue de esta manera que Abdón le puso frente a dichas plagas que aquejaban a su cultivo de cacao. En la actualidad Abdón es un productor potencial del cacao por lo que está orgulloso de haber logrado muchos beneficios económicos para su querida familia. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que Abdón se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que lo ayuden a sacar la maleza.
texts.en:
Abdón, 50, is married to Vaciliza, 49, and they have four children; they own their house located in the community of Periavente Alta.  Abdón is a person dedicated to farming that is proud to see his cocoa bean crops constantly producing thanks to the dedication and effort he puts into them.

Since his youth Abdón has been working in agricultural occupations since his ancestors have always been in this line of work and they started the farming that Abdón thanks his parents from the bottom of his heart for having taught him.  

When Abdón started to dedicate himself to cocoa bean farming during that time the illness of monoliasis [thrush-like fungal infection] was rampant throughout the valley and this kept farmers from producing high quality product.  As time went by farmers succeeded in eradicating this infestation by providing adequate maintenance to their fields and this is how Abdón got the upper hand on the infestations that were attacking his cocoa bean crops.  Currently, Adbón is a potential cocoa bean producer and he’s proud to have attained these economic benefits for his beloved family.

This will be his first MFP loan and Abdón promises to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the 2000 new soles to hire day laborers to help him remove weeds.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Kely Johana

texts.es: Leidy es una joven quien a sus 19 años de edad ya es madre de un bebe de apenas tres meses de nacido, con el animo de brindarle a su hijo todo lo necesario, la joven Leidy inicia con su propio negocio de venta de mercancía por catalogo tal como perfumes y lociones corporales desde hace aproximadamente un año y medio gracias a un familiar quien le enseño todo lo relacionado con esta actividad. Con el animo de mejorar sus ventas y con estas conseguir los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento familiar, la joven Leidy requiere de la compra de mercancía para ofrecer un mejor surtido a sus clientes. El sueño de la joven Leidy es ver crecer a su hijo y tener su propio almacén en un centro comercial reconocido de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Leidy is a young woman who at 19 years of age is a mother of a baby just barely three months old. 

With the intent of giving her child everything it needs, young Leidy is beginning her own business selling merchandise from a catalog such as perfumes and body lotions. A relative taught her everything about this activity about 1-1/2 years ago. 

With the objective of improving her sales and securing the necessary income for supporting her family, young Leidy needs to buy merchandise to have a better display for her customers. 

The dream that Leidy has is to watch her child grow up and to have her own shop in a well known mall in the city.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and body lotions

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика занимается торговлей продуктов питания оптом. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Malika sells food products in bulk.  She is 29 years old and married.  She hast two children.  She is requesting a loan in order to increase her range of merchandise.

loans.use: To increase her range of merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un luchador, el vive en la ciudad	de Camaná, Perú, un oasis en el otro modo de largo y seco desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad, destruido la industria del turismo en Camaná, y costando muchos de sus puestos de trabajo, los medios de subsistencia, y los hogares, asimismo Camaná tienen unas hermosas playas ya que solo mirarlas uno se enamoraría  y les gustaría vivir allí; como el Perú es muy conocido por su exquisita gastronomía y uno de los platillos que más le gusta a Luis es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”, Luis solo estudio hasta el quinto año de secundario por diversos problemas económicos de sus padres, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía ya que a el le encanta cocinar, nos comenta que le gusta comprar libros de cocina para aprender recetas nuevas.

Luis trabaja en su negocio de elaboración y venta de kekes (tortas pequeñas), se levanta muy temprano, desde las 3 de la mañana el esta preparando sus productos porque el dice al que madruga Dios lo ayuda, aproximadamente le dedica a su negocio 8 horas, en un día puede ganar hasta S/.50 pero en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/. 80, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque cada dia se esfuerza mucho por elaborar bien sus productos y porque sus clientes se sienten a gusto con su labor.

Luis agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva porque con su gran apoyo el podrá comprar más utensilios para la elaboración de sus productos con esta mejora el podrá tener mayores ingresos lo que le permitirá seguir ahorrando para que más adelante puede cumplir uno de sus grandes sueños:”comprar un local para la venta de sus productos”
texts.en:
Luis is a fighter. He lives in the city of Camana, Peru, an oasis in the otherwise long and dry Sechura desert that dominates the coast in the southeast part of the country. Camana has historically been an important tourist destination in Peru; nevertheless, the frequent and strong earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and an 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, destroyed the tourist industry of Camana and cost many their jobs, means to make a living and homes. Camana has beautiful beaches that you only have to see to love and you would like to live there. Like Peru, it is well-known for its exquisite gastronomy and one of Luis' favorite dishes is the delicious "Lomo Saltado". Luis only completed fifth year of high school due to his parents' different economic problems, but he would have liked to go to culinary school since he loves to cook. He tells us that he likes to buy cook books to learn new recipes.

Luis works in his business making and selling cakes. He gets up very early. From 3 in the morning he prepares his products because he says that God helps him in the morning. He works for approximately eight hours. In one day, he can earn up to S. 50 but on a good day he can earn up to S.80. He believes his business is going well because every day he works hard to make his products and because his customers are happy with his work.

Luis is very thankful for the Kiva loans because with its great support he can buy more utensils for making his products. With this improvement he will be able to have more income which will permit him to continue saving so that in the future he can accomplish one of his great dreams: to buy a shop from which to sell his products.

loans.use: to buy baking utensils.

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.es:
Leobardo is a farmer that lives in a rural community in one of the poorest states of Mexico. With the support of a NGO, he obtained the technical expertise and built the necessary infrastructure to develop a silvopasture system. He will use the loan to buy 15 head of cattle, fatten them and sell them to increase the household income. 

With this project, Leobardo will develop a more sustainable cattle-raising method through a silvopasture system. In addition, he will improve the living conditions of his family, and contribute to the conservation of an area of high environmental value. 

In the future he would like to have more than 50 head of cattle in his land and generate employment in his community.

loans.use: to buy 15 head of cattle to develop a sustainable farming ecosystem.

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Solange (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 45 ans. Solange n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Solange est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Hervé. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Solange et son mari. Pour cette raison, Solange vend des ustensiles de cuisine de façon ambulante depuis dix ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Solange  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Solange sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des ustensiles de cuisine.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.He is married with one child.Issa sells used cloth at Tandika market. The market is well known and famous in selling used cloths.There are a lot of competitors to Issa’s business.The profit margin has been declining.Through his experience Issa learnt that it is better to switch to selling of used shoes which have a better profit margin.The switching strategy demand more working

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her crafts and recycable material collecting business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a member of the Esenyi women's group. This group is composed mainly of people living with the HIV/AIDs virus. PEMCI has a non-discriminative policy, and we encourage people living with the virus to become economically active members of their community, and to be self-empowered. Esenyi is part of a different group forming a C.B.O that is fighting AIDS in the division. Beatrice is married with eleven children. She started her business in 1999. With the first loan from PEMCI, she was able to uplift her business and built herself a small shelter where she now lives. With this 2nd loan (her 1st with Kiva) she plans to expand her stock of fish in order to improve her income. From selling fish, Beatrice is able to offer diversity in nutrition to the vulnerable members of her community, especially those living with HIV/Aids. She is also a good role model of living positively.

loans.use: Boost her Fish monger/ Hotel Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food inventory

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana M. Suárez is married and a mother of three children and belongs to an association called "Armonía de Pro Mujer" (Accord of Pro-Women) in the area of Villa Adela in the city of El Alto. Since five years ago, Susana works hard as a medical supplier to pharmacies, where she has much related experience. Before this work, she was a nurse but had to leave the profession for health reasons.

Currently, Susana works hard only in this activity that even though she does not make money as she would like, it at least allows her to move ahead with all of her family. Thus, she needs more capital to be able to buy more merchandise and increase her inventory and sell them, for in this way, she can improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana M. Suárez, casada y madre de tres hijos pertenece a la asociación Armonía de Pro Mujer en la zona de Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto. Hace cinco años, Susana se dedica a ser proveedora de medicamentos a farmacias, rubro en el que tiene mucha experiencia, ya que antes de dedicarse a ésta actividad, cumplía funciones de enfermera, profesión que tuvo que dejar de lado por cuestiones de salud.

Actualmente, Susana solo se dedica a esta actividad que si bien no le genera los ingresos que ella desearía, por lo menos le permite salir adelante con toda su familia, por tanto ella precisa de capital para poder adquirir mayor mercadería y ampliar sus productos para de esta manera mediante la venta mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: she needs working capital to purchase a large amount of merchandise to increase her inventory, and thus sales to improve the quality of life

loans.name: Elohor

texts.en: Mrs. Elohor A. sells frozen meat, chickens, and other provisions. She learned her trade for 6 months from her mother and started her own business in 2000. She would like a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more frozen meat, chickens, provisions, and drinks for resale. She is 32 years old, married, and has been with LAPO as a leader of her union; she is a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Muharram

texts.ru:
Muharram M. has been working in the market for the past 11 years. She is a widow and has 5 children. Before, her husband was the sole provider for the family. After his death she was forced to work as a nurse at nights and work in the market during the daytime. In the beginning, she was the only one working on the market. A year after, when she accumulated more capital, her oldest son, Davron, started helping her. After obtaining her first loan from MicroInvest, she started bringing the goods from a different country, which has increased her earnings. Currently, Davron himself is selling goods on the market and Muharram is bringing new inventory. During the past two years, Muharram has been continuously taking out loans from MicroInvest and has become a very good customer. Because of the colder weather, she intends to increase the assortment of her goods by purchasing thicker winter fabrics. Her son, Davron is in the photo. Her own photo was not available.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova. Kiva Volunteer.

Махсумова Мухаррам Екубовна в течение 11 лет торгует на рынке. Не замужем (вдова). Имеет 5 детей. Муж был единственный кормильцем семьи. После его смерти Махсумова Мухаррам была вынуждена, чтобы прокормит семью одновременно работать медсестрой в ЦРБ (ночное время) и торговать на рынке (днем). В первое время она одна работала на рынке. После года деятельности когда она имела не большой собственный капитал ей начал помогать старший сын Даврон. После получения первого кредита от Микроинвест она начала сама привозит, товар тем самим увеличила доход. В данное время Даврон постоянно торгует на рынке, а Мухаррам привозит ему товар. В течение последних 2 лет кредитуется в фонде и является образцовой клиенткой. В связи с наступлением холодов она намерена расширить свой ассортимент посредством приобретения зимних утепленных тканей.

loans.use: Goods' assortment increasing

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Since she was very young Roberta worked on a small farm, and now, along with her husband she works cultivating potatoes, corn and vegetables. When their crop comes in they transport it to the capital for sale. This activity has helped to pay the economic expenses of her family and to give an education to her five children, three of which have taken advantage of the opportunity provided and are today professionals working in the city of Lima. Thanks to them Roberta can transport their products to the capital. Nevertheless they are still responsible for the two smaller children, for which she and her husband continue to strive. She has found an opportunity to acquire a position in the market of Huaycan, where she could bring her products and by being there acquire a larger income. With this desire in mind she asks your consideration to receive them in your kind heart.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva volunteer

Roberta desde muy niña trabajó en la chacra y ahora junto a su esposo se dedica al cultivo de papa, maíz y verduras, los cuales al llegar su cosecha son trasportados a la capital para su respectiva comercialización.Esta actividad le ha ayudado a solventar los gastos económicos de su familia y a brindarles educación a sus cinco hijos, tres de los cuales han aprovechado el esfuerzo de su abnegada madre y hoy son profesionales y radican en la ciudad de Lima. Gracias a ellos Roberta puede transportar sus productos a la capital.Sin embargo aun tiene a su responsabilidad a sus dos menores por los cuales ella y su esposo siguen esforzándose. Ha observado la posibilidad de adquirir un puesto en el mercado de Huaycan, a éste lugar podría llevar sus productos y por la misma demanda de la zona adquiriría mayores ingresos. Con este deseo en mente les extiende su solicitud a fin de se acogida en vuestro bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: To buy a place for selling in the market of Huaycan.

loans.name: Adriana Del Carmen

texts.es:
With great enthusiasm and dedication, Mrs. Adriana M. has worked selling meals in the inside of the market Santa Ana in Chinandega. She began her business with a capital of C$300 (three hundred cordobas), which she invested to buy the ingredients necessary to prepare this food. For three years now she has been working with Ceprodel, obtaining loans which have greatly benefited her business, increasing her profits and allowing her to acquire greater volumes of raw materials to prepare her meals.

The need Mrs. M. is going through is the urgency to acquire ingredients to prepare the meals she sells. Because of this she trusts that Ceprodel will support her as in previous occasions. Her loan record is for 18 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de comida es el negocio al que con mucho entusiasmo y dedicación se ocupa la señora Adriana M. en el interior del mercado Santa Ana en Chinandega. Inició su negocio con un capital de C$ 300 (Trescientos córdobas netos) los cuales los invirtió para la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación de estos alimentos. y desde hace tres años ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que han beneficiado grandemente su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y adquirido mayores volúmenes de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos

La necesidad que atraviesa la señora M. es la urgencia de adquirir la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y por tal motivo confía en que Ceprodel le beneficiará como las veces anteriores. Su record crediticio actual es de 18 créditos con Ceprodel

loans.use: Investing in business, buying ingredients for food preparation (Inversión en el negocio)

loans.name: Charles A. B.

texts.en: Charles is a young married man who has one small child.  He primarily sells women's clothing, jewelery, shoes and some perfumes.  With SMT loans, he has diversified his stock, and he is now requesting another loan to expand the business further.

loans.use: additional capital to further develop his business

loans.name: Izatullo

texts.ru:
Izatullo Iskandarovich Z. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 39 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary education and has a small grocery store where he sells food products. To increase the variety of produce in his store Izatullo needs money and decided to apply for a loan. By expanding his business he will be able to make more money to support his family. This will also allow the local residents to buy the necessary goods without leaving the town. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Зоиров Изатулло Искандарович проживает в районе Файзабад .Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей .Образование среднее. Занимается куплей продажей продуктов питания. Имеет небольшой магазин на местном рынке,где торгует продуктами питания. Для увеличения ассортимента магазина клиенту нужны деньги . Клиент решил взять кредит. Расширив бизнес клиент сможет заработать больше денег и лучше содержать свою семью. Жители смогут покупать у него свежие продукты питания,не выезжая в город.Клиент планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Arnaldo Javier B. is a salesperson. The products he offers include: electronic devices, diaries, pencils and pens. Arnaldo goes into public transports such as buses, and there he sells his products to the travelers.

Ten years ago, he got married to Rosana Elizabeth. The couple has one son called Jonhatan. Arnaldo wants to send Jonhatan to primary school.

In 2006, Arnaldo contacted his friends and convinced them to form a committee of entrepreneuring men called “Las Avellanas de Luque”. That is how he became a client of Fundacion Paraguaya, which is very satisfied with clients like him who repay the credits punctually.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of diaries, pens, pencils, electronic devices, keyrings and others.

loans.use: Purchase of diaries, pens, pencils, electronic devices, keyrings and others.

loans.name: Sowra D 2012-2 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Betty W.. She sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to rent to others. Betty is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has 3 children ranging from ages 15 to 25, who go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately 70 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike.

Betty is joined in her small group by Mary W., Floura D., Victoria J., and Tabitha T.. Mary W. sells charcoal and wants to build shop to sell oil. Floura D. sells salt and charcoal in a shop and wants a loan to expand her shop. Victoria J. sells charcoal and wants to buy a tractor for plouging her farm. Tabitha T. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to rent to others

loans.name: Islamiat

texts.en:
Islamiat Y. sells clothes and is also a fashion designer and seamstress. She spent 2-1/2 years learning this skill. She is 24-years-old, single, and lives in Imude, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Islamiat has one sewing machine and two apprentices. She has been in business since 1996 and has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. Islamiat is requesting this loan to buy more fabric and tailoring materials. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia O. is 41 years old and she is married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells and supplies drinks. She learned this business for 2 years. She started her own business in 2005. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more drinks to sell and supply to customers. She expresses her gratitude to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale and supply

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Саидова Инобат жительница города Турсунзаде. Вдова , имеет 2 детей. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей и фруктов на рынке «Дехкон».Она скупает у местных крестьян фрукты и овощи оптом. На доход от  торговли она содержит своих детей. Сейчас она хочет закупить юольше товара. Планирует погасить кредитт в течении 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Inobat S. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is a widow with two children. She works buying and selling vegetables and fruit in the Dekhon market. She buys fruit and vegetables wholesale from local farmers. She supports her children with this income. Now she wants to buy more goods. She plans to pay off the loan in fifteen months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying goods

loans.name: Communal Bank "gosalvez" Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento GOSALVEZ, inició actividades con doce socias, las mismas tiene su domicilio en la zona del mismo nombre, Gosalvez en la Villa Nuevo Potosí, Zona que se encuentra en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, esta ladera se caracteriza por tener vecinos migrantes del altiplano, en esta zona generalmente se dedican al comercio, servicio y también a la producción y por ende la mayoría de las socias se dedican a estos rubros. 

El Banco de emprendimiento GOSALVEZ trabaja con nuestra Institución cinco ciclos, habiéndose fundado el 10 de enero de 2007, actualmente se mantienen en el grupo 10 socias, teniendo como mesa directiva: 

- 	Presidenta			Catalina L. 
-	Tesorera			Paulina  M. Q.
-	Secretaria			Sofia V. A.

Se debe resaltar que el grupo trabaja con mucha solidaridad, compañerismo y responsabilidad; aprendieron al interior de la asociación a ahorrar, hecho que en nuestro país es muy difícil por la misma situación social y económica que atravesamos. Las razones que las motiva a trabajar en este tipo de crédito, es que las señoras indican, que al interior de la asociación encuentran un espacio de esparcimiento, motivación, confraternización, un espacio donde se sienten escuchadas y pueden hablar de sus problemas personales, para luego salir y poder nuevamente hacer frente a todos sus problemas 

Catalina L. Condori : Tiene como actividad principal la venta en una  tienda que esta ubicada en su propio domicilio, vive con el esposo que se dedica a la actividad de transporte libre (taxi) como asalariado, como su familia no cuenta con un ingreso fijo ellos han acudido a prestamos de la institución y una de las aspiraciones de la señora es ver a sus hijos profesionales, uno de ellos se encuentra en la escuela de sargentos, el pequeño se encuentra recién en secundaria.

Agustina M. Q.: Tiene como una actividad principal la venta de lubricantes y la elaboración de mantas en su propio domicilio. La señora con el esfuerzo y sacrificio de su trabajo juntamente con su esposo, mantienen a sus cuatro hijos. Gracias al préstamo otorgado por la institución a podido comprar equipo de trabajo para la elaboración de mantas y así aumentar su capital de trabajo.

Guillermo M. N.: Tiene su propio negocio de elaboración de calzados en su propio domicilio, su esposa tiene como actividad principal la venta de comida en la zona de Chijini, pese a que los dos trabajan sus ingresos no le alcanzaban para poder ahorrar pero con el préstamo que se hicieron de la institución pudieron incrementar su capital y poder ahorrar para sus hijos ya que ellos ansían verlos superados.

Paulina M. Q.: Madre de cuatro hijos, es empleada de una carnicería, el sueldo que ella percibe es mínimo por lo que no le alcanza para cubrir sus gastos familiares, es por este motivo que cual conjuntamente con su esposo elaboran calzados para la venta El préstamo  otorgado por Emprender posibilito aumentar su capital de trabajo y por tanto su producción e ingresos, que a su vez mejoro su situación económica.


Juana Sabina T. N.: Tiene como principal actividad la elaboración y venta de chamarras, pese a que ella es una joven soltera, la misma se encuentra al cuidado de sus padres y sus hermanos, por lo que se ha constituido en la jefe de su hogar. Gracias al préstamo concedido a logrado elaborar chamarras para hombres y mujeres en diferentes tallas, lo que antes por falta de materia prima era difícil, uno de sus sueños es poder tener una tienda propia y poder exportar sus diseños.

Sofia V. A.:  Tiene como principal actividad la venta de  ropa interior y medias,  como no cuenta con un sueldo fijo y  sus ingresos no le alcanzan, solicito préstamo para poder incrementar y diversificar sus productos. Tiene como principal objetivo el poder ahorrar para comprar su propio lote.

Dominga N. A.: La Sra. se dedica a la  venta de mandiles, se encuentran a su cargo sus 5 hijos, los únicos ingresos con los que cuenta la familia es de la madre, ya que los hijos se encuentran estudiando, con el préstamo otorgado se ha posibilitado que la Sra. pueda comprar su propio puesto y tener un stock en mercadería.

Teodora Q. Cayo: Tiene como actividad la fabricación y venta de calzados, están bajo su cuidado sus 6 hijos, ya que el padre se encuentra en el área rural, es por este motivo que ella asumió los gastos y responsabilidades de su hogar. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda y aumentar su capital, para fabricar zapatos para caballeros ,damas y niños. 

Flora R. M.: La Sra tiene como principal actividad la venta de frutas, tiene una familia numerosa, los ingresos de la familia  dependen de la jefa de hogar. Con el préstamo de la institución a logrado aumentar su capital y así poder comprar más productos de la temporada y mejorar su situación económica de ella y sus hijos.

Irene C. M.: La Sra trabaja en la atención de un baño publico, su esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado, sus ingresos familiares son mínimos y no llegan a cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Con el préstamo la Sra. ha logrado comprar regalos  que son vendidos en los locales que se encuentran cerca de su trabajo y así poder mejorar su situación económica que era muy difícil.
texts.en:
The communal bank GOSALVEZ began activities with twelve members. They live in the zone with the same name, Gosalvez, in the village of Nuevo Potosí which is an area located on the western slope of the city of La Paz. This hillside is characterized by having migrants from the high plains region. In this zone they are generally dedicated to commerce, services and also to production, and most of the members work along these lines.

The communal bank GOSALVEZ has worked with our institution for five cycles, having funded itself on January 10, 2007. Currently, the group consists of ten members with a management team as follows:

- President Catalina L. - Treasurer Paulina M. Q. - Secretary Sofia V. A.

It must be highlighted that the group works with great solidarity, companionship and responsability; they learned how to save within the organization, given that in our country it is very difficult because of the social and economic situation we are going through. The reasons that motivate them to work with this type of credit, as the women indicate, is that within the association they have a safe haven where they find motivation, fraternization, a space where they feel heard and can talk about their personal issues. They later leave feeling renewed and able to again face all of their problems.

Catalina L. Condori: Has as her primary activity sales from a store that is located in her home. She lives with her husband who earns his wages as a taxi driver. Since their family does not count on a fixed income, they have turned to loans from the institution and one of this woman’s dreams is to see her children become professionals. One of them is in sergeant’s school, and the other is still in secondary school.

Agustina M. Q.: Has as her primary activity the sale of lubricants and production of blankets in her own home. This woman, with effort and sacrifice, works together with her husband to support their four children. Thanks to the loan granted by the institution, she has been able to buy equipment for making blankets and that way increase her working capital.

Guillermo M. N.: Has his own business making footwear in his own home. His wife has as her primary activity food sales in the zone of Chijini. Despite the fact that they both work, their income wasn’t enough to be able to save. However, with the loan they were granted by the institution they were able to increase their capital and save for their children as they have hope to see them get ahead.

Paulina M. Q.: Mother of four children, she is an employee of a butcher’s shop. She earns a minimal wage which did not meet the family’s financial needs, which is why she decided to join her husband in making footwear to offer for sale. The loan granted by Emprender increased her working capital and, in turn, her production and income which simultaneously helped improve her economic situation.

Juana Sabina T. N.: Has as her principal activity the making and sale of jackets. Despite the fact that she is still a single young woman, she is in charge of caring for her parents and brothers and therefore finds herself as the head of household. Thanks to the loan granted her, she has managed to produce jackets for both men and women of different sizes. Before, she was lacking in raw materials which was a difficulty. One of her dreams is to one day have her own store and to be able to export her designs.

Sofia V. A.: Has as her principal activity the sale of undergarments and socks. Given that she does not count on a fixed wage, her income was not sufficient. She sought a loan to help her to increase and diversify her products. Her principal objective is to be able to save so she can buy her own plot of land.

Dominga N. A.: Dedicates herself to the sale of aprons, and finds herself in charge of supporting her five children. The only income with which the family can count on is hers, since the children are still in school. With the loan granted her, it has become a possibility that this woman might be able to buy her own stand and a stock of merchandise.

Teodora Q. Cayo: Has as her activity the fabrication and sale of footwear, and she also cares for her six children given that the father is in a rural area. It is for this reason that she assumed the expenses and responsibilities of the home. Her dream is to be able to have a store and increase her capital, in order to produce her shoes for men, women and children.

Flora R. M.: This woman has as her principal activity the sale of fruit. She has a large family, and their income is dependent on her. With the loan from the institution she has managed to increase her capital, and in that way purchase more seasonal products and improve the financial situation for herself and her children.

Irene C. M.: This woman works tending to a public restroom, and her husband earns his wages as a chauffer. The family’s income is minimal, and does not cover their basic needs. With her loan, she has managed to purchase gifts which she sells in various locales close to her work and in this way try to improve their very difficult economic situation.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen P. lives in Pour Roung Village in Takeo Province. She is married with three children who attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Eth Oun, own a plot of land where they cultivate rice to earn their living. On their plantation, they cannot cultivate rice because they do not have enough animals to plow. Mrs. Pen P. would like a loan of $250 to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. With the rest of the loan, she would buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her crop. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs Nguyen Thi H. 31 years old. She is married  and has two children. She lives in Hung Trung commune, Hung Nguyen district , Nghe An province. She has been in TYM Fund since 2002. Her main income comes from raising chicken on a farm and growing rice. As her previous loans have been used wisely, her income is becoming more stable with more invest in her children’s education. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more chickens and chicken feed to further grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Baba

texts.fr:
Madame BATANA baba est une femme motivée qui a ouvert un débit de vente de boissons en casiers et charbons dans le quartier de djidjolé à Lomé (Togo), ce commerce marche bien et elle le fait depuis 1998. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local de tsotsi pour les charbons et au point d’approvisionnement de la brasserie du togo. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour pouvoir acheter des casiers de boissons et des sacs de charbons.
Elle est mariée avec Mr BRANGAMA tombégou qui est un entrepreneur, ils ont trois enfants. Avec le profit tiré de ce commerce, elle pense aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
Ms. Baba BATANA is a motivated woman who opened a outlet selling beverages in cases and charcoal in the Djidjolé district in Lomé (Togo). She has been in this business since 1998, and it is doing well. She gets her supplies at the local marketplace of Tsotsi for charcoal and the supply point of the Togo brewery. She has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan and is requesting this initial loan to buy cases of drinks and sacks of charcoal.

She is married to Mr. Tombégou BRANGAMA, an entrepreneur. They have three children. With the profit derived from this commerce, she is planning to assist her husband with day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Luyện  năm nay 42 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị Luyện rất khó khăn, thu nhập chủ yếu dựa vào việc đi làm thuê.  Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ  được vay vốn gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và đấu thầu đầm để nuôi cá. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
 Vòng vốn tới chị Luyện mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để  mua thêm cá về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Luyện is 42 years old. She has been a part of TYM Fund since 1997. Before she joined the fund, Mrs. Trần's family experienced a lot of financial hardship. Their main source of income was from working as laborers/hired hands. Since TYM, she and her family have worked hard to borrow money and invest in rearing livestock and purchase land to farm fish. These are the main sources of income for the family - amounting to 4,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, Mrs. Trần Thị Luyện would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to buy more fish to farm/raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising/Farming Fish

loans.name: María Maribel

texts.es:
Maria empezó trabajando con mototaxis con su esposo y sus hijos en el año 2001. Los compraban y vendían a la vez, el día de hoy sus tres hijos mayores todavía trabajan en este negocio, mientras Maria ya no. Actualmente y desde hace tres años, cuando cumplió treinta y ocho años, empezó con su tienda de bazar y abarrotes siguiendo el consejo de sus hijos.
 
Hace dos años empezó a recibir los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, que le permitieron ampliar su negocio, y ahora está planeando en el futuro junto a sus hijos alquilar un local en el mercado para vender ropa.
texts.en:
Maria began working with taxis with her husband and their children in 2001. Their family bought and sold taxis. Today, their three older children still work in this business, but Maria no longer does. At the present, and since three years ago, when Maria was thirty-eight years old, she began her own hardware and grocery store following the advice of her children. Two years ago she began to receive loans from EDAPROSPO, an affiliate of Kiva, which allowed her to expand her business. She is now planning to rent a local space in the market with her children in order to sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products for Carnival season

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is a 25 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Kamal has repaired cars since 2003. He repairs cars, changes oil and cleans them. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools and car oil for his garage. Kamal is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools for his business. This is the first time that Kamal has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to purchase a new cleaning machine.

loans.use: Kamal would like to use the loan to purchase new tools and car oil for his garage.

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.ru: Халимов Абдуманон житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Имеет пекарню, где выпекает лепешки. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Обратился к нам за кредитом . Деньги нужны для закупки муки , которую будет использовать для дела. погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdumanon H. lives in the Gissar region. He is 34 years old, is married and has three children. He has a bakery where he bakes flatbread. Abdumanon has been in this business for 10 years now. He has turned to us for a loan. He needs money to purchase flour, which he will use for his business. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
I. is a 53 year old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. I. has owned a furniture store since 1990. He is requesting a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that I. has requested a loan.

I. is special in his work because he offers nice furniture and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his family members, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding a good location to open his store. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for a store

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok L. lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Toeur Orn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. This couple has four children, one of whom is a policeman while another is a grocer and the remaining two are enrolled in the local school.

Although Mrs. Sok L. family’s members have different careers, they still earn insufficient income to support their living. Thus, Mrs. Sok L. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business to earn more income. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow breeding business to earn more income

loans.name: Foindu Group

texts.en:
This is Mye John B., Abibatu C., and Mariama S.. They are local businesspeople in Magburaka town. They named their group Foindu, after the village of the group leader. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have had a tremendous impact on the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to look after themselves and their families. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are now requesting a new loan to further expand their businesses. 

Abibatu C. (left) sells firewood, cold water, and local produce. Mye John B. (middle) sells building materials like sand, stones, and sticks. And Mariama S. (right) sells ink, soda, powder, and white cottons. 

Mye John B. is the leader of the group. He was born in Magburaka, which is in the Tonkolili district of northern Sierra Leone. He is 38 years old and married to a businesswoman. They have five children who are in primary and secondary school. Mye John has more than ten years of experience in business.

loans.use: Invest in his retail business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 34 years old and a public teacher in their village of Cabruan Naguilian, Isabela. She has been teaching kindergarten for about five years now and receives a monthly compensation of only PHP 1,200. She is married to Loreto D. who is 40 years old and works as a farmer. They have two children who are both studying in the primary school. Valerie Kyle is the eldest while Valian Klyde is the youngest.

Marites’ compensation from teaching is not quite enough for her family’s daily expenses so she has started selling Avon and Natasha products to her co-teachers and neighbors. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more products to sell and provide needed income to her family. 

According to her, “poverty is not a hindrance for success.” She is aiming for success despite the difficulties that her family is experiencing. As long as there is patience and perseverance she knows she can lift herself and her family out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce S. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through primary education. Her husband is a fisherman who fishes on a small scale.
