Joyce sells smoked fish in Abortoase. She uses all her income in taking care of the children and other parental responsibilities. She will use the loan to purchase fish on a large scale, process them by smoking and sell to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase fish on a large scale

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Ms. Sokunthea S., 35, is single and has two brothers. She lives in a small village along National Road Number Two about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 
 
Sokunthea has been a garment factory worker for ten years. One of her brothers has full-time employment and the other one is learning to be a locksmith. She is asking for a loan of $800 to plaster the wall of her house and to build a staircase.

loans.use: To plaster the wall of her house and to build a staircase

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene sells drinks and other items. She is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more drinks and turkey to sell.  She says thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more turkey and drinks

loans.name: Ipogolo Group

texts.en:
Suzana is a member of the Ipogolo borrower group.she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged12,14 years.

Suzana started her own business selling local beer 5 years ago,she works 11 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tsh.

This is Suzana`s first loan from BRAC.She requested loan amount 200,000 In order to buy more commodities like wheat,sugar for her business.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Suzana hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Modesta is another member of the same borrower group,she requested loan amount 200,000 in order to expand her own food business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for hae business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 48years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs in front of her house. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell, she says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more Jewries to sell.

loans.name: David Mutisya

texts.en:
David is 41 years old and is married to Patriciah. They have three children, Mary, who is 14-years old; Leonard, who is 10 years old, and Annah, who is five years old.

David has run a retail shop for five years. He has no previous credit history from other MFI's. He was introduced to KADET by members of an existing group.

David's business is located in densely populated area with middle-class customers who rely on his shop because it is the only one near their homes.

He has applied for a loan to increase his stock of cereals, such as rice, beans, and, maize, which are in demand, but which is needs funds to purchase. With the extra profits from his business, David plans to build rental houses.

His future hopes and dreams include turning the business into a wholesale businessand become a wholesale distributor. David believes he is focused and hardworking.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy cereals for his food store

loans.name: Phares

texts.en: Pharesi Naftari is a small business Tanzanian married man. He runs cosmetics shops business at Mombasa ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells varieties of business goods at his shop and most of the customers are women as far as Dar es Salaam is hot. He purchases the business goods direct from the whole and retail sales shops. He has been in the business for three years. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Solmira

texts.en:
Solmira, 36 years old, has managed a livestock business for almost five years, raising both hogs and ducks. She has also been engaged in vegetable vending for eight months. In order to make her business more productive, Solmira is requesting a loan of PHP8,000 from KIVA lenders to purchase feed for her hogs and ducks. She hopes that the lenders will help her to earn more income and attain her business goals.

Solmira is married to Apolinario and blessed with five children: James - 27 years of old, a tricycle driver; Emerson - 26 years old, a farmer; Tayrene - 24 years old, a full-time housewife; Arnold - 22 years old, a college student, and Jonard - 16 years old, a fourth year high school student.

loans.use: Additional capital for her livestock business

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar was born in 1989.  He lives in Fuzuli region.  He is married and has one child.  Three years ago, he started a cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves to expand his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Mary Anne

texts.en:
“If you want to succeed, always think positive!” That is an inspiring quotation shared by Mrs. Mary Anne B. of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Ric B. and they are blessed with two children. They help each other to earn a living for their survival and for the future of their children.

Mary Anne's husband is a carpenter in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya, while she helps her husband in gaining income by selling MSE and Natasha cosmetics products in their village. She wants to acquire more of these products so she can sell more to their village but she cannot afford to due to lack of capital. Having the interest to continue her business, she wants to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 Philippine pesos to acquire more of these products. She is so happy with this financial assistance that gives her the opportunity to continue and improve her small business.

loans.use: Additional capital for selling costmetics

loans.name: Aisha Kabuye‘S Group

texts.en: Aisha is a 40-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 6 and 20 years.  All her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she is staying with three people. Aisha doesn’t take care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.  Aisha owns a beauty salon in Nakulabye Kiyaye zone. She incurs transport costs to and from buying hair conditioners and hair extensions from Kikuubo shops, one of the busiest places in Kampala city. She pays rent for her business premises at 45000/= per month.  She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of seven customers a day and works on all categories of people, whether its relaxing, braiding or plaiting.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her. She has been in this business for nine years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her 10th loan, working with the same group mates. Aisha joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair conditioners and hair extensions. She is hoping to see her business grower bigger, start doing manicures and pedicures only, and getting a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy hair conditioners and hair extensions

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday is a transporter. He owns a motorcycle used for commercial purposes to convey his passengers from one location to another in his community. Monday also has a school. He made his wife the head teacher of the school. When the school closes for the day he rests for a while before using his motorcycle for commercial purposes. He is married with three children and he is 46 years old. Monday is a hard working man and he hopes to lift his business above poverty. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more textbooks and school uniforms. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks and school uniforms

loans.name: Modinot

texts.en:
Modinot is 46 years old and married with three children. She has been a member of the Kiva field partner, LAPO, for over two years now.

Modinot is the owner of Mummy Mutia Salon, where she displays her talent as a stylist. She also sells hair extensions and beauty accessories such as weaving materials, attachments, hair creams, etc. She started this business about 19 years ago, and she is not doing badly. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Modinot needs a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions and beauty accessories, and other materials for her salon business.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair accessories and other materials for her salon.

loans.name: Maria Epifania

texts.es:
La   Señora María Epifanía T. González, Labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y  estos se encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento y arena, para la construcción de  un muro en el patio.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 María dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. María Epifanía T. González works as a janitor at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. She is a single mother with two dependent children attending school. She has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for the past three years. During this time, she has received four home improvement loans.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as stone, cement, and sand in order to build a wall in her patio. Her objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for her children. María thanks CEPRODEL for providing the loans that make it possible for her to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.en:
Amy E. is from Barangay Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old and she is the group leader of a eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Amy E.'s Group.

Amy is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Amy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Amy is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita S. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives in a family home with her husband and two sons, both of whom are currently attending elementary school. Mrs. Sarita and her husband, Mr. Puspa S., make baked goods. They have been in business baking cakes and cookies for two years. They sell their baked goods to local shops and markets.
Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to expand their business. They will use the extra income generated to expand their business further and send their children to better schools.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
Cesar M. de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposa trabaja en una tabacalera con ella tiene 2 hijos. 

Cesar inicio con una pequeña tienda hace ya muchos años, cuando solo tenía arroz y azúcar para vender implemento vender aceite y enlatados. 

Ahora el tiene una tienda muy surtida con enlatados, carnes, frutas, aceites y otros productos. Trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 21h30. Quiere implementar la venta de ropa y artículos personales. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene en su negocio es la delincuencia en el sector.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, zapatos y arroz para su tienda. En el futuro quiere trasladar su tienda a otro sector para evitar la delincuencia.
texts.en:
Cesar M., 32, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil; his house is cement and it has all basic services. His wife works on a tobacco farm and they have two children together. Cesar started with a small store many years ago when he only sold rice and sugar; later he added cooking oil and canned goods. Now he has a well-stocked store with canned goods, meats, fruit, cooking oil and other products. He is open for business from 6:30am to 9:30pm. He wants to start selling clothing and personal articles. One of the obstacles he faces is the high crime rate in the area. He will use the funds to buy notebooks, shoes and rice for his store. In the future he would like to move his store to a different neighborhood to avoid the crime.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks, shoes and rice.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita G. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 58 years old. Nenita is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Don José vive en San Martin, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado y por el momento ella se encuentra en el extranjero ya que tiene visa de contrato, el es chofer de transporte con ruta de San Martin Jilotepeque a Guatemala. Don José solicita el crédito para comprar un repuesto de su caminoneta ya que se le arruino. El sueño de José es tener mas caminonetas y asi tener su propia linea de transportes.
texts.en:
Jose lives in San Martin. He is 39 years old, married to a woman who is currently out of the country on a work visa. He is a driver on the San Martin Jilotepeque line to Guatemala. Jose is requesting a loan to buy a part for his bus, which is broken. Jose’s dream is to have more buses, and his own transportation line.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his bus

loans.name: Demberelsuren

texts.en:
Demberelsuren G. is 52 and the married father of two children. He and his family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. 

Demberelsuren operates a transportation and mobile trading business. He transports local residents to and from many different areas. He has been operating his businesses since 2007, and has steadily expanded his business and built a loyal customer base. Between 2004 and 2007, Demberelsuren operated a raw materials trading business. He is an industrious person, a good salesman, and has excellent communication skills. 

In the future, Demberelsuren would like to expand his business and repair his car. He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~ 1075 USD) loan to purchase fodder and consumer products to sell to local herder families.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Juraeva Avazhon Group

texts.ru:
Авазхон 46 лет. Ее супруг  занимается перепродажей КРС.  Сама клиент  в настоящее время активно занимается сельским хозяйством и животноводством, а также продает молоко. Цель кредита - Закуп удобрений(азот), 1тонну по 10 сом. Так как клиентка имеет арендованный земельный надел, уже на 0,50 га посеяли хлопок, 0,50 га посеяли картофель.

Зарипе 46 лет. Она замужем и мать 4 детей. Дети в свободное время от учебы помогают по бизнесу.Она занята откормом и разведением КРС, также продает молоко, сузьма. Цель кредита - закуп удобрений и телки для откорма.

Равшанбеку 45 лет. Он женат и воспитывает в детей.Оба уже взрослые: дочь выдал замуж, сын занимается сбором и реализации камня, заработок около 70 долларов. Супруга работает воспитательницей в детском саду, зарплата 75 долларов. Клиент занимается животноводством: откорм и разведение КРС и реализация молока. В данное время у него есть коровв доенная с теленком, телка, 4 овцы и 6 коз. На кредит он планирует купить удобрения и культивировать землю.

Тасилхон 42 года. Она вдова и мать 4 детей: сыну 20, дочери 17 лет, младшему сыну 12 и младшей дочери 12 лет. Старший сын и дочь находятся на заработках в РФ, работают продавцоми в магазине. Младшие дети близнецы учатся в школе. Получают пособие на безотцовство.Цель кредита - закуп минеральных удобрений и сделать культивацию хлопчатника и коз для разведения. На земельном наделе 0,16 га посеяли картофель, 0,25 га хлопок, 0,25 га кукурузу.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Avazhon is 46 years old. Her husband is involved in resale of cattle. Currently, the client is actively involved in agriculture and animal husbandry and also sells milk. The goal of the loan is a purchase of 1 ton of fertilizers at 10 som. Because the client has a leased plot of land, she planted cotton on 0.50 hectares and potatoes on another 0.50 hectares. Zaripa is 46 years old. She is married and a mother of 4 children. The children help with the business in their free time away from school. Zaripa is involved in fattening and breeding cattle and also sells milk and traditional dairy products. The goal of the loan is to purchase fertilizers and heifers for fattening. Ravshanbek is 45 years old. He is married and has two children. Both of them are already grown. He married off the daughter, and his son is involved in collecting and selling stone, earning about 70 dollars. Ravshanbek’s wife works as a kindergarten teacher. Her salary is 75 dollars. The client is involved in animal husbandry – fattening and breeding of cattle and selling milk. Currently, he has a dairy cow with a calf, a heifer, 4 sheep and 6 goats. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers and cultivate the land. Tasilhon is 42 years old. She is a widow and a mother of 4 children. Her son is 20, daughter is 17, and youngest son and daughter are both 12 years old. The oldest children work as store salespersons in the Russian Federation. The youngest twin children go to school. The family receives a monetary assistance because they do not have a father. The goal of the loan is to purchase mineral fertilizers in order to cultivate cotton and to buy goats for breeding. They planted potatoes on 0.16 hectares of their land plot, cotton on 0.25 hectares and corn on another 0.25 hectares.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Farahim

texts.en:
Farahim H. is a young businessman of 23 who sells spare parts in Imishli city. He has three years of experience in this field. He is single and runs his business alone.

Farahim applied for a 1000 Azerbaijan New Manats loan, which he will use to purchase more spare parts and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: Purchase more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela has applied for a loan for her husband’s business selling herbal medicines. His business is doing well but he needs to buy some new herbal products for the formation of new medicines. He will make new herbal medicines as a result of his research.

Shakeela wants her children to get the best education and, for this reason, her family business needs to be improved so that she will be able to afford their education expenses. She is hopeful that, by investing money in her husband’s business, their family financial condition will be improved and their children will be able to get a good education and will become successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase herbal products for her husband to manufacture into herbal medicines

loans.name: Ka-Muyu Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the “Ka-muyu” group. They are small-scale-business people based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profits and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Hawa K. who is age 43 and was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with six children. Her husband is a businessman and two of her children are attending secondary school.

For twenty-two years now, Hawa has sold cooked rice, rice and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). She will use her share of the loan to buy bags of rice, gallons of palm-oil, fish, onions, pepper and plates.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, gallons of palm-oil, fish, onions, pepper and plates

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem C., 43, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is a farmer, growing rice and raising pigs for an income of $1 (US) per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $3 (US) per day. C. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jarlene

texts.en:
Mrs. Jarlene A. is from the barangay of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and married to Romy A., a truck driver.  She is blessed with two children who are school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in hog fattening. She is also receiving support from her husband. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for one year and earns approximately PHP 2,000 a month from this activity. 

In the year 2009, Jarlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jarlene, as an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program, has successfully repaid a loan of PHP 10,000.  She is now requesting a loan of PHP 14,900 as her third loan to purchase additional piglets for her existing hog fattening activity. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, children’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansion. 

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets

location.town: Ozamis-P6 Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en: Maka H. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread (gelebia & lagemat) at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour. Maka is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and 2 brothers. He is an experienced construction worker who began working in construction at a young age. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase lumber for his newest project. He expects the coming year to be successful and expects to further increase his business productivity. He also plans on taking on bigger projects. His business income is important, as it is used to support his family in collaboration with his 2 brothers to meet their high expenses.

loans.use: Purchase lumber

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, tomatoes, beans, red oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene la edad de 32 años, es casado, y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 y 7 de edad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar la semilla de jengibre y con lo que sobra para construir una manguera para el riego que necesita para su buen crecimiento y buena calidad. Él cuenta con el terreno necesaria para la siembra y la producción. Desea llegar a obtener unas buenas ganancias con su inversión. Ademas, está quedando bien con el comité de crédito de Pilón pues es una buena opción de crédito. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José, 32, is married and lives with his wife and two children who are 6 and 7 years old.  

He wants the loan to buy ginger seeds and with whatever’s left over build a hose irrigation system for watering the crop for good development and quality. He has good fields available for planting and production.

He hopes to earn good profits from his investment.  In addition he is in good standing with the Pilón credit committee because it’s a good option for credit.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms offered. 

He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and increased economic stability as well as to continue growing both as a person and as a farmer.

loans.use: To plant ginger and for a watering hose irrigation system.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city of Pakistan famous for its textile industry. She is 36 years old and married to R. M.. She has two sons. Her eldest son is 4 years old and youngest is 6 months old. Both of them are too young to go to school. She is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her family, particularly her youngest son, who needs her full attention. 

Her husband has a plant-selling business. He has a small plant shop from where he sells different plants, plant pots, seeds, etc. He has good number of customers due to his good knowledge of plants. He has a good reputation among his customers and enjoys regular sales.  

Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy plants, seeds and pots and increase his sales. Nazia is hopeful that her husband’s business will surely improve with the help of this loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who never missed any meetings and paid her installments on time. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady who has dressed up with an orange color is Nazia and the next to her who is raising her hand is her group member Shahnaz".

loans.use: To buy plants, seeds and pots for the plant shop

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is a married woman with seven children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She sells second hand-clothes and also has a restaurant. For over seven years she has sold from door to door and from home. Riziki faces a major challenge of late payment by customers who buy goods on credit. With the Kshs 80,000 Riziki wants to purchase construction materials for her stall and clothes to resell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She decided to join Yehu because it provides sustainable financial services to economically marginalized entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her stall and second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jeralyn's Group

texts.en:
Jeralyn I. is from the village of Cebu San Isidro. She is 43 years old. Jeralyn is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jeralyn I. group.

Jeralyn is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeralyn owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Jeralyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeralyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Jeralyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jeralyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.fr: Aloys Nsabinawa est agricultrice du riz, est elle est un membre du groupe Abishyizehamwe Kibaza.  Elle est mariée, et elle a 3 enfants entre 4 ans et 16 ans.  Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école.    Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les fertilisantes urées et NPK, et aussi pour la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’être fournisseur de secteur du Ruhuha.  Elle voudrait devenir commerçant et agriculteur moderne.  Pour sa famille, Elle voudrait avoir d’habitation, et payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Aloys Nsabinawa is a rice farmer, and she is a member of the Abishyizehamwe Kibaza group. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 16. Two of her children go to school. She is going to use her loan to buy urea and NPK fertilizers, and also to pay for manual labour. Her strategy for helping her business grow is to be a supplier for the Ruhuha sector. She would like to become a merchant and modern farmer. She would like to have a house for her family and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for manual labour

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has been operating a dry fish selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Salama faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a bundle of fish to resell.  She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Leaflor

texts.en:
Leaflor T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 21 years old. Leaflor is single. To make a living, Leaflor runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leaflor works hard to be able to help her family financially.

Leaflor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leaflor is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Leaflor from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eva María

texts.es:
Eva es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos menores hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como mango y limón. La localidad pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y artículos de escritorio en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio tiene como principales clientes a los estudiantes de la zona, que siempre acuden a su establecimiento porque pone al alcance de sus manos artículos que siempre necesitan y por los cuales tendrían que ir hasta el pueblo central para adquirirlos.

El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia ya que gracias a el ayuda a su esposo, que es maestro panadero, con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Es por eso que ella trata de mantener su negocio del mejor modo posible. Actualmente desea ir surtiendo su negocio con más artículos de modo que esté preparada para afrontar la demanda que se presente durante la temporada escolar, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Eva María ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y de su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad también pudo ampliar su negocio y gracias a ello su demanda y ventas aumentaron. Ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva que le ayudaron a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eva is a 40 year-old mother who lives together with her husband and two dependent children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a semi-tropical area that is noted for mainly producing fruit such as mangoes and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque province.

Eva sells school supplies and writing supplies from a small store in her home.  Her main customers are students from the area who always come to her establishment because she is able to supply them with items that they need and which they would otherwise have to go to the central town to acquire.

Eva's business is an important source of income for her family since, thanks to it, she is able to help her husband, who is a master baker, to cover their family's expenses.  For this reason, she tries to maintain her business as well as possible.  She would currently like to stock her business with more items so that she is ready to meet the demand that she will have during the school season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her achieve her goal.

Eva has already had a loan from Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and their 'seed money program'.  With that loan she was able to expand her business and, as a result, her demand and her sales increased.  She is grateful to the Kiva lenders who helped her to get ahead.

loans.use: To acquire items to stock her business

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino vive en la casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la localidad de Caluyo. El señor se trabaja como ayudante del equipo de perforación de una empresa constructora. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene tres hijos y es casado.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera para comenzar el negocio de la venta de leche a la planta industrializadora PIL.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico lo califica como sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Saturnino lives in his own home in the town of Caluyo.  He works as an assistant in a drilling team for a construction company.  This is his main source of income with which he supports himself.

Saturnino will use his loan to buy a dairy cow, so that he can start a business selling milk to PIL (a milk processing plant).

This is Saturnino's first loan with Impro and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him to receive a loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so that he can start a milk sales business

loans.name: Tharcis

texts.en: Tharcis owns a hardware shop. He is 43 years old, married, and has four children. He works together with his wife. Tharcis has been selling metals and other plumbing supplies for eleven years. His loan will be used to add more metals to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to increase the volume of his business. In the future, he wishes to own a big shop which supplies different kinds of metals.

loans.use: To buy metals for his hardware store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing goats, beans and sorghum

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is a 53-year-old hard-working woman, married, and a mother of 8 living in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. Safina has been operating a clothing and textile business for 10 years, and she started small, but now it's gradually improving. She faces a challenge of bad debtors and hopes that her business will grow bigger than what it is now. Safina needs the loan to purchase clothing, bags and suitcases for sale.

loans.use: Buying clothing, suitcases & bags for sale.

loans.name: Sou's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sou, a 39 year old married woman, is a group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by its four members. The members of this group will use their money to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Sou's husband is a farmer who owns 3-hectare plot of land which he uses to grow rice for a living. This couple has five children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is employed in a shoe factory, and one is a laborer, while the others are attending in the local school.

Mrs. Sou is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to help support her family. Her family living doesn't have a well, so she would like to ask for a loan to add her saving to dig a well.

loans.use: To add her savings, to dig a functional well.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeun was born in 1978.  She is married to Mr. Sina, and has three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school (the others are too small to work or study). She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice, some of which they sell, and some of which they use to support their family. Besides being a farmer, Mr. Sina is also a driver who earns a low salary. In this dry season, it is time to grow rice, and Mrs. Hoeun needs some money to help her do this. She would like to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Su amor por los animales, su origen campesino y sus deseos de ofrecerle una mejor calidad a sus dos hijos impulsaron a Adriana María Gutiérrez a crear su propio negocio, una cría de cerdos que se ha convertido en una fuente de ingresos para la familia. 

A sus 35 años de edad, Adriana sueña con tener su casa propia y poder construir un criadero grande que le permita mantener más cerdos y aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente, Adriana necesita de un préstamo para adecuar el corral de los cerdos y comprar otro de estos animalitos con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos. 

Humilde, sencilla y trabajadora, así es como se define esta campesina emprendedora que espera hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Her love of animals, her country origin, and her desire to offer a better quality of life to her two children inspired Adriana María Gutiérrez to create her own business raising hogs.  This has become a source of income for her family.

At 35, Adriana dreams of having her own home and being able to build a large farm where she can keep more hogs and increase her income and quality of life.

She needs a loan to acquire a pig pen and another hog.

Humble, simple and hardworking is how we can describe this enterprising country girl who hopes to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy a hog and a pen

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel tiene 55 años de edad está casada y tiene un hijo del cual se encarga junto con su esposo. Ellos viven en un caserío (comunidad rural de condición pobre, con casas en desarrollo) ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. La actividad principal en este distrito es la agricultura y la ganadería.

Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia, en la cual cuenta con mango y algodón que ha sembrado para esta campaña.

Ysabel se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino-vacuno-porcino, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, contando con corrales apropiados y espaciosos. Ysabel vende sus ovejas y cerdos cuando estos han alcanzado el  tamaño y peso ideal. Además vende la leche de sus vacas. Sus ventas son realizadas en el mercado local 

Ysabel solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará para la implementación de un corral para cerdos y para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales.

Ysabel cuenta con  buenas referencias personales y un historial crediticio óptimo.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 55 years old, married, and she has a son that she supports together with her husband. They live in a community (a poor rural community where the housing is under development) and it is located in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. The principal business activities in the district are agriculture and farming. 

Her husband is an agriculturist who works on his own parcel of land. This season he has sown mango and cotton.

Ysabel raises sheep, cows, and pigs. She has had this business for 10 years and she has her own corrals and spaces. Ysabel sells her sheep and pigs when they have reached an ideal size and weight. She also sells the milk from her cows. She carries out her sales at the local market.

Ysabel requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles and she will use it to set up a corral for her pigs and to purchase balanced feed.

Ysabel has good personal references and an excellent credit history.

loans.use: to set up a corral and to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Baloon Group

texts.en:
M. is in his late 20s, is single with one small child. For the past two years, he has been a fishmonger. He works from 8:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night and is able to earn a fair monthly profit.

This will be M.'s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He has used his previous loans to increase his sales, start selling chips, and also to buy a motorcycle. He has successfully repaid all of his loans. 

M. will share this loan with his loan group. The group is called “Baloon” and has 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

He will use his portion of this group loan to buy more fish and chips to sell. In the future, his dream is to buy a tricycle (bajaji).

loans.use: to buy more fish and chips to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install security devices.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has been fishing in Naivasha for the last two years. She normally sells her fish in the local market. She is 36 years old and married to Christopher. They have three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more fish to add to her stock, as she does not want to disappoint her clients.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to grow in her business and get tenders to supply fish to major hotels in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to boost her stock

loans.name: Juana Mirtala

texts.es: La señora Juana de 56 años de edad, es viudas, tiene un hijo, vive en la ciudad de León . De oficio comerciante ella se dedica a la venta de ropa , tiene una tienda en el mercado central de león en donde vende desde hace mas de 18 años, antes se dedicaba a vender ropa ambulante en los barrios de la ciudad de león pero con la ayuda de su fallecido esposo y prestamos que hizo logro poner su tienda en el mercado , además viajo a honduras para poder comprar ropa y vender en Nicaragua , con el paso del tiempo su negocio fue prosperando y puso una pequeña pulpería y ha venido componiendo su casa . Con el firme propósito de seguir prosperando solicito el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería tales como ropa para niños, ropa interior para mujer, varón, camisetas. Al comprar la mercadería por cantidad mayor le sale mas barato y puede sacar mejor ganancia. Sus próximas metas son la graduación de su hijo que esta en la universidad., hacer crecer su pequeña pulpería y acondicionar mejor su local y vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old.  She is a widow, has one son, and lives in the city of León.  She is a saleswoman who sells clothes.  She has a store in León central market where she has been selling her products for more than 18 years.  She used to sell clothes as an itinerant vendor in the neighborhoods of the city of León.  However, with the help of her deceased husband and loans that she took out, she managed to set up her store in the market.  She also traveled to Honduras so that she could buy clothes to sell in Nicaragua.

Over time, Juana's business prospered.  She set up a small grocery store and has been making repairs to her home.  With the firm goal of continuing to prosper, she requested a loan to invest in buying merchandise such as children's clothes, women's and men's underwear, and t-shirts.  Buying her merchandise in bulk works out cheaper for her and she is able to make better profits that way.  Her future goals are to see her son, who is at university, graduate; to grow her small grocery store business; and to make improvements to her business premises and her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as children's clothes, women's and men's underwear, and t-shirts

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 32, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. She also has a small tailor shop in the town. She is married to Moses and they have four school-going children.  

Beatrice was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to improve her tailoring business.

In the future, Beatrice hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area and to also see her tailor shop grow and get many orders from her clients.

loans.use: to improve her tailor shop.

loans.name: Ines Dilenia

texts.en: Ines lives in Choluteca, Honduras, and is a single mother of three children. She makes a living by selling candy, chewing gum, and snacks, and primarily sells her wares near a local school. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL to purchase merchandise. In her spare time, Ines enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase bulk amounts of candy, chewing gum, and snacks.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: The picture above shows Esi displaying some loaves of bread and crates of eggs. She is a baker.  Esi is married to a driver and has 3 children. She attained a junior high level of education. Comfort, with the income she makes, assists her husband to educate her children. Comfort will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar, gas and crates of eggs. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, gas and crates of eggs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: 30-year-old Mary is a married woman living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to construct a family house in the near future. Mary owns a retail shop from which she sells African attire and airtime. She has been in this kind of business for five years. Her major challenge has been instability in product prices which affects the demand power of her customers. Mary needs the loan to buy African attire and airtime for resale.

loans.use: To buy African attire and airtime for resale.

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: habite a cité senghor elle vend des tissus de détails et elle s'approvisionne en Mauritanie et en gambie, avec ce pret elle veut retrouver le confort familial et réaliser un bénéfice important
texts.en: Sokhna lives in Cité Senghor and retails fabrics. She gets her supplies in Mauritania and Gambia, and would like to use this loan to turn a large profit and improve her family's comfort.

loans.use: to buy and resell fabrics

loans.name: Seiylkan's Group

texts.en:
Seiylkan is the leader of this group. She is 67 and married to a farmer. Seiylkan has raised a son who is now 24 and is also a farmer. In order to earn money and provide for their livelihood, Seiylkan and her family cultivate agricultural products and breed livestock. They sell part of their harvest and their fattened livestock and earn about 5,000 KGS per month. 

Seiylkan is requesting a loan to expand their livestock business and purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she hopes to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Milagros Del Pilar

texts.es:
Milagros de 21 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Milagros se dedica a la elaboración, venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad lo realiza desde hace varios años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado la venta de la chicha de jora en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Milagros a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora,  con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Milagros is twenty-one years old and lives with her husband and child in their own home which has light and water service in the rural region of the Department of Piura. All the inhabitants of this region make a living through agriculture, ranching, and handicrafts.

Milagros makes and sells chicha de jora (a tasty beverage made from corn and very popular in northern Peru). She has been doing this for several years, since it is a custom handed down from generation to generation. Lately, chicha de jora sales in the region where Milagros lives have increased, which has allowed her to be able to increase her revenue and improve her family’s quality of life.

Having the opportunity to grow, Milagros has requested a loan of 1000 PEN [$375] from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a greater quantity of corn flour to use to prepare chicha de jora. Her goal is to earn greater profits and also increase her customer base. In this way she can repay the loan awarded and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of corn flour to use to prepare chicha de jora.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia de 54 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo e hijos en casa de sus suegros, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Desde hace varios años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio.  Con esta actividad ella solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda  su familia.

Delia observa que va creciendo favorablemente su negocio, desea seguir ampliándolo con la compra de más mercadería como gaseosa y abarrotes en general.  Va a comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades lo que ayuda en bajar el precio que paga. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles. Delia es muy trabajadora, empeñosa y responsable frente a su negocio. Desea lograr mayores ingresos para brindarle mejores opciones en la vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Delia, age 54, lives with her husband and children in her in-law’s house.  The house has all of the basic services.  It is located in an urban zone in the Chepén district in the La Libertad department.  The people in this zone devote themselves to farming, livestock, and tourism.

For several years she has had a general store set up in her house.  She sells diverse daily consumption products and general groceries to her neighbors and customers.  She has established customers, and she does not have any competition close to her business.  Through this business she pays for her expenses and helps her family.

Delia notices that her business is growing favorably.  She wishes to continue expanding it with the purchase of more merchandise like soft drinks and general groceries.  She will buy products in large quantities, which will help lower the price that she pays.  

She therefore finds it advisable to request a loan for 1,200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Delia is a very hard-worker, and she is diligent and responsible in her business.  She wants to manage to get greater income in order to provide better options in her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like soft drinks and general groceries for her store.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en: Carolyn is a 36 year old married lady who is blessed with two children aged 9 and one year old. Only one child who is 9 years old goes to school. She has been running a tailoring and dressmaking business in Nairobi to make a living since 2002. She has employed one person to help her run the business. The major challenge she has faced is competition. She is requesting a loan for 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fabric. In the next five years, she wants to become more financially stable. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage her business with her previous loan. She describes herself as hardworking, visionary and committed.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, corn, soft drinks, juice, and snacks.

loans.name: Lourdes Massiel

texts.es:
Lourdes es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, ella tiene 25 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, eligio este tipo de trabajo porque le es muy rentable y recibe el apoyo de su hermana, ya lleva en el negocio por mas de 2 años.
Lourdes es una mujer  emprendedora, responsable y luchadora que día a día busca salir adelante ella y su menor hijo.
Lourdes ,  empezó su negocio en el año 2008 , gana semanalmente S/.250 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Lourdes invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería (ropa de temporada).  Su sueño de Lourdes es tener su casa propia y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija., su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente .

Lourdes  vive y trabaja en famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a single mother with a two-year old son. She is 25 and has worked selling clothing for two years. She choose this business because it is profitable and because her sister supports her.

Lourdes is a responsible, hard-working woman who tries hard every day to improve her family's life. She began her business in 2008, and she earns 250 new soles a week. With the loan of 1500 soles that she will receive thanks to Kiva she will purchase merchandise, specifically clothing from this season. Her dream is to have her own home and improve her son's quality of life. Her counselor thinks she is an excellent client. 

Lourdes works and lives in the famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have persevered despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.

loans.use: purchase merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en: Emilio is 48 years old, married and blessed with two school-aged children. For the last 20 years, he has earned a living by growing rice. He is applying for a loan for PHP 30,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizer. He is determined to work hard to provide for his family, and hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, ya que quiere construir un pequeño muro al final de su vivienda, ya que por ahí pasa una quebrada y él quiere mantener su hogar más seguro, para esto necesita comprar cemento, bloques, piedra y arena, esperando con estos materiales iniciar y finalizar la construcción del muro para evitar cualquier incidente con su familia.
El tiene efectos positivos de los préstamos anteriores apoyando a su familia y teniendo una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Martín is requesting a new loan, as he wants to build a small wall at the end of his property as there is a gully that passes alongside and he wants to make his home more secure.  In order to do this, he needs to buy cement, cinder-blocks, stone and sand.  With these materials, he hopes to be able to both start and finish construction on the wall, so as to avoid any kind of incidents with his family.

He has had positive effects from the previous loans on supporting his family and having better financial solvency.

loans.use: to purchase cement, cinder-blocks, stone and sand.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.es:
Arnold, tiene 38 años de edad, casado con tres hijos de 14, 13 y 6 años de edad, vive en el Dorado Santa Bárbara.
Arnold, hace 15 años que se dedica al cultivo de café, hace sus viveros luego los siembra,  cuenta con dos manzanas cultivadas, mas otros terrenos que fueron heredados por su padre, siembra café de variedad paca y catuaí. Lo vende en pergamino húmedo en el mercado local. Su familia también se dedica a esta actividad. Este producto actualmente es muy rentable.  
A solicitado 3 prestamos a ODEF, con ellos a podido mejorar sus cultivos. Actualmente va invertir en siembra de vivero de café, donde pagara mano de obra y fertilizantes. Su meta es mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Arnold, age 38, is married and has three children; ages 14, 13, and 6.  He lives in Dorado Santa Bábara.

Arnold has been growing coffee for 15 years.  He makes the seed beds, and then he plants them.  He has two “manzanas” (a manzana is just under half of an acre) and other land that he inherited from his father. 

He grows the “paca” and the “catuaí” varieties of coffee.  He sells the wet parchment coffee in the local market.  His family also devotes itself to this business activity.  This product is currently very profitable.

He has requested three loan from ODEF.  He has been able to improve his crops with those loans.  Now he will invest in planting the coffee nursery, pay labor costs, and buy fertilizers.

His goal is to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to plant the coffee nursery, to pay labor costs, and to buy fertilizers and manure, etc.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 40-year-old married woman who lives with her family, a husband and five children. She has enrolled all of her children into school. To meet their education expenses and to support her husband financially, she operates a clothes sales business. She has had several years of experience in her business. Her clientele base is her community clients and shop owners. She buys clothes from other different cities for quality and variety: that’s why her customers approach her to buy clothes. She makes a good income every month. 

Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her clothes sales business. She will invest the loan in buying different varieties of clothes  in bulk quantities for reselling. She is confident that she will make good sales from her business and further improve it.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy clothes for re-selling

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is married with 3 children. Belinda is 51 years old and lives in Mitugas,Tudela.

Belinda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living.  Belinda has been doing this for 27 years.  Belinda has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops. 

Belinda  has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Belinda hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina de 33 años convive con oscar de 32 años con quien tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en el centro poblado de Omaya del distrito de Pichari. Ricardina es una mujer de mucho talento para con los trabajos en la agricultura, ella cultiva cacao en su parcela que esta ubicado en el centro poblado de Omaya desde los 19 años de edad juntamente con su querido esposo. Ellos trabajan de lunes a viernes de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, mientras que los sábados se dedican a otro negocio. En su parcela agrícola, tiene cultivos de cacao, café que son productos que en estos últimos años está teniendo una buena acogida en los mercados nacionales e internacionales es por esta razón que Ricardina, continua incrementando sus cultivos de cacao con la finalidad de lograr una mayor producción para luego obtener un ingreso económico con el que pueda solventar los gastos económicos de su familia. Ricardina está feliz y contento con la actividad que realiza, por que hasta ahora todo le va muy bien gracias a ese esfuerzo que ella pone en su trabajo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente  el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Ricardina, 33, lives with Oscar, 32, with whom she has three children.  They live in the small town of Omaya in the district of Pichari.

Ricardina is a woman with a lot of talent for agricultural work.  She has grown cacao on her plot of land in the small town of Omaya along with her beloved husband since she was 19 years old.  They work Monday through Friday from 7:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon, while Saturday they work selling clothing in the market of their town.

On her plot of farmland she has cacao plants, which are very well-received products in the national and international markets these last few years.  This is why Ricardina continues increasing her cacao plants, with the goal of getting a larger crop to later have an income with which she can pay the family expenses.

Ricardina is happy and contented with the job she does because up to now everything has gone very well for her thanks to this effort she puts into her work.

This is her first loan with MFP, for which she promises to make her payments punctually.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy cacao plants.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants.

loans.name: Enangnon Group

texts.fr: ENANGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Elise Hortense (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 48 ans. Elise Hortense a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Elise Hortense est mariée à un certain Emmanuel. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Elise Hortense vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Elise Hortense et son mari. Pour cette raison, Elise Hortense vend de la bouillie et des beignets depuis quinze ans dans sa région, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Elise Hortense  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Elise Hortense sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe ENANGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, de la farine de blé, du sucre et des beignets.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a responsible, optimist and very hard-working woman; she is widow and has 4 children. She started her business when her husband was no with them, she knew that her children would need an education, support and food. Her house is in a commercial area where there are a lot people traffic, for that reason she bought some school articles and offer them out of her house to the people, she saw a great success and bought more school articles; having a better demand. Ruth began her new business and now her children collaborate with her when she needs.

Ruth is requesting for a loan of $925 USD to purchase school articles and sell them in her small business. She and her family hope this Christmas season her sales will increase more than another season. They require of your support and they thank your understanding.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Ruth es una mujer responsable, optimista y muy trabajadora, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos. Ella inicio su negocio al sentir que su esposo ya no estaba con la familia, sabía que sus hijos necesitarían de una educación, sustento y comida. Su casa esta en un área comercial donde transita mucha gente, por lo que a Ruth se le ocurrió comprar algunos artículos escolares y ofrecerlos afuera de su casa a la gente que pasaba, ella vio una gran respuesta por parte de las personas y compro mas útiles escolares; teniendo un mayor éxito. Ruth empezó su nuevo negocio y ahora sus hijos colaboran cuando se necesita.

Ruth y sus hijos requieren un préstamo de $925 USD para la compra de artículos escolares y poderlos vender en su negocio. Ella y su familia esperan que esta temporada navideña las ventas de Ruth se incrementen al doble. Ellos requieren de tu apoyo y agradecen tu comprensión.

loans.use: Purchase school articles

loans.name: Akouanvi

texts.en:
Akouanvi D., age 35, has been a merchant for ten years. She currently lives in the village of Agbanakin (in Les Lacs prefecture) and is married and the mother of two. Concerned about providing for her family and to create a proper way to live, she became specialized in stocking grains. Although a worthwhile endeavor, it is under-financed. So she is requesting a loan of $850 to buy sacks and some other items and materials for safekeeping her inventory of grains. She can then stock sizeable quantities of corn and thus meet the current high demand for it. The loan will also serve as working capital that will secure her income, which should reach a substantial level.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame D. Akouanvi est commerçante depuis 10 ans et vit actuellement dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Agée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Soucieuse de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de lui créer un cadre de vie décent, elle s’est spécialisée dans le stockage de céréales très rentable mais peu financé. Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui lui permettra d’acheter des sacs et des produits de conservation afin de faire un stock important de maïs et répondre ainsi à la demande qui est très forte. Ce fond lui servira également de fond de roulement, ce qui va sécuriser son revenu qui deviendra dès lors consistant.

loans.use: To buy materials for keeping grain, and to buy and stock up on corn

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan has a small farm where he grows rice and raises cattle. He has been working in agriculture his entire life after being taught by his father. He has four children, only one of which is still in school. His other three children live and work with him on his farm and help him produce rice. He wants to improve his home, because it is made only out of wood at the moment.

Juan is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water basins that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. The loans will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the freshwater Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in a rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: But

texts.en:
