Mrs. But V. is 22 years old and works with her husband to produce mortars and pestles. They earn about $2/day in this business, and it takes them many many hours to produce these products by hand.

Mrs. But V. is seeking a $400 loan so that she can purchase a machine to help produce her product. This machine will greatly help her and her husband to produce more of their product which is currently in high demand by their clients. As they save more money from their income, Mrs. But V. and her husband hope to purchase more tools to make the production process faster and more efficient.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to produce mortars and pestles

loans.name: Sepuita

texts.en: Sepuita's talent has become a major helping hand to her family. She’s a creative lady that enjoys designing materials. She never attended any training to learn how to print, but everything came natural to her. She’s a mother of only 1 son, who is six years old. Sepuita is now 42 years old and can’t have another baby, due to the removal of her other ovary that was infected. Her elei printing business has become famous to some of the Ministries in town. Her main customers are the employees of the Samoa Water Authority whom she supplies with printed yards of materials for their uniforms. Not only does she supply for the ministry, she also supplies individual orders from the employees and she says it’s now getting to the stage that she’ll need a helping hand in providing the materials - there is too much demand and she can’t handle it. So with her requested loan, she’ll be purchasing more materials and fabric paints for her production, and will also be looking at hiring someone to help her out with her business.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase more materials and fabric paints.

loans.name: Amevi-Margueritte

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Amévi-Margueritte was born June 11th, 1966 in Kolokopé. Married and the mother of three children, she has been selling eggs in Gbadago for the last six years knowing that the income of her retired husband isn't enough for the needs of their household. Even though she has a good command of her trade, she sometimes has difficulties making purchases. She would therefore like to have a 600 dollar loan to stock eggs to better satisfy her clients. Financial support of this project will increase her income in order to contribute to her household's needs.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme A. Amévi Margueritte est née le 11 juin 1966 à Kolokopé. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle exerce le commerce des œufs depuis 06 ans à Gbadago sachant que les revenus de son mari retraité ne suffisaient pas pour les besoins du foyer. Bien qu’elle ait une bonne maîtrise de son activité, elle a des difficultés pour faire les achats. Pour cela elle désire avoir un crédit de 600 dollars pour faire les stocks d’œufs pour bien satisfaire les clients.. L’appui financier apporté à ce projet augmentera ses revenus afin de contribuer aux besoins de son foyer.

loans.use: Stocking and sale of eggs

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Pov married in 1998 and has two sons and one daughter. She has been in the business of raising pigs since 2000. In addition, she produces rice alcohol. She does not only sell alcohol, but also has the waste from the production of rice alcohol as food for her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Sok Phoeun, before commencing his business of providing a transportation service, raised pigs at home with his wife, Mrs. Pov.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to expand the pig raising business.

loans.use: To expand pig raising business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 32-year-old Grace F.. She is married with two children, aged 2 and 7. In 2004 Grace established a barbecue business and now requests a loan of $450 in order to purchase ingredients in bulk for her tasty tandoori chicken. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mr. Seak S., 43, is married with four children and works as a taxi-driver making around $5 a day. His wife works at home, caring for their children (two of whom are in school) and cooking. Mr. Seak S. hopes to use this loan to fix his taxi, which is broken and needs to be repaired.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Yudelkis Altagracia

texts.en:
Yudelkis Altagracia is a thirty-two-year-old single mother of a thirteen-year-old girl. She lives in the Alceviejo community of Los Alcarrizos in Santo Domingo, the capital. Yudelkis sells a collection of chic pants to friends and other people in her community. She doesn’t have a big stock of products, but she makes purchases according to quantity ordered by her customers. Yudelkis says that business is going well, and that she’s getting more and more customers.

Yudelkis wants to stabilize and boost her business. She is requesting a loan to add shirts and underwear to her stock so as to offer more variety to her customers and attract more people.

loans.use: Purchase of an assortment of pants to restock a small business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is a 51-year-old married mother of six children living in Drobo, Ghana. For the past two decades, she has earned a living by purchasing pillows and mattresses from a nearby city and selling them at a profit in her own town.

Rose has applied for a loan of $625 U.S. dollars to purchase more inventory to sell. With the additional profits, she hopes to pay for her oldest son's college fees and support her family. She is a member of the group called Mount Sinai. The group members guarantee that each individual will re-pay her loan,

loans.use: To buy more mattresses and pillows for a small store

loans.name: Jeunes Femmes 2 Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of women inspired by one ideal and one will. We want to work for the power of women to make decisions in their milieu. Our principal activity is commerce. We plan to buy fruits and vegetables and process them into a finished product that we can then sell to the local population at a reasonable price. This will allow us to lighten the load of the housewife, provide autonomy for women, try to stop the exodus of women, and improve living conditions for group members.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Nous sommes un groupement de femmes animées d'un même idéal et d'une volonté qui œuvrent pour le pouvoir de décision des femmes dans leur milieu. Notre principale activité est le commerce. Il s'agit d'acheter des fruits ét légumes et de les transformer pour avoir un produit fini que nous allons revendre à bon prix aux populations locales. Ceci nous permettra d'alléger le panier de la ménagère, donner une autonomie aux femmes, lutter contre l'exode des femmes, améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres

loans.use:
purchase of fruits and vegetables for processing

achat de de fruits et légumes pour transformation

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 33-year-old father of two children. He lives with his family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Moussa sells car oil. This is the fifth time he has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Danaya group are mostly married women living in traditional extended families. They have on average three children and an average age of 32. They reside in the village of Banankoro (Kati prefecture) in the Koulikoro region.

The members of the group Danaya are linked to each other by ties of family, community, and friendship. To obtain financial resources to fill their fund of capital, they decided to collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which the Danaya group is on its first loan. After a series of four training sessions regarding community living and good business management, they obtained a loan in the end. They all work in small-scale commerce of various articles (soap, undergarments, condiments, etc.) at the marketplace in town. Each day, they get their supplies in bulk in Bamako, the capital of Mali. The sales are retail sales and are made at the marketplace by displaying the good or often by going door-to-door .

With this loan, they expect to realize a profit of 15,000 to 20,000 francs CFA each month. The women of the Danaya group hope to increase their profits substantially but also to diversify their sources of supplies.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Les membres du groupe Danaya sont en majorité des femmes mariées vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies et ayant en moyenne 3 enfants et 32 ans d’age. elles résident dans le village de Banankoro Préfecture de Kati Région de Koulikoro.

Les membres du groupe Danaya sont liés entre elles par des liens de consanguinité, de voisinage et d’amitié. Pour obtenir des ressources financières afin de completer leur capital, elles décidèrent de collaborer avec le programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso avec qui le groupe Danaya est à son premier prêt . Après une série de quatre formations portant sur la vie associative, la bonne gestion des activités économiques elles ont finalement obtenu un prêt. Elles mènent toutes le petit commerce d’articles divers ( savon, lingerie, condiments alimentaires etc.) au marché de leur localité. Elles s’approvisionnent hebdomadairement en gros à Bamako la capitale du Mali. Les ventes sont effectuées au detail au marché sur des étales et souvent de facon ambulante.

Elles comptent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 15.000 FCFA à 20.000 FCFA par mois. Les femmes du groupe Danaya espèrent augmenter substantiellement leurs profits mais aussi diversifier leurs sources d’approvisionnement.

loans.use: To buy various articles for small-scale commerce

loans.name: Mbae´pora Group

texts.es:
The Mba´apora Group was formed thanks to two women who felt the need to help their community because they had many friends and neighbors who really wanted to work and contribute to the family income. They decided to establish a women’s group and attended four meetings prior to receiving the loan. They then requested 300,000.00 Paraguay Guarani each, which was used to expand their businesses and purchase such goods as sugar, bread, machinery, meats, cold meat, dairy, etc. They also purchased goods for footwear, clothing, and fast food businesses, among others. The program is currently in its 2nd cycle, and the loan has increased to 500,000 Guarani each. Five new members have also joined the group. The Mba´apora Group would like to thank Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the courage that they are giving to all of these enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El comite Mba´apora se formo gracias a dos señoras que vieron la necesidad de ayudar a su comunidad, ya que tenian muchas vecinas y amigas con muchas ganas de trabajar y aportar al ingreso de sus familias. Decidieron conformarse en un comite de mujeres, asistieron a cuatro reuniones previas al credito y solicitaron 300.000 Gs cada una, que utilizaron para ampliar sus negocios realizando compras de mercaderias como azucar, panificados, maquinarias, productos carnicos y embutidos, lacteos, etc, e inclusive para emprender actividades como venta de calzados y ropas, venta de comidas rapidas, etc. Actualmente se encuentran en el 2do ciclo y han aumentado su credito a 500.000Gs cada una, asi tambien se han incorporado cinco nuevas integrantes. El comité Mba´apora agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y a Kiva el valor que les estan dando a todas las mujeres emprendedoras.

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, machinery, thread, sweets, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad. Angélica es casada, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Angélica viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región actividad que realiza 3 días a la semana, donde vende ropa variada, abarrotes, verduras, frutas y de las ferias compra quesos y animales menores los cuales los comercializa por mayor en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Además Angélica tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes, verduras para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos.

Angélica necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de faldas, chompas, pantalones, casacas. Los sueños de Angélica son sacar adelante a sus hijos, mejorar su casa y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the “Amor y Verdad” (Love and Truth) microfinance institute. Angélica is a 46-year-old married mother of 5 children. She travels to the different markets of the region 3 times a week to sell assorted apparel, provisions, fruits, and vegetables. At these markets, she purchases cheese and small animals, which she sells at the city’s wholesale market. Additionally, Angélica has her own in-home mini market where she sells provisions and vegetables. Her children help out with running the store.

Angélica needs a loan of 2,500.00 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of skirts, sweaters, pants, and jackets. Angélica dreams of helping her children get ahead in life, improving her house, and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase skirts, sweaters, pants, and jackets

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru:
Ашуров Рахим, 1961 года рождения, он женат и у них 5 детей. Рахим занимается необычным бизнесом, он производит и продает «Нос» (национальный табак).  Этот бизнес он унаследовал от своих родителей. На продаваемый им товар всегда есть спрос, так как местное население пользуются его товаром как например курение сигарет. Этот вид товара пользуется известностью и потребностью, придаваемое успокоение этого продукта ничем не сравнить, говорит Рахим.
Чтоб производить этот продукт Рахиму нужен табак, который является основным ингредиентом. Для закупа табака он хочет получить займ в сумме 4500 сомони.
texts.en:
Rahim A., was born in 1961, he is married and has 5 children. Rahim has an unusual business, he makes and sells “Nos” (traditional tobacco). He inherited this business from his parents. Rahim’s products are always in demand, since local residents use his product just like they would smoke cigarettes. This product enjoys popularity and demand, nothing can compare to the calmness that this product provides, Rahim says.

In order to make his product, Rahim needs to purchase tobacco, which is the main ingredient. Rahim would like to borrow 4500 somoni ($1200) in order to purchase tobacco.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tobacco

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy C. was born in 1962 and she now lives in the Svay village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Touch Kheang, is a driver (pictured here). They have four children, two of whom are employed in garment factory, and two repair cars. Because their work place is far from the house, they usually have to pay a great deal of money for transportation. Thus, Mrs. Chanthy C. requests a loan to add to her savings so she can buy a motorbike for her children to go to work.

loans.use: Add to savings to buy a motorbike for transportation to work

loans.name: Jenefa

texts.en:
Jenefa J. is currently in the business of selling beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Jenefa is 38 years old and is married with a husband that is a nurse. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  n 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Construct a house to rent

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị N.  năm nay 46  tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Thời gian đầu mới tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn để đầu tư đi thu mua phế liệu. Đến nay sau 10 năm tham gia vay vốn làm ăn hiệu quả hiện tại gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng chuyên sản xuất các loại cửa sắt phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm sắt về phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. is 46 years old. She originally joined TYM Fund in 1998 to borrow loans to invest in her scrap metal business. After 10 years, her investment grew and her family now owns a business specializing in manufacturing metal doors. Her business brings an income of 4,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in more materials to meet the needs of her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ThienN. Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Paula Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Paula es una mujer trabajadora desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar para sus familia, es docente de la secundaria  desde hade veinte años, tiene 49 años de edad, reside en el barrio Omar Trujillo en la capital de Managua, con tres hijos de 19,25 y 28 años de edad, dos de ellos trabajan y uno cursa la universidad. Sus planes es poder comprar un vehiculo ya que ha sido uno de sus anhelos, ya que por años ha viajado en ruta que van llenas, es por eso que ha ido ahorrando y con el apoyo que Afodenic esta brindando con crédito para poder comprar su vehiculo que se lo están ofreciendo en oferta lograra cumplir sus sueños lo cual va hacer de beneficios para poder viajar al trabajo y poder gozar con su familia un viaje placentero. Sus objetivos es poder ayudar a su hija que termine su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Paula is a hard working woman. She has worked since she was very young for her family. She has worked as a high school teacher for the past twenty years. Paula is 49 years old. She lives in Omar Trujillo, which is the capital of Nicaragua, Managua. She lives there with her three children who are 19, 25 and 28 years old. Two of her children have jobs and one is in college. Her plans are to be able to buy a car, since it has been one of her dreams for many years now. She has been commuting to and from work on a bus that is always completely full and very uncomfortable. For that reason she has been saving money and with the help of Afodenic she will be able to fulfill her dreams. This will allow her to be able to purchase a care to drive to and from work and to be able to enjoy with her family a pleasant commute. Her goal is to help her daughter to finish her university education and to become a professional.

(Translated by Ashlee and Katey of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Buy a Car to Commute to Work

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Halima has owned a small shop in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business from 6:00 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Halima is 29 years old, married, and has two children: ages 11 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Sarah, Priscila, Jamilah, and Veniranda, Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Sabatgul

texts.ru: Мирзоева Саъбатгуль проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 50 лет, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается животноводством уже 12 лет. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Поэтому она решил развивать бизнес и увеличить поголовье скота.В данный момент она планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купит пару голов бычков, которых она сможет реализовать после откормки. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabatgul M. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. She is 50 years old, married and has six children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years. This business solely supports her family. This is why Sabatgul decided to develop her business and increase the livestock headcount. Currently, she plans to obtain a loan in order to purchase a couple of bulls to raise and sell. She will be able to repay this loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y sus 4 hermanos. Se dedica a la crianza de pollos en una parte del terreno de su casa, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año atrás, y cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es criar bien a sus animales y que éstos lleguen a un crecimiento y peso correcto para llevarlos a vender al mercado y poder obtener un precio justo. Su negocio le es rentable porque cada 35 días, ya están listos sus pollos para la venta. Para el futuro, Maria quiere comprar un terreno para mandar a construir galpones y criar mayor cantidad de pollos. Con MFP tiene 3 préstamos, su banco comunal se llama “Nazareno” y le gusta trabajar ahí porque se lleva bien con todos sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de pollos bebés y alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
María is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents and 4 brothers. She raises chickens in a section of her family's yard. She began this work one year ago, and counts on the support of her entire family to get it done. She takes pleasure in raising her animals well, making sure that they grow up to a proper size and weight so that they can be sold for a fair price when she takes them to market. Her business is profitable for her because every 35 days a new group of chickens becomes ready to be sold. For the future, María wants to buy a plot of land where she could have sheds built and raise a greater number of chickens. She has had 3 loans with MFB. Her communal bank is called "Nazareno", and she likes to work there because her friends have all had good experiences with the bank. The money that she asks for will be invested in the purchase of chicks and chicken feed to use in raising them.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de pollos bebés

loans.name: Dodaroy

texts.en:
Dodaroy M., 50, along with her husband, a doctor, has raised four children. Dodaroy has been running a drug store for 12 years, selling only certified medicines, and because the store in located in a hospital, she has many clients and customers. She is now requesting a loan of $1500 USD in order to expand the business, with the increased income helping to finance higher education for the children. Dodaroy would like to assure Kiva lenders that she will repay the loan in nine months. Your generosity can change the lives of this family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase medicines to expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce and sell palm oil

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn T. is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP for additional capital for her sari-sari store. She is married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a barangay (village) councilor. They live in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. 
Marelyn is a regular member of Paglaum MPC under the Paglaum Development Program for Landless People program. She’s thankful to Paglaum for giving her the opportunity to borrow money that will be used for additional capital for her business and for having life insurance as security for their future.

loans.use: For capital for a sari-sari store

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Olambi

texts.ru: Оламби Курбонова проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 51 год. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Оламби более 11 лет занимается торговлей, она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует одеждой. Ее муж работает водителем маршрутного такси. Клиентка проаит кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот.
texts.en:
Olambi K. lives in Dushanbe city. She is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She has over 11 years experience trading and has a shop in the market where she sells clothing. Her husband is a taxi driver. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her trade turnover.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase trade turnover

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Claudina es conviviente  tiene 28 años tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años  que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Claudina estudio informática y está trabajando como cajera  en un hipermercado, pero su hermana la inscribió para que vendiera productos de belleza por catalogo  y también  vende joyas. 
Desde que Claudina esta en Finca pudo comprar más mercadería  y tiene un respaldo económico.
Claudina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de pulseras, anillos de plata y productos de belleza. 
El sueño de Claudina es poner una tienda bazar en la casa de su suegra.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the communal bank “Las Luciérnagas.” She lives with her partner, is 28 years old, and has two children: ages 5 and 7. Both are students in the state school. Claudina studied computer science and works as a cashier in a hypermarket, but her sister signed her up to sell jewelry and beauty products from catalogs. Claudina has been able to buy more merchandise and has more financial backing since she has been a member of Finca. She needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy bracelets, silver rings, and beauty products. Claudina’s dream to open a store (a bazar) in her mother-in-law’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de pulseras, anillos de plata y productos de belleza

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 66 years old and married with 15 children. His wife sells medicines. He has been in business for a long time. He hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen R. currently sells beer at her bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer to sell. Hellen is 42 years old and married to a security guard. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she intends to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Ana Florinda

texts.es: Doña Ana P. tiene 42 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su esposo  e hija, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de elaborar  Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío  Chaquiral, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 37-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon. Zeinab has been selling accessories for four years. She sells perfumes, beauty products, make up, hair accessories, and much more. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise and buy a shelf for her shop. This is her third loan and she has always repaid on time. 

Zeinab is special in her work because of her location. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and people from her region. When she first started her business, she had difficulty finding the proper place to open her shop. Zeinab decided to start her business because she had sales experience. Because before she opened her shop, she used to sell from her house. In the future, she plans to improve her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and buy a shelf for her shop.

loans.name: Albertina Januario

texts.pt:
Albertina Januário Fernando P. nasceu na cidade de Chokwe Província de Gaza, tem 29 anos de idade, frequenta 10 classe. Neste momento casada e com 2 filhos de 4 e 2 anos de idade, vive ainda com uma sobrinha de 9 anos que vai a escola enquanto outros frequentam escolinha. Para alem destes não sustenta mais ninguém, os seus parentes geram o seu próprio rendimento.

 Deslocou se para Boane no ano de 2001 saindo de Chokwe, e em 2005 devido a transferência do marido juntos se deslocam ate Ponta Douro, onde em 2008 casa se oficialmente. Reside actualmente em Boane embora o marido continuando na Ponta Douro trabalhando como técnico agrónomo da Quinta Ouro.
 
Desenvolve o seu negócio permanentemente na Ponta Douro, onde aprendeu esta actividade desde o ano de 2005 e tem 2 empregados. Quando aplica 10.000.00 mt na aquisição, consegue 15.000.00 na venda, o que lhe faz render cerca de 10.000.00 por mes e consegue poupar algum para no final de mes. O marido tem também ajuda nas despesas, de momento vive em casa própria.
 
Nunca teve outros empréstimos em outras instituições e este é o seu quinto empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00mt para compra de material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia e outros). Os outros empréstimos foram para a mesma actividade nos valores de 5.000,00mt;17.000,00mt duas vezes de 6.000,00mt.
Para o futuro pretende abrir um armazém de venda de ração, assim após a conclusão deste pretende solicitar mais empréstimo para fortificar o negócio.
texts.en:
Albertina Januário Fernando P. was born in the city of Chokwe, Gaza province, in Mozambique. She is 29 years old and is enrolled in 10th grade. She is married and lives with her two children aged 4 and 2, and a 9 year old niece, who also attends school. Besides the kids, she doesn't support anyone else. Her husband lives in a different city because of his work as an agronomist for the company Quinta Ouro. Albertina has a business and she makes around 10.000,00MT (U$375) per month. Her husband also helps with the household expenses, so they are able to save some money every month. This is going to be her 5th loan in the amount of U$375 to buy construction supplies (rocks, cement, sand, and others). The other loans were made for the same purpose. She dreams of opening her own animal feed mixer store, and improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction supplies (sand, rock, cement, others)

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Mrs. Emma O. is a 35-year-old married woman who is blessed with 2 children. She farms corn and she just harvested her corn crop. Her income from the harvested crop is only enough for her family’s needs. Emma needs additional capital to be able to buy corn seed. She has requested a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures. This loan will help Emma to start planting corn on her farm again.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
B. Sherali is 27 years old, married and has two children. He is a hardworking man struggling to feed his children and his parents who also live with him.

Sherali makes a living by selling the fabrics to make national dresses, and he has a trading place in the central local market of Istaravshan city. Sherali is trying to offer a wide range of goods in order to meet his customers' requirements and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income. Being a devoted father, Sherali is doing his best in order for his children to be well educated and happy.

Today, Sherali feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income. He is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to jumpstart the business and raise his family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible father give his children a brighter future.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Seeta Development Of Mukono Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 43 years old and married with five children, the youngest being 12 years old.

Sarah has a stall in Seeta Trading Centre where she has sold fresh produce and chickens for seven years.

She is so hard working and she has been able to repay back her loan with a lot of ease yet it has worked for her. She is happy that she has been able to transform her business by having more stock - hence more profits.

Sarah needs a loan to help buy more fresh food and chicken for resale.

Sarah is a determined and hardworking lady that has been able to cater for her family with the help of her husband.

loans.use: To buy fresh food and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is a 47-year-old married woman with six children aged between 10 and 20. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with eight people. Nulu takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.

Nulu incurs transport costs to and from buying human medicines from pharmacies and drug manufactures in Uganda. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Nulu works six days a week .She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She owns a drug shop in Bwaise, paying monthly rent of 60000/=. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves.

Nulu has been in this business for nineteen years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her fourteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of drugs and syrups. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent nursing home.

loans.use: To buy boxes of drugs and syrups

loans.name: Future Youths Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Future Youths' group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown. They want to expand their businesses but lack the required capital to enable them to do so. They have thus formed themselves into a group of three and applied to SMT/'Shine on Sierra Leone' for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With this loan, they can expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. In this way, their living conditions will improve to a new level.

Sulaiman K. on the left in the photo is the leader of this group. Sulaiman was born in Koindu in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children – one in class two and the other not yet of school-going age. Sulaiman sells phones, top-up cards for all the four networks, mobile phone accessories, and he recharges mobile phone batteries for a fee of SLL 1,000. Sulaiman has been doing business for ten – fifteen years now. With this loan, he will be able to expand his business by adding top-up cards, phone batteries and provisions (milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise etc) to it.

loans.use: Buying top-up cards, phone batteries, and provisions -- milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, etc.

loans.name: Bumi

texts.en:
Bumi is 44 years old, married, and has five children. Her two eldest children are in secondary school while the younger ones are in primary school. Bumi is a businesswoman who lives and works in Lagos. For the last ten years she has made a living by running a retail business selling drinks to customers. As a hardworking woman, she also runs a rental service in order to make additional profit. With the profits from her business, she is able to support and sustain her family financially.
Bumi is requesting a loan of 180,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell, especially during the festive season when there is an increase in demand and therefore an opportunity to make more profit. She sends her thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Natalia Mariel

texts.es: Natalia tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive en el domicilio de sus abuelos. Trabaja en una empresa de productos comestibles como encargada de ventas además de trabajar como educadora en un jardín de niños, cuenta con amplia experiencia en ventas. Natalia no tiene competencia al ser asalariada ya que recibe sueldo por parte de sus empleadores. Solicito el crédito para realizar la compra de una computadora portátil (laptop). Natalia tiene un buen comportamiento de pagos, buena voluntad y capacidad de pago, solo trabaja con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Natalia tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive en el domicilio de sus abuelos. Trabaja en una empresa de productos comestibles como encargada de ventas además de trabajar como educadora en un jardín de niños, cuenta con amplia experiencia en ventas. Natalia no tiene competencia al ser asalariada ya que recibe sueldo por parte de sus empleadores. Solicito el crédito para realizar la compra de una computadora portátil (laptop). Natalia tiene un buen comportamiento de pagos, buena voluntad y capacidad de pago, solo trabaja con nuestra institución. Natalia is 27 years old, is single, and lives in her grandparents' house. She works in a company in a food products company where she is in charge of sales. She also works as a teacher at a kindergarten and has ample sales experience.Natalia does not have any competitors since she is a salaried employee, receiving a salary from her employers. She is asking for a loan to purchase a laptop. Natalia has made her payments, has goodwill and the ability to pay. She only works with our organization.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of laptop

loans.name: Kurmanbayeva Jumagul`s Group

texts.ru:
Жумагул является лидером этой группы, ей 32 года, замужем и мать 1 дочери. Супруг в данное время занимается торговой деятельностью в городе Тараз, Казахстан. Жумагул занимается перепродажей скота на местном рынке. В среднем каждую неделю ее товарооборот составляет 20 000 сом. В обороте у нее 4 коровы и 10 овец. Половина кредита будет использована для того, чтобы начать новый бизнес, а именно реализацию носков, оставшаяся часть инвестирована в текущий бизнес. В будущем она планирует довести еженедельный товарооборот до 100 000 сомов. 

Нурзат 19, пока не замужем, но собирается в скором будущем. Она живет вместе с матерью и 3 братами. После окончания школы, Нурзат хотела продолжить образование в ВУЗе, однака из за отсуствия денег, ей пришлось ненадолго отложить свою мечту и занятся бизнесом. У ее семьи есть земельный надел, где они выращивают пшеницу, кукурузу, семечки. За счет дохода от сельского хозяйства она смогла оплатить стоимость образования и поступила в экономический факультет. Кредит будет использован для закупа двух коров для дальнейшей отправки на пастбище. После окончания ВУЗа, она планирует устроится на работу в один из местных банков.

Замирбеку 35 лет. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Супруга домохозяйка. Замирбек занимается реализацией риса в Узгене. Стоит отметить, что узгенский рис славится далеко за пределами не только области, но всего Кыргызстана. Кредит будет использован для закупа 100 кг риса, а также чтобы купить 2 овца. 

Рахат 35 лет, она замужем и мать 3 детей. Супруг работает таксистом по местному маршруту. Сама она занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно выращиванием семечек, риса, пшена. Собственный земельный надел расположен недалеко от ее дома, что очень удобно. Кредит будет использован чтобы купить 300 кг семена пшена, а также удобрения для весеннего посева. 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Jumagul is the leader of this group. She's thirty-two years old, married and has one daughter. Her husband works as a salesperson in the city of Taraz, Kazakhstan. Jumagul sells livestock on the local market. On average, her weekly turnover is 20000 soms. That mainly includes four cows and ten sheep. Half of the loan will be used to start a new bussiness selling socks, and the other half will be invested in the current bussiness. In the future, Jumagul plans to increase her weekly turnover to 100000 soms. Nurzat, 19, is'nt yet married but plans to in the near future. She lives with her mother and three brothers. After finishing school, Nurzat wanted to continue her education in college, however, due to the lack of money, she was forced to postpone her dream and begin working. Her family owns a plot of land, where they grow wheat, corn and sunflower seeds. With the profits from their bussiness, she was able to pay for college and is studying to become an economist. The loan will be used to purchase two cows. After finishing college, she plans to find a job in one of the local banks. Zamirbek is thirty-five years old. He has a wife and two children. His wife is a housekeeper. Zamirbek sells rice in Ozgen. It should be noted that Ozgen rice is praised well beyond the borders not only of the region but of Kyrgyzstan as well. The loan will be spent on purchasing 100 kilograms of rice and two sheep. Rahat is thirty-five years old, married and is a mother of three children. Her husband works as a taxi driver on a local route. Rahat grows sunflower seeds, rice and millet. Her field is located close to her house which is very convenient. With the loan she plans to obtain 300 kilograms of millet seeds and fertilizer for the spring sowing.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 50% of loan will be used to start up new business: socks trade, other 50% for animal sales

loans.name: Ney

texts.en:
Ney C., 53, is a cleaner in a night club and started her work a year ago. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to seven children. Six of them are single and the other one is married. 

Ney C. has a daughter who is no longer in school and now works with her in the same field and place. Ney C. is taking out her loan to purchase a new motorbike, which she will use to ride to her work location. She is hopefully that the loan will help her reduce expenses from hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase video game discs, controls, memory cards, and a television

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda S. is from the village of Dawo. She is 47 years old, single, and has a school-aged child. To make a living, she runs a general store  selling a variety of different products. Rosenda has been in the business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Rosenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her inventory. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosenda from PMPC and the second from KIVA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, tiene 38 años, tiene un hijo llamado Kevin  de cuatro años. Ella es una joven responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. 

Armandina se dedica a la venta útiles escolares y pasamanería. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Armandina pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 6 años que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos, lapiceros y muchos útiles más para implementar su librería. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Armandina lives in the city of Urubamba. She is 38 years old and has a four-year-old son named Kevin. She is a responsible woman who looks for every opportunity she can to progress and help her family. Armandina sells school supplies and adornments. She has been working in this business for ten years. The business has been doing well thanks to the determination she devotes to her work. Armandina belongs to the Third Millenium Community Bank of the Arariwa Association. She has been a member of this community bank for the past six years. Her first loan was for 100 dollars, which she used to invest in her business. She would like this loan in order to buy notebooks, pencils and other items in order to increase her inventory of school supplies. This member is thankful for the opportunity provided by the bank and she promises to pay back the loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Armandina would like this loan in order to buy notebooks, pencils and other items.

loans.name: Leakhena

texts.en:
Mrs. Leakhena K., 28, and her husband, Mr. Nob Nheb, 33, live in a small village along National Road Number Three, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2002 and have two daughters, both still young. Leakhena also has her elderly mother living with her. 
 
Leakhena has been a garment factory worker for 14 years. Her husband is a construction worker. She is applying for her first loan of $400 to purchase construction materials for her brother’s construction business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her brother’s construction business

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en: Mrs. S., 24, is a married woman. She and her husband are blessed with a young child who is enrolled in school. Mrs. S. is a laborer who sews clothes in a garment factory, earning a suitable salary. Another source of income for the family comes from her husband’s taxi business. Mrs. S.’s husband complains that he cannot attract as many clients as before because his old taxi has broken down often, and his income has been affected. Because of this reasonable problem, Mrs. S. decided to ask for a loan in order to replace the old taxi.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old taxi

loans.name: Retchel

texts.en: Retchel T. is from the village of Iniawan, Poblacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Retchel is married and has an infant. To make a living, Retchel raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Retchel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Retchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Retchel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise. Retchel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional piglets to raise. This will be the second loan taken out by Retchel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Vai

texts.en: Vai S., 25, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. She prepares fabrics at home for an income of $2 US per day. Her husband is employed at a private company, earning an income of about $5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Cheri Mai

texts.en:
Cheri Mai M. is a shopkeeper in Thecho, Village. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are farmers. Mrs. M. lives in a joint family home with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Tulshi M., works in a private office. Her older son is a teacher and her younger son is in grade 10.

Mrs. M. opened her grocery shop 7 years ago. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulse, biscuits, and noodles in her shop. Her children also help her in her work. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in that area so she is requesting her second loan of NPR 10,000 to buy grocery items to meet the demand. She is very grateful for your support.

A major part of her income goes toward her children's education.

loans.use: To buys grocery for her store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva S. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Eva is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns & operates a business venture operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle services in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide moto-service. Eva is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Eva from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide motorcycle service

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Evelyn is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishes to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nancy Prudencia

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy tiene un negocio ubicado en la zona de el tejar, donde vende fruta de temporada al por mayor, ella rescata de los camiones viajeros y lo vende a segunda mano, ella tiene una casita que recién la construyo en la zona de alto Ovejuyo, donde vive juntamente con el esposo y sus hijos quienes estudian en la universidad, uno de ellos ya es independiente , el esposo es transportista de taxi particular, realiza viajes a los yungas en algunas épocas y en la mayoría trabaja c como taxista libre, es una cliente antigua y muy responsable anteriormente fue cliente kiva por lo que se solicita nuevamente este crédito, con el dinero del crédito comprara frutas como papaya, mandarina , coco, etc. y con el resto del dinero lo utilizara en el mantenimiento de la movilidad de su esposo,  la Sra. Nancy es una persona muy trabajadora siempre velando por el bienestar de su familia, en la foto la Sra. Nancy se encuentra acompañada de su Sr. esposo.
texts.en:
Nancy has a business in the El Tejar zone where she sells seasonal fruit at wholesale. She acquires it from passing trucks and resells it. She has a small house she recently built in Alto Ovejuyo where she lives with her husband and children who are university students. One of them is already independent. Her husband is a private taxi driver who makes trips to Los Yungas (The Yungas is a stretch of forest along the eastern slope of the Andes Mountains from southeastern Peru through central Bolivia) during some seasons but mostly works as an on-call taxi. She is a long-standing, responsible client who has been a Kiva client in the past. She is once again asking for a Kiva loan to buy fruits like papaya, mandarin oranges, coconut, etc. The rest of the money will be used for her husband’s vehicle maintenance and repair. Nancy is a very hard working person who is always watchful of her family’s wellbeing. Nancy’s husband appears with her in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata T. N. est âgée de plus de 42 ans, mariée, elle  réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Mamassoni, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso.
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle décida  de s’initier à l’activité  de préparation et de vente du crème traditionnelle “Dèguè” à base de céréales, du sucre et du lait et cela depuis plus de douze ans. 
L’insuffisance des ressources propres pour bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de la demande de ce prêt auprès de Soro Yiriwaso afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt elle est à son deuxième qui sera utilisé pour  acheter, 5 sacs de farine de sorgho, 4 sacs de sucre et 2 sacs de lait en poudre sur place. Elle vend ses crèmes traditionnelle “Dèguè” au grand marché de Sikasso et sa clientèle est composée des femmes et surtout des foraines. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre l’essentielle des dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata T. (No 2) is a married woman over 42 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in Mamassoni, a neighborhood on the outskirts of Sikasso. After attempting several activities without success, she decided over 12 years ago to engage in the preparation and sale of Dèguè, a traditional cream of cereal, sugar and milk. Lacking the resources to carry out this activity successfully, she requested a loan from the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to better meet the needs of her clientele, which is steadily increasing. Having repaid a first loan without incident, she is seeking a second one to buy 5 bags of sorghum flour, 4 bags of sugar and 2 bags of powdered milk, on location. She sells her traditional Dèguè cream at the big market of Sikasso to a clientele composed of women, mostly fair-goers. With this loan, she hopes to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover the bulk of the family expenses and to pay the interest on the loan, any remainder to be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the preparation of Dèguè (cream of cereal)

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza  nace hace poco mas de 1 año para tener acceso al crédito y demás servicios que ofrecen la fundación.
Se unieron varias vecinas que se conocen desde hace varios años y a partir de ahí tomaron el habito de reunirse todos los domingos por las tardes, se ayudan bastante y todas juntas están aprendiendo a construir su comité. 
La Sra. Emilia es una de las integrante y se dedica a la venta de ropas y teniendo en cuenta la llegada de la nueva estación deséa incrementar sus ingresos adquiriendo en cantidades a precios de mayoristas, ropas de temporada primavera-verano y así aumentar sus ganancias, abaratando los precios de costo.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo y desea seguir haciendolo ya que le ayuda bastante para los gasto de la familia.
Su puesto de venta lo tiene en su casa y tambien recorre en la casa de conocidos para vender sus mercaderias, ella recurre a distintas formas de vender para aumentar sus ingresos y comenta que los creditos la ayudan para renovar sus mercaderias.
texts.en:
The committee called “La Esperanza” (The Hope) was established more than a year ago so that the members could access credit and other services offered by Fundacion Paraguaya. The group consists of different neighbors who have known one another for several years. They are accustomed to the habit of meeting every Sunday afternoon so that they could help one another and learn how to build their committee.

Sra. Emilia is one of the members who sell clothing. With the arrival of a new season, she wants to increase her earnings by purchasing in quantity so that she can obtain the wholesale price. By acquiring clothes for spring and summer at a lower cost, she hopes to generate more revenue. Emilia has been in this business for some time and wants to continue so that she can help with the family expenses.

Her vending post is located at her house, but she also travels to the homes of her acquaintances to sell her merchandise. Emilia finds different ways of selling her goods in order to increase her profits. She says the loans have helped her replenish her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Gladys Yahaira

texts.es: La  Sra. Gladys Yahaira R. A.  ella  es trabajadora Activa de Distribuidora “R. S.A” desempeñándose como Responsable de Cobro , tiene  cinco años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys Yahaira R. A. is employed by Distribuidora “R. S.A” as a Debt Collector.  She has been working for this firm for five years.  She is married and has a school aged son.

She has had three previous CEPRODEL loans that she used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.

Ceprodel loans have been very beneficial for her in that they have improved hers and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: For cement, iron rods, sand, stone.

loans.name: Armando's Group

texts.en: Armando P. is from the village of Jurisdiccion, Alcala, Cagayan. He is 48 years old. Armando is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Armando is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Armando raises pigs for breeding. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2005, Armando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Armando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Fredrick Muchunu

texts.en:
Fredrick has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last three years.  He is 30 years old, married to Joyce Wangari, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy goats for slaughter and sell the meat from his butcher shop.

In future, Fredrick hopes to grow his butcher shop and be able to fill large orders for meat.

loans.use: To buy goats which he will rear and slaughter for sale

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is 30 years old. She is married to a motorcyclist and has two children who are between two and five years old. Dativa sells different items in her shop such as lotion, biscuits, juices and mineral waters. She has been doing this business for about three years. Most of her time is spent in her business and that is why her business prospers.  

She has requested this loan to increase her sales and buy more lotions, juices and mineral water to sell. Dativa would like to use the profits for savings. In the future she dreams of owning a prosperous business offering a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more lotions, biscuits, juice and mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel C. is from the village of San Jose, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Raquel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

location.town: San Jose, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys K. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Gladys has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works seven days out of every week. Gladys sells her products in a shop on a retail basis.  

Gladys has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes and rice. The main business challenges for Gladys include seasonality and transportation.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to educate her children up to university. Gladys lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff like bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Buyantogtoh

texts.en:
Buyantogtoh L. is a single parent who lives with her three children. Her oldest daughter is disabled and stays at home, while her younger two children both attend a local high school. Buyantogtoh supports her family by operating a clothes-making business in her town, sewing not only the traditional Mongolian coat called deel, but also dresses.

Having worked in a tailoring business for many years, she gained much experience as a seamstress. She started her own business in 1992 after retiring from a dressmaking company, and over the years has expanded her product line to make a variety of evening dresses. She has built a positive reputation amongst her customers because of the good quality of her products.

A modest woman, Buyantogtoh is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for 1,250,000 MNT and a new sewing machine for her business at 250,000 MNT.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and a new sewing machine

loans.name: La Alternativa 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a middle-aged woman that lives in Samaná, Dominican Republic. As a mother of 5 children, her small vending business allows her to support her family's income, by adding to the income from her long term partner. With this particular loan, Ruth is looking forward to the possibility of acquiring more inventory such as cosmetics and beauty products. The earnings from her business will allow her to continue to support her children and put her one step closer to her dream, which is to run an ice cream store.

Ruth is just one member of the 10 person group, La Alternativa 1 & 3. Together, these Dominican entrepreneurs are able to unite in solidarity, allowing them access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the other members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

Ruth has been an Esperanza associate for 5 years. This is her 11th loan. All her previous loans have been paid and invested in her business. Her story is representative of this group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samaná, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Theodosie

texts.en:
Theodosie is 30 years old, married and has two children who are three and five. Both her children attend school. Theodosie sells grocery items such as sugar, maize flour, and rice, which she has done for nine years. Her husband is a soldier.  

Theodosie will use the loan to add more merchandise such as sugar, maize flour, and rice.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Theodosie plans to build a house and rent that house out to generate more revenue in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as sugar, maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en: Marianne has a 9 year old child, and she is married. She sells adult secondhand clothing and she works with her husband. Her business is doing well. She has done it for six years. Marianne is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothing to make more profits and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing

loans.name: Veng

texts.en: Veng A., age 33, is married with one child who is studying at university. She earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she is also a domestic rice trader who owns a rice hulling machine inside her home. She provides a rice milling service to her neighbors. Her husband is a medical doctor. She says that she wants to take her finished products to sell in the other province, but she lacks the money to buy product. To solve this situation, Veng A. is applying for a loan to buy rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill; she will then sell her finished rice to people for income. With the rest of the funds, she would purchase a used motorcycle to transport her rice for selling in the mobile place.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill, and then sell finished rice for income.

loans.name: Wandile Group

texts.en:
Bahlakaniphile is 65 years old and married with 3 children, aged 20, 28, and 30. One of them is still attending school. She sells meat, vegetables, fruit, and clothes from her home. She has other four relatives that she lives with and takes care of. She also receives other income from the government's old age support grant. In the photo, she is the second from the left.

She's been in this business for over 6 years. She says that the main challenge to her business is that the customers buy on credit and pay later than she expected. Bahlakaniphile would like to own a big vegetable market and butchery in five years' time.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy fruit and vegetables, meat, clothes, and cold drinks. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children to university and driving school. In five years' time she would like to build a shelter specially for her business. 

She added that KIVA and WDB are very helpful to them because they can easily manage to do their businesses from their very own home.

loans.use: Buying meat, cold drinks, clothes, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 52 years old and married with four children.

Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.
