Amelita has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from tricycle transport.

Amelita aspires to expand her business and plans to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ayele

texts.fr: Madame Ayélé à 27ans, elle est couturière et réside  à Kégué (un quartier du Togo). Elle est mariée à un revendeur et à 02 enfants en charge. Ayélé à crée son salon de couture depuis 2006 et  a pour nom « TOP CREATION » elle  emploie 06 personnes. Elle désire en plus de son activité faire le commerce des articles de mercerie et des produits de premières nécessités. Elle fait son approvisionnement au Grand marché de Lomé et revend à Kégué. Ce premier prêt  lui permettra de relancer son activité afin de prospérer et de mieux s’occuper de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs Ayélé is 27 years old; she is a seamstress who resides in Kegue (a neighborhood in Togo). She is married to a retailer and has two dependent children. Ayélé created her sewing room in 2006 under the name "TOP CREATION." She employs six people. In addition to her activity, she wants to retail sewing supplies and first-necessity products. She procures her supplies on Lome's Great market, and retails in Kegue. This first loan will allow her to relaunch her activity to prosper and take better care of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies and first-necessity products

loans.name: Jessica Vanessa

texts.es:
Jessica es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno.  Es madre soltera y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.  Jessica cuenta con grado de instrucción  educación superior.
Viene  trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años.  Su préstamo inicial fue por S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos de belleza por catálogo.
La señora requerirá de un nuevo préstamo por la suma  de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá comprando: cremas, colonias, maquillajes, joyas, etc, 
Paralelamente se dedica a la refracción de  cocinas, para luego venderlas; en este negocio le ayuda su papá.
Su sueño es trabajar en su carrera (turismo hotelería)  o tener un hotel.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad de los préstamos y lo que puede ahorrar.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the “Victor Echave” community bank which is located in Puno district, province and department.  She is a single mother and has one school-age child.  She completed her higher education.

Jessica has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her initial loan was for 300 Peruvian soles.  She invested that money in her business selling beauty products through a catalog.  She needs this new loan for 1,500 soles to invest in buying creams, cologne, makeup, jewelry, etc.

In parallel with this work, Jessica also works refurbishing stoves for later resale.  Her dad helps her in this business.

Jessica's dream is to work in the profession she studied towards (tourism and hotel management) or to own a hotel.

What Jessica likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans and what she is able to save.

loans.use: to buy creams, cologne, makeup, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Estela

texts.es:
Vilma tiene  37 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo e hija. Ellos viven en la parte urbana del  distrito Tambogrande  en Piura. 

Su esposo es contador público y Vilma se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza, en su propio domicilio y entregando pedidos a clientes conocidos. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de un año. 

Vilma solicita un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa que destinará en la compra de cosméticos de mejor calidad para su negocio. 

Esto satisfará las necesidades de sus clientes y le permitirá a Vilma tener un mayor número de ventas y así ampliar su negocio con lo que podrá ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband and daughter.  They live in the urban part of Tambogrande district, in Piura.

Vilma's husband is a certified public accountant.  Vilma sells cosmetics and beauty products in her own home and also delivers orders to already-known customers.  She has been in this business for more than one year.

Vilma is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the money to buy better-quality cosmetics for her business.  This will satisfy her customers' needs and allow Vilma to make more sales and thereby expand her business.  This will enable her to help her husband with their family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy better-quality cosmetics

loans.name: Huatajata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUATAJATA” iniciará el ciclo número dos en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Alejandrina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio 
 
La señora Alejandrina indica que es el segundo año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace dos años atrás, negocio que aprendió de amiga.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de mercadería (compra de flecos y lana) los que comprarán de la feria 16 de julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y los venderá en la misma feria los jueves y domingo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.

En la fotografía podemos observar que la señora Josefa no aparese, ya que no es permitido por su cultura
texts.en:
The nonprofit “Huatajata” began their second loan with Pro Mujer, as a part of Germán Busch’s focal group. The group is made up of nine members; the communal bank is run by a board headed by Mrs. Alejandrina. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied since they are in the sales, production and service sectors.

Mrs. Alejandrina says that this is the second year that she has been a part of the Pro Mujer Communal Bank, as she was invited to join by a promoter. At present, she has worked for two years weaving blankets, a trade that she learned from a friend.

The loan is to increase her merchandize (to buy fringes and wool) which will be bought at the 16th of July fair (a marketplace in the city of El Alto) and will be sold in the same market on Thursdays and Fridays. This work will allow Mrs. Alejandrina to have more income to support her family since she is married and has eight children.

In the picture we can see that Mrs. Josefa is not pictured since it is not allowed by her culture.

loans.use: buy merchandize like fringes and wool.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 45 años de edad, cuenta con casa propia,  la cual está ubicada en la parte rural del distrito de Catacaos, en el departamento de Piura en el norte del Perú.

Gregoria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha (bebida oriunda del Perú, hecha a base de maíz y jora) esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años en su domicilio, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro ya que es una actividad desarrollada de generación en generación. Ella se encarga de distribuir su bebida en los alrededores de su comunidad. Gregoria cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Además esta es una actividad desarrollada  también por hermanas de la titular. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Gregoria está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar productos para la elaboración de chicha ya que desea empezar la venta en el distrito de Catacaos y así ampliar el margen de distribución de su producto.

Gregoria es una  persona emprendedora y responsable, ella desea poder crecer como empresaria y poder alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 45, lives in her own house which is located in the rural part of the Catacaos District in the department of Piura in the north of Perú.

She makes and sells "chicha" (a drink from Perú made with corn and "jora"), and has been in this business from her home for five years.  She is an expert because it something that is passed on from generation to generation.  She distributes her product around the community and has an established customer base in the area.  Her sisters also do the same work and have established customers.

Gregoria is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy ingredients to make chicha in her aim to start selling in the district of Catacaos and, thus, broaden her established customer area.

Gregoria is an enterprising woman and very responsible.  She wants to grow her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "chicha".

loans.name: Arther

texts.en:
Arther has worked in Quarries in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He extracts stones to sell in the local market. He is 36 years old, married to Caroline and they have four school going children. 

Arther was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He is planning to start poultry farming and he will use the loan amount as capital for the business. 

In the future, Arther hopes to grow in both business, i.e quarry and poultry rearing.

loans.use: to start poultry farming on his piece of land.

loans.name: Sarouen

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Sarouen and her husband fish for a living, earning a combined income of $4.6 per day. They have three children, one a factory worker earning $3 per day and the other two students. Every month, Sarouen has to spend $80 on food, $15 on electricity, and $10 on school fees. If she can save more money, she expects to buy a new boat to replace their old one.

Sarouen is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter's commute to work and for other family use as well. She has a strong commitment to send her other two children to university to study.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her daughter's commute to work.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla, 28, has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town for the last four years. She is married to Benson and they have one child, who is one and a half years old.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy three bags of potatoes and one crate of tomatoes to add to her stock.

In the future, she hopes to expand and open a big grocery store in a more permanent place.

loans.use: to buy three bags of potatoes and one crate of tomatoes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María soltera, sus hijos ya mayores independientes, los planes son seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda. Mujer emprendedora tiene  su propio negocio venta de cosa de horno. Su negocio lo tienes desde hace un tiempo iniciándolo con fondos propios, aumentar las ventas son sus planes a corto plazo.
Con el préstamo construirá la pared del lado lateral de la casa por lo cual requiere comprar los siguientes  materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, piedras canteras, hierro, tablones de maderas, perlines entre otros. Obteniendo mayor protección para su familia.
texts.en:
María is single and her children are now adults.  Her plans are to continue improving the infrastructure of her house.  She is an enterprising woman who has her own business selling baked items.  She started her business with her own funds and has had it for some time now.  Increasing her sales are a part of her short term plans. 

With the loan she will build a wall on the lateral side of her house which will require the purchase of the following construction materials:  cement, sand, gravel, blocks, quarry stones, iron, wood boards, metal beams, etc.  This will help her to better protect her family.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Kakakuona Group

texts.en:
Rahel, who is in her mid-20s, married, and the mother of a small child, has had a general store business for three years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rahel's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, having used her previous loan, since repaid, to purchase 20 bags of rice. She will use this loan to buy another 20 bags of rice and some fabrics to sell door to door. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Rahel will share this loan with her loan group "Kakakuona," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of rice and some fabrics to sell door to door.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer is a 37-year-old man who has been engaged in livestock breeding for the last six years. He buys calves, raises and fattens them, and then resells grown cattle in the central Bilasuvar bazaar. His monthly profit is about $150 and he wishes to increase it to $300. He would like to purchase more livestock, and for this purpose, he needs a 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan. Azer promises to pay it back in an accurate manner.

loans.use: to purchase three calves.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Lourdes tiene un salón de belleza y necesita el capital para la compra de un casco eléctrico para permanentes, para ondulaciones,  ella vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos en su propia casa la cual le costo mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, ahora ella quiere mejorar y agrandar su negocio su negocio funciona en su propia casa ya que ella vive muy cerca  de una avenida  concurrida y es el único salón de belleza por la zona, ella es la única peluquera y peinadora el sueño mas grande que tiene es darles lo mejor a sus hijos, ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien, es una persona muy emprendedora, trabajadora y con ganas de superación de mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Lourdes has a beauty salon and needs capital to buy an electric permanent wave apparatus (helmet-style).  She lives with her husband and two small children in their own house which they bought through much effort and hard work.  Now she wants to improve and expand her business which is set up at home.  She lives near a busy avenue and hers is the only beauty salon in the area, so she is the only hairdresser around.  Her dream is to provide her children with the best she can and see them become professionals and good citizens.  She is very enterprising and a hard worker and is intent on improving her and her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a permanent wave apparatus for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Connie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned good, snacks and beverages.

Connie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Connie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned good, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.fr:
Client  âgé de 42 ans et célibataire sans enfant.Ayant fini ses études universitaires, et ne trouvant  pas du travail, il a crée une micro-entreprise axée sur la vente des produits alimentaires et vivres frais  en détail.


il a bénéficie de plusieurs cycles de pets, il a gère une boucherie , avec une capacité de vente et des  remboursements efficaces. 
Avec une demande aussi  forte,le quatrième prêt lui a permis d'ouvrir  une chambre froide , il a achète des cartons de vivres frais comme le poisson, la viande de bœuf , des cotes de porcs et de la volaille
 Il envisage beaucoup épargner et a l'heure actuelle , il est entrain d'atteindre petit a petit ses objectifs.

 Exemplaire dans ses attributs d'homme d'affaire il entretien  des relations d’amitié et de bonne coopération dans sa communauté.
texts.en:
This client is forty two years old and single, without children. Having finished his university studies and not finding any work, he created a small business based on the retail sale of food products, including fresh food.  

He has benefited from several loan cycles, and has managed a butcher shop with a capacity for sales and effective repayments. With an equally strong request, the fourth loan has permitted him to open a cold storage room. He purchased boxes of fresh food like fish, beef, pork chops and poultry. 

He plans to save a lot, and right now he is in the process of accomplishing his objectives little by little. Exemplary in his characteristics as a businessman, he maintains friendly relationships and good cooperation in his community.

loans.use: To open a cold storage room and purchase fish, beef, pork chops and poultry.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cristina, de 43 años de edad, habitante de la cuidad de León, madre de 4 hijos, todos ellos independientes, ella es maestra de profesión pero al mismo tiempo es comerciante, ella tiene una mini- tienda de ropa. Ella trabajo 12 años como maestra de una escuela primaria pero al renunciar busco otra manera de cómo ganarse el pan de cada día de manera honrada así que con el dinero que le dieron de su liquidación puso su tienda de ropa  usada para vender.  

Ella solicita el préstamo para hacerles mejoras y reparaciones a su casa y darle una mejor presentación a su tienda para poder atraer clientes, hacerles sentir confort en su tienda e invertir en mercadería nueva para vender. Le gustaría dar publicidad radial para darse a conocer mas en todo su vecindario y en lo futuro poner dos tiendas de ropa usada.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Cristina is 43 years old and a resident of the city of Leon. She has 4 children, all independent. She is a teacher by profession but is also a merchant. She has mini-store selling clothes. She worked for 12 years as a primary school teacher but on resigning looked for another way to earn her daily bread in an honest way. With her severance pay, she set up a used-clothes shop. 

She is asking for a loan to make improvements and repairs to her house and give her shop a better appearance to attract customers, make them feel comfortable in her shop and also to invest in new merchandise to sell. She would like to subscribe to radio advertising to be better known around the neighbourhood and in the future set up 2 used-clothes stores.

loans.use: to make improvements and repairs to her house to give her shop a better appearance so as to attract customers and make them feel comfortable in her shop and invest in new merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana lives in the village of Misaktsieli, Kartli Region. She is 50 years old. She is married and lives with her family: husband Ioseb and three daughters (26, 25 and 20 years old). The younger daughter is a student. 

The family earns a living through agriculture. They have three milk cows and a calf. Manana produces cheese and yogurt and sells it in the village on weekends. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns a greenhouse, with the area of 300 sq meters. In fall and winter months the greenhouse is used for greens growing and in spring and summer, tomatoes are grown there. The family sells harvested products locally to the greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 1100 Laris (approximately $660 USD). 

Manana requested credit for renovation of the greenhouse. It needs urgent renovation, as is already old and can’t keep the needed temperature. When Manana and Ioseb fix it, they will count on a good harvest of greens this fall and winter and sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse renovation.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura, es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Warakaq, tiene 53 años, es viuda, madre de 4 hijos, hace 13 años es socia de Finca.
Maura es dueña de una Imprenta, donde gracias a las charlas y al método de trabajo que se maneja en la Institución aprendió ahorrar, a ser responsable, puntual y a manejar su negocio. Le gusta las capacitaciones sobre todo el cuidado de la mujer y la familia. Agradece a FINCA Peru porque gracias a los préstamos que le otorgaron pudo comprar sus equipos, papeles y así mejorar su negocio, ahora ella trabaja juntamente con sus hijos quienes la apoyan. El préstamo que esta solicitand lo invertirá en la compra de papeles químicos, simples y tintas.
Su meta es abrir sucursales en otros lugares y crecer junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Muchuy Warakaq cooperative bank.  She is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 children.  She has been a member of the cooperative for 13 years.  Maura is the owner of a printing service.  Thanks to the informative talks and work training provided by the Institution, she has learned how to save, be responsible, punctual, and how to manage her business.  She likes the training and, above all, the care shown toward women and families.  She is grateful to FINCA Peru because, thanks to the loans they facilitated, she was able to buy her equipment, paper, and, in this manner, improve her business.  Currently, she works together with her children, who support her endeavor.  The loan she is requesting will allow her to invest in the purchase of papers, dyes and other printing supplies.  

Her goal is to open branches in other locations, and to grow alongside her family.

loans.use: purchase papers, dyes and other printing supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 38 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Victoria has a business selling dried fish. She earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Victoria has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Victoria became a member of PMPC this year (2011). In the future, Victoria would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 38-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married, living with his wife and two school-aged children. Regardless of the heavy life expenses, his family are really thankful for what he did so far. He decided to start his own work as a photographer seven years ago and has opened his own shop. He’s talented and works with high professionalism. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new supplies such as cameras, lances, films and many other items for his work in order to increase his sales and his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own photography center.

loans.use: to purchase new supplies such as cameras, lances, films and many other items

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Doña Rita es una mujer microempresaria, de 47 naños, que vive con su compañero y sus tres hijos.

Ella se dedica desde hace más de 15 años a la maquila de prendas de vestir y en los últimos años a la producción propia de ropa : ropa infantil y de mujer, combinando también la venta de productos por catálogo.

Es muy importante para ella mantener su independencia económica, contar con sus propios ingresos, eso la ha empoderado y le permite autovalorarse y poder enfrentar muchas veces , comentarios y actitudes machistas de su compañero.

En la fundación es una clienta de gran trayectoria por su moral de pago y actitud positiva, que busca mejorar sus condiciones, las de su familia y del negocio. Ella misma se asombra de todo lo que ha crecido su negocio en cuanto a activos y patrimonio.

Ella todos los años por seguridad y prevención se realiza una serie de exámenes médicos y chequeos radiólogicos como: mamografía, ultrasonidos y gastos odontólogicos, este año hace la solicitud a la fundación de apoyo económico para realizarlos.
texts.en:
Rita, 47, is a small businesswoman. She lives with her husband and three children.

For 15 years she has worked in a garment factory, and in recent years she has started producing clothing herself - baby clothes and women's clothes - as well as selling catalog products. It's very important to her to maintain her financial independence and have her own income. This has empowered her and given her self-worth that allows her to confront frequent chauvinistic comments and attitudes from her husband. 

She has a lot of potential with the foundation because of her payment ethic and positive attitude. She's looking to improve conditions for herself, her family and her business. She is surprised herself by how much her business has grown in terms of assets and legacy. 

Every year for prevention purposes, she has a physical exam and x-rays like a mammogram, ultrasound and dentistry work. This year she has asked the foundation for financial support to complete them.

loans.use: to do an upper abdomen ultrasound and gastroscopy, and to buy medications

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Sevilla

texts.en:
This is Sevilla, 45, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, her business partner, and she is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Sevilla operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sevilla dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 33 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rosalinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other materials for fishing.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Gs La Cumbre Ii Group

texts.es:
La joven Kenia tiene 23 años,  es una persona  muy responsable y  luchadora, ella vive con su hija, su esposo y  su madre quienes la respaldan en cada uno de sus compromisos.
Kenia se dedica a la venta de pinol, ella tiene su negocio de manera ambulante ya que viene trabajando con personas desde hace 8 años.  el crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, cacao, canela, leña etc. para así de esta manea satisfacer, los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes todas las semanas ya que por la calidad de sus producto tiene mucha demanda.
el impacto que tendrá con el crédito Kenia es que podrá comprar más producto e incrementar sus venta, y de esta manera generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
los planes a futuro de Kenia es hacer crecer su negocio, y darle una buena educación a su hija.
Mirna se dedica a la venta en su Pulpería
Evelsa vende leña y tortillas para el sustento de ella y su familia.

Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Kenia, 23, is a very responsible young woman and a fighter.  She lives with her daughter, her husband, and her mother, who support her in every one of her commitments.  Kenia sells "pinol" [a corn/cocoa-based powder to make drinks].  She does her business as a street vendor and has been working with people for eight years.

She needs the loan to buy corn, cacao, cinnamon, firewood, etc., so she can satisfy the orders she gets every week from her customers.  Her product is in great demand because of the quality.

The impact of the loan is that Kenia will be able to buy more products and increase her sales.  In this way she will generate better income for herself and have a better quality of life.  Kenia's future plans are for her business to grow and to give her daughter a good education.

Mirna works in sales in her grocery store and Evelsa sells firewood and tortillas to support herself and her family.

Choluteca, Honduras, March 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, cacao, cinnamon, firewood, and other products.

loans.name: Gs Colinas Del Poteca Group

texts.es:
La Señora Eloisa, tiene 61 años de edad, tiene 2 hijo y es madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la venta de pan, nacatamales, dulces, ropa nueva desde hace más de 10 años, Doña Eloisa, esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de productos como ser: maíz, queso, azúcar, carnes, verduras y ropa para la satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, hace algunos años atrás Doña Eloisa era propietaria de una cantina (venta bebidas Alcohólicas) pero cansada de este tipo de negocio dañino para la sociedad decide cambiarle el rumbo de su negocio desligándose por completo de este y emprende la venta de nacatamales, pan, y ropa nueva y de esta manera deja atrás el pasado y comienza una nueva historia en su vida, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña Eloisa, le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia para ayudarla a salir adelante,
Uno de los sueños de Doña Eloisa es establecer una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos y no seguir haciéndolo ambulante y vender una variedad de producto.
La Señora Dimara, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de Hot Dog, papas fritas y Calzado.
La Señora Glenda, se dedica a la caficultura y comercio  su actividad principal es el cultivo de café  venta de Ropa y calzado, compra y venta de ganado.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz, queso, azúcar, carnes, verduras y ropa para su negocio

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: ESMERALDA: Es una señora sonriente y jovial de 54 años de edad, casada  con 6 hijos: 4 mayores de edad, un adolescente de 15 años que estudia su quinto año de secundaria y un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera de manera informal, como albañil. Solicita financiamiento para cubrir gastos médicos y poder viajar a Managua, debido a que se encuentra delicada de salud. Ella sueña con tener una vivienda de concreto.

loans.use: para cubrir gastos médicos y poder viajar a Managua, debido a que se encuentra delicada de salud

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: To her, LAPO caused a break through in her life and family. She discovered that borrowing from a reliable source and making good use of it, is very profitable. As a 40 years old woman, I know what it is to get money when one is desperately in need of it to expand a business. I will appreciate if I can have access to the above amount through anyone.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her beauty salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water storage equipment , etc. for his dairy business

loans.name: Sy

texts.en: Mrs Sy T. is 52 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. Her husband is a fisherman and earns 4 dollars a day. They have 4 children. They would like to purchase a small boat and fishing tools to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase a small boat and fishing tools

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Thou is married and has 7 children: 4 sons and 3 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her the older generation in her family since 1966 and she started her silk production at that time. She did not weave during the Khmer Rouge regime from 1975-1979. She began her weaving again after 1979. Her husband is a wood-construction contractor, which he contracts to do with the community people. 

She has had 5 loans from MAXIMA. She is now requesting a loan of $200, which she will use loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. This will improve her income and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria A. is 71 years old with six children, all fully grown and independent, living in Mariano Roque Alonso, Paraguay. Two of her children live nearby and visit daily. Gregoria has run a despensa, or small convenience store, for the past 18 years. She has a regular clientele and many friends in the neighborhood.

Gregoria began working in the world of sales when she was just 12 years old. She inherited this profession from her mother. When Gregoria was very young they worked together making and selling hats made from Karanda’y (the local Guarani word for a material made from palm leaves). After this she worked selling common household necessities from a mobile stand. Her husband grew up working in a similar way. Before they met and were married, he worked as a cook for construction workers in the capital city of Asunción. He did this for five years. With the money that he saved from this endeavor and much dedication, Gregoria and her husband were able to open their store. Since that time they have been successful and are a well-liked establishment in their neighborhood.

Today they are very proud that they have been able to realize many of their goals, including the education of their children. They are especially thankful that they are in good health and can continue to be active and serve their clients.

The credit she has obtained from the foundation will be used to buy more merchandise for the store.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: L. Mary is 35, married, has 2 children and hails from Afromedia in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drugs and drinks, and has been in business since 1999 and.  She requests a loan of $625 to buy more provisions, drugs and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more Drugs, Provisions and Drinks

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is a member of our programme who has been with us for a long time. She is from the village of Manono Tai and she is running a fishing business. She has five children, four of whom are attending the village primary school. She is one of our active members and she is reliable and trustworthy.

Her husband does not have other work so he is the one that is helping her to run the business. The husband goes fishing up to five days of the week, depending on the weather. If the fishing goes well then Elisapeta will now go to the market to sell the catch instead of selling it in front of her house beside the road. She is on her fifth loan and she is looking to receive more loans from SPBD in the future to further expand their little business.

loans.use: Business expansion & home improvement

loans.name: Juwariah

texts.en: Juwariah, 51, is the mother of 3 children and her husband, A., has no fixed job. To support her family's needs she sells snacks and groceries at her small shop in front of her house, earning up to $18 a day. She is asking for a loan of $125 to buy more goods for her shop and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Rabiyya

texts.en: Rabiyya A. is 51, married with four children, and lives in the village of Saatli city in the south-central area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Rabiyya owns a small herd of cows and sells milk in the Saatli bazaar. Her family expenditures are increasing as the children grow. Rabiyya plans to increase the number of cows she has in order to increase her income. For this purpose, Rabiyya applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $600. She hopes this loan will help her improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow for her dairy business

loans.name: Biljana

texts.en: Biljana, a 39 year old single mother, with two children ages 5 and 10, comes from Štrpci, a small village near the town Prnjavor. Biljana hopes to receive her first loan of $500 to buy cleaning and polishing products for her job. These tools are essential in helping her clean staircases and flats as best as she can.

loans.use: To buy cleaning and polishing products

loans.name: Aracelys' Group

texts.en:
Aracelys is a thirty-year old mother of two children who is fighting tooth and nail to make a living and improve her family’s living conditions. Her husband lives outsiD. the country and sends her money occasionally. Aracelys is an experienced businesswoman. She used to run a cafeteria in the past, but she had to leave that activity for a while as it was hard to have access to capital in order to keep operating the cafeteria. She says it was like fighting a losing battle.

Now, the entrepreneur wants to start over, but seriously. Together with four other women, she’ll take a loan which she’ll invest in the purchase of a variety of materials in order to operate the cafeteria. Aracelys had already rented a small locale where the café will be operated. She hopes that this new beginning will help her support her children's educations and to change her family’s life.

The others members of the group are: Gloria L. S., a women’s clothing retailer; Juliana A., to buy clothing in bulk to retail; Santa D. L. C., for a small café; Regina T. F., to sell materials for a beauty parlor.

Photo: from left to right: Aracelys, Gloria, Juliana, Santa y Regina.

loans.use: To start over a small cafeteria.

location.town: La Gallera, community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima K. is a devoted member of the Kewerimidde women’s group in Katosi and owns a restaurant that has been operational for seven years. At this stage, her restaurant can stand on its own as it makes enough profit to cater for any pending issue in her business. She is a widow with five children and all of them are in school. Through her group, she is asking for a loan to enable her to pay for her children's school fees. She fears to drain her business by extracting so much in school fees from it at once and that is why she needs a loan which she will pay back in installments using the profits from her restaurant.

loans.use: Halima Kilibwa needs a loan to be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia is a very honest, responsible, and hardworking person with the desire to get ahead in life. As a single mother who did not have anyone’s support, she started the business because she needed the extra income in order to offer the best to her 2 children, Luis Abraham, an 18-year-old high school student, and Nadia Rubí, a 15-year-old middle school student. Thanks to her job cleaning houses, she earned the income needed to move her children forward and to purchase the tools and materials needed to make her crafts.

She started in February of 2006, thanks to an invitation she received for an arts and crafts course, in which she learned very quickly. Now, she can make different types of crafts, such as baskets, paper flowers, bath sets, and bags, among others, which she sells to her friends and employers.

She needs a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, in order to purchase the supplies she needs that will allow her to continue making her crafts to sell to her customers. With your help, Emilia will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Emilia es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.Inicio el negocio ante la necesidad de contar con otro ingreso para ofrecerle algo mejor a sus 2 hijos, Luis Abraham 18 años, estudiante de preparatoria y Nadia Rubí de 15 años estudiante de secundaria, ya que es madre soltera y no tenía el apoyo de nadie, gracias al trabajo que realizaba haciendo el aseo en casas donde la contrataban tuvo ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos y para comprar el material y las herramientas necesarias para elaborar sus manualidades.

Comenzó en Febrero de 2006, gracias a una invitación que recibío para asistir a un curso de manualidades en el cual aprendío muy pronto y en la actualidad puede realizar diversas manualidades como canastas, flores, juegos de baño, bolsas, etc. la cuales ofrece entre sus amistades y a la gente de las casas donde trabaja.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando mis manualidades y poder venderlas entre sus clientes.Con tu ayuda Emilia saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase craft supplies

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City where she runs a business selling provisions and drinks. She has been in this business since 1996 and she learned the business for 2 years. Felicia needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Adenuke

texts.en:
Adenuke A., 42, lives in Ojodu, Lagos State, Nigeria with her husband and four children. She has been producing and selling vaseline since 2003. Vaseline is a body cream that is used mostly by women and children in Nigeria. The demand for her product is high.

Adenuke is requesting the loan to purchase more raw materials to increase her production of vaseline so that she can supply her numerous customers. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for body cream production

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 48 años de edad, estudió tercero de primaria, es casada y madre de cinco hijos. Vive en la avenida de los niños, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Un día la invitaron a una reunión de amigas del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz, se informó la modalidad de trabajo y decidió integrar el Banco Comunal desde hace un año y medio. Con el crédito inicial de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, compró 03 alpacas. 

Desde los 12 años de edad empezó vender mates y café en Mazocruz, acumulando capital, también preparaba comida para vender los días de feria. A los 20 años de edad tuvo su pareja, ella  seguía vendiendo comida y su esposo vendía carne de alpaca, llama y ovino, los cuales entregaba a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de carne, semanalmente entrega de 20 a 30 degollados.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 07 cabezas de alpaca, los cuales entregará en carne a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna. 

“El Banco Comunal es bueno para nosotras porque nos presta de inmediato sin mucho papeleo y eso nos conviene” manifestó Doña Delia.

Su sueño es comprar un camión para transportar ganado que trae de las comunidades de Wilacota, Asani, Huaitiri, Titijani y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old and studied until the third grade of primary school. She is married, has five children and lives on Los Niños Avenue, Mazocruz district, in the province of El Collao, Puno.

One day she was invited to the reunion of friends of the commual bank "Generación 2000" in Mazocruz, where she learned their method of business. She decided to become a member 1 ½ years ago and, with her initial loan of 300.00 soles, she purchased 3 alpacas.

She started selling mates (a type of South American herbal tea) and coffee in Mazocruz when she was twelve years old, accumulating capital. She also prepared food to sell on market days. At 20 years of age she married and continued to sell food, while her husband sold alpaca, llama and sheep meat which he delivered to the wholesalers of the city of Tacna. Currently, she dedicates herself to the sale of meat, delivering 20 to 30 butchered animals per week.

With this credit of 1,500.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she plans to purchase seven alpacas which she will deliver as meat to the wholesalers in the city of Tacna.

“The communal bank is good for us because we can obtain a loan quickly and without a lot of complicated paperwork, which is positive for us”, states Mrs. Delia.

Her dreams include buying a truck to transport livestock that she brings from the communities of Wilacota, Asani, Huaitiri, Titijani, and continuing to support her children’s educations.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seven alpacas.

loans.name: Nassazi Rachael’S Group

texts.en:
Rachael is the leader of a group of 5 members. She is 30 years old and married with 5 children, aged between 15 and 3 years. All her children go to school. Rachael is a very hard-working lady, taking care of three orphans and her old mother. She resides in and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with six people. They don’t have electricity or piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala, and she uses public transport. Rachael deals in second hand clothes, selling them from Owino market, which is in Kampala city. She sells to all categories of people, both by wholesale and retail. Rachael receives 15-20 customers a day, depending on the weather: when it rains, few customers come in, because the area where she is staying is prone to floods. Rachael works seven days a week. Her main challenge is the rainy season. She has been with MCDT for four years and is servicing her twelfth loan. She wants to use this loan to acquire more capital for her business.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Pham Thi Q. is 48 years old.  She has five children and all of them are grown up.  She has been in TYM since 2002.  During her long time in TYM, she has always repaid her loans on time.  Now her main income is from raising chickens, growing rice, and the salary of her son, an income of about 3.5 million VND ($200) per month.  This time she wants to borrow 10 million ($600) to buy more chickens and chicken feed for raising them.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Atamu Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of Kadiatu S., Adama B., Mabinty F., Mary F., Maseray K., Fatu S., and Yombo S.. They have called their group "Atamu". They have received several loans through SMT. They have re-paid previous loans successfully. They each received Le 1,000,000 in their previous loan. That loan helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan, and thus were able to solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a new loan for the same amount of Le 1,000,000 each to add to their businesses.

Kadiatu (left) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. She is forty-three years of age, married with five children – one in college, one in secondary school, one in primary school, one in nursery school and the last is not yet of school age. Her husband is a businessman, too.

Kadiatu sells groundnuts (peanuts). She has been in this business for 20 years now. With this loan of Le 1,000,000, Kadiatu will buy about five bags of groundnuts to add to her business. She travels to the village of Bamoi to buy the groundnuts. The fare to Bamoi is Le 15,000 and she pays a Le 6,000 delivery fee for each bag of groundnuts. A bag of groundnuts costs Le 200,000. So far, Kadiatu faces no major challenge worth noting in her business. Her only challenge in life is taking good care of her children. She wants the best education for her children. With her business, she wants to make more profit so that she will be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: buying groundnuts to re-sell in the market

loans.name: Arafaat

texts.en:
Arafaat is a 44-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Arafaat has been working as a plasterer for 23 years. Arafaat requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase wood and spraying machines. This is his second (loan) cycle, and he has always paid on time.

The first loan has influenced his life in a good way. It let him purchase better machines and thereby improve his work. In turn, he improved his lifestyle. Arafaat stands out professionally because of his good work and punctuality. Anybody can be his client. He decided on doing his work because he wanted to be independent. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and spraying machines.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es socio del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Felix es casada, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Felix se dedica a la compra de ganados en las diferentes ferias de la región, luego los beneficia en el camal de la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo reparte por mayor a los carniceros.
Felix necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.
Los sueños de Felix son tener capital propio, mejorar su casa para la comodidad de sus hijos y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Felix is a partner of the Communal Bank called "Comunal Musuq Rumi" which means New Stone in Quechuan. Felix is married, he is 56 years old and he has 3 children. Felix buys cattle from the different fairs of the region where he lives, then he take it to the slaughterhouse of the city of Ayacucho and then distributes the meat as wholesale to the butchers. Felix needs a loan of 2000 soles ($625); the money will be invested to buy dairy cattle. Felix's dream is to have his own working capital, improve his house for the comfort of his children and that his children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy cattle

loans.name: Fikiria Group

texts.en: Agnes M. is 32 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of five and 15.  She is also a member of the Juhudi Loan Group and frequently shares her loans with a colleague.  Agnes has worked for six years as a fish seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha in Tanzania.  She earns about $70 each month yet works from 6:30 every morning until 10:30 every evening.  Agnes wants to purchase more items for her business and thereby increase her customer base and profit.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $350, which she will share with another member from her lending group.

loans.use: To purchase more items in order to expand business.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Madame  Korotoumou   D. est âgée de 38 ans,  mariée et mère de  3 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants au quartier Pelengana Nord de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt  les activités commerciales auprès de sa belle sœur qui vendait des condiments alimentaires au grand marché de pelenegana. Après plusieurs années passées auprès de cette dernière et  riche de cette expérience, elle évolue en solo dans le commerce de la pâte d’arachide et de Tamarin (fruit exotique très prisé en Afrique depuis 15 ans. Elle reçoit fréquemment des commandes de Bamako ou de certains fonctionnaires de Ségou.
 Pour faire sa pâte d’arachide, elle procède d’abord au triage de l’ivraie de la bonne graine, ensuite elle procède au  décorticage, au vannage et à la torréfaction, afin elle va moudre au moulin la graine grillée pour la transformer en pâte. Après cette phase elle met la pâte dans des seaux de 5 kg et  10 kg  destiné en ce moment à la vente.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance avec qui  elle est en relation depuis 4 ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires et  2 prêts individuels tous  bien  remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle espère utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 40 sacs d’arachides. Elle s’approvisionne essentiellement   à partir de  Yangasso auprès de paysans producteurs et effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et  de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui lui permettra de subvenir à  certaines charges de la famille (habillement, participation aux événements sociaux.) Son désir est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Ms. Korotoumou D., age 38, is married and the mother of three. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in the Pelengana Nord district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school for societal reasons, she very early on started in commerce with her sister-in-law, who used to sell condiments at the grand marketplace of Pelenegana. After several years with her, and rich with this experience, Ms. D. developed on her own for 15 years in the commerce of peanut butter and tamarind (an exotic fruit highly prized in Africa). She frequently receives orders from Bamako or from certain civil servants in Ségou.

To make her peanut butter, she first starts with threshing, and next she proceeds to shelling, winnowing, and roasting. Finally she goes to grind the roasted nuts at the mill in order process them into paste. After this phase, she puts the paste into 5-kg and 10-kg pails ready now for sale.

With plans to augment her working capital, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she has had an association with for 4 years. After 4 solidarity loans and 2 individual loans, all repaid, she is on now on her third individual loan. She hopes to use this loan to buy 40 sacks of peanuts. She supplies herself essentially from Yangasso from rural producers. Sales are made to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

She intends to realize a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will enable her to cover some family expenses (clothing, participation in social events). Her desire is to build a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. is 49 years old. She is a divorced mother of two daughters. According to her, both are married and live with their spouses. Martha lives with some grandchildren in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Martha is a trader. She deals in onions. Martha procures bags of onions from the Eastern part of the country and sells in the market square. She says she distributes to retailers and treks to nearby markets to sell.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure onions in bulk. Martha is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and give her grandchildren support to further their education.

loans.use: Procure onions.

loans.name: Mustafokul

texts.en:
K. Mustafokul is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Mustafokul has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Mustafokul harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests $700 USD to buy more cattle to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is divorced. She has one daughter who is 14. Galina offers medical diagnostic services. She started this business four years ago. She offers computer diagnostics of various diseases as well as treatment and preventative medicine. She has helped many people improve their health. Galina would like to receive a loan of 9,390 UAH to purchase medicine and maintain her equipment. Galina likes her business and wants to develop it further.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and maintain equipment

loans.name: Zhuraboi

texts.ru: Нишонов Журабой- мужчина  56 лет . Журабой женат отец у него 7 –детей. У Журабоя очень большая и дружная семья. Они все вместе дружно трудятся в колхозе кроме старшего сына который находится в Российской федерации и помогает своей семье. Женщины в семье Журабоя занимаются переработкой пряжи  также у них дойная корова которая приносит доход семейному бюджету.
texts.en:
Zhuraboi N. is 56 years old. He is married and a father of 7 children. It is a big and very tight family who all work together at the farmer's co-op, except Zhuraboi's eldest son who is currently in Russia, earning money to help out his family. The women in Zhuraboi's family also prepare and spin wool and they own a milk cow which brings additional income to the family's budget.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur n’a pas fait l’université faute de moyens, devant subvenir à ses propres besoins il a fait une formation en secrétariat bureautique et a ouvert après sa formation sa propre boutique de traitement de texte et d’impression. Il veut agrandir son commerce en alimentant sa boutique avec des fournitures de bureau, la vente de cartes de recharges et des services téléphoniques. Ainsi il pourra réaliser de meilleures recettes. Il demande a WAGES pour cela son premier crédit pour acheter des fournitures de bureau, 2 cartons de cartes de recharges TOGOCEL et une cabine téléphonique.
texts.en:
This gentleman was not able to attend a university since he lacked the means to do so. Being obliged to support himself, he took courses to become a secretary and after his training, he opened his own shop doing word processing and printing. He wants to expand his business by selling office supplies, rechargeable phone cards, and telephone service in his little shop. Thus he will earn more income. He is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy office supplies, 2 boxes of TOGOCEL rechargeable phone cards, and a telephone booth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of office supplies, rechargeable phone cards, and a telephone booth

loans.name: Julia Carlota

texts.es:
Julia es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Julia es casada, tiene 46 años y  tres hijos, los de 22, 21 y 16 años; los mayores están casados y el ultimo  estudian ingles. 
Julia se puso a vender samwish pero no le fue bien por que la zona donde vendía había mucha competencia  y su hermana la incorporo a la venta por catalogo de Productos de belleza, empezó con una linia ahora vende para tres empresas de belleza.  
Desde que comenzó en Finca  ha aprendido que todo mujer tiene la oportunidad de surgir 
Necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para compra productos  de belleza por catalogo en oferta, y poder estoquearse. 
El sueño  de Julia es tener una librería bazar.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the 24 de Octubre Community Bank. She is 46, married, and has three children. The children are 22, 21, and 16. The older children are married; the last one is studying English. Julia started selling sandwiches, but that was not good because there was so much competition in the area where she sold. Her sister got her into selling beauty products by catalog. She started with one line, and now she sells for three beauty companies. Since she started with Finca, she has learned that every woman has the opportunity to advance. She needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy beauty products by catalog and be able to stock her inventory. Julia’s dream is to have a bazaar style bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products by catalog and be able to stock up

loans.name: Уктам

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Уктам1958 года рождения, женат имеет пятерых детей. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Так же Уктам работает на водоносной станции Сумчака. Жена помогает ему ухаживать со скотом . После откормки скот продается на скотном рынке.Уктам кредитуется в нашей организации более 3 лет. Он успешно закончил предыдущих займов и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Он планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем самым увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ему очень нравятся условия нашего кредитования и он рад, что есть такие организации поддерживающие общество.

loans.use: на покупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie S. is from the village of Catadman, Manabay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married, and has one young child. To make a living Charie owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste etc. Charie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month. In 2009, Charie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charie is requesting her first loan from GDMPC, for 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's living conditions. About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Francisca es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Francisca tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas y carne, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Francisca necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Francisca son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the El Sol Community Bank. Francisca, 36, is married and has four children. She has a store in her house where she sells general groceries like vegetables, fruit, and meat. She does this with help from her husband. Francisca needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Francisca’s dreams are to improve her business and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Elohor

texts.en: Elohor is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers and she also sells hair extensions. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Our Father 2 Group

texts.en:
Kular G. is 46 years old and married with three children between the ages of five and eleven. They attend school in 1st through 8th grades. Kular is illiterate due to poverty. 

She buys rice wholesale and takes it to rural areas to sell it at a retail price. Kular has been running this business for fifteen years, and it is the income from this business that makes it possible for her to take care of her family. She has good relationships with her customers, and that's why her business is successful.

This loan is needed to buy more rice wholesale in order to make more profits that can expand her business. Kular dreams of having a rice store of her own that she can manage well in order to build a house, educate her children, and give them good medical care.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Isikulu

texts.en:
E. is 44 years old and married with six children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria.

E. sells fufu in retail to her customers. Fufu is prepared from fermented cassava. E. hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more fufu to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to make more fufu

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en: This is Irenea B., 51 years old, who lives and does business in Silang, Cavite. She lives with her husband Ignacio, a farmer, and their four children. Irenea has been selling vegetables for twenty-seven years and has also established a general store. She earns P27,000 a month which she saves for future needs. Her earnings answer for her family’s basic daily needs. Irenea is thankful for becoming a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She is now on her 7th loan. She is expecting a new loan from the cooperative of P16,000 as additional capital. With this fresh additional capital, she can purchase more assorted vegetables for her business. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more assorted vegetables

loans.name: Enarcisa

texts.en: Enarcisa, 43 years old, is a mother of three children. She has been married to her husband Lito since 2000. Her oldest child is now twenty-two years old. A rice farmer for some time now, she loves spending time at her farm. Her goal is always to produce a quality harvest so she can sell better and also feed her family. Enarcisa is a member of CEVI and now has the opportunity to avail of its financial service. She is applying for a loan of 11,000 PHP. This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 and married with four children aged between 4 and 13 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a four-roomed house where she is staying with eight people. Mary takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.

Mary incurs transport costs to and from buying charcoal from villages. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Mary has a charcoal store in Ndeeba town and pays 30000/=as monthly rent charges. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both wholesale and retail.

Mary's greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, medications, and school fees. Her major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works from an area that floods.

Mary has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for three years, servicing her tenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more  sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 30 years old, is single, and lives in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is a self-employed businessman and has sold firewood in bundles for the past eight years. He starts his business early in the morning and finishes late in the evening.

Theogene is now requesting his first loan in order to purchase more trees to be transformed into firewood so that he can satisfy the demand of his customers, especially the restaurant owners. With this loan, he hopes to earn more profits as well as selling to a larger number of customers.

With the profit he expects to gain, Theogene plans to save a portion for his financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood for sale

loans.name: Khasanov

texts.en: Khasanov A. lives in Baku. He is 21 years old and single. A. has had a butcher's business for two years. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more meat in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: La familia de Pedro está conformada por el cliente, su conyugue y 4 hijos de 14, 11, 8  y 3 años todos viven en la misma casa que es de propiedad del señor Pedro. Él se dedica a la jardinería desde hace unos 20 años atrás, la cual realiza sus trabajos a domicilio, su cónyuge se dedica a la venta de frutas de acuerdo a la temporada. Pedro realiza sus trabajos a domicilio, el cual le ha permitido adquirir clientela de manera fija, su cónyuge vende las frutas hace bastante tiempo lo cual le ha permitido posesionarse bien en el mercado de ambulante por lo que la competencia es mínima. Pedro requiere el crédito para la compra de material de construcción ya que como empieza la época de las lluvias no quiere tener percances en su vivienda. Este es su cuarto crédito con Agrocapital, tienen un excelente cumplimiento de pago  a la fecha solo tiene crédito con nosotros.
texts.en:
Pedro's family is formed of himself, his wife, and his four children, who are 14, 11, 8, and 3 years old. They all live in the same home, which Pedro owns. He has been a gardener for 20 years and his wife sells seasonal fruits. Pedro works at his clients homes, which permits him to have clients in fixed locations. His wife has sold her fruit for a while, and this has allowed her to position herself in the local market, where there is little competition. Pedro seeks this loan to purchase construction materials for his home since the rainy season has begun and he doesn't want anything to happen to his home. This is his fourth loan with Agrocapital. He has an excellent record making his payments. To date, he only has received loans through our organization.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
The smiling person shown in the picture is Mrs. Khean D., 22 years old, who lives in the province, Siem Reap. She owns a small store in the village which is full of her fellow villagers, and she uses this store to sell a few grocery items. She generates a profit of approximately US$2 a day to help provide her family with more stability by supporting her family’s daily expenses.

Her husband is the chief provider for the family, and he works as a building worker. This couple have a child. Khean D. always hires a taxi to deliver her inventory from the market to her store. She hopes to reduce this cost by taking out her loan with which, when added to her saving, she can buy a used motor vehicle which will enable her to transport her wares.

loans.use: To buy a used motor vehicle

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Mrs. Neng N. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Oeung Soeng, are farmers who own 1.50-hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farmer, Mr. Oeung Soeng is a construction worker who can receive a small income to support his family’s living. 
Mrs. Neng Nhab is requesting 1,500,000 Riel from AMK to buy a motorbike to support her husband’s income. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. The couple has one child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una esposa muy tierna y una madre muy amorosa con sus 4 hijos. Tiene 61 años y vive en su humilde casa, que está a medio construir, en un barrio marginal de la zona sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Durante toda su vida ha trabajado en diversos negocios relacionados a la venta de comida. Actualmente, elabora y vende tamales (platillo a base de maíz molido); los viernes por la tarde hierve el maíz y su esposo le ayuda a moler los granos, mientras que ella se avoca al aliñado del tamal, adicionalmente vende una sopa típica de su tierra llamada “caldo de cabeza”. María se siente feliz de lo que hace, ya que con estas ganancias ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su hogar junto a su esposo. Ella es una mujer muy laboriosa, de buen carácter y muy buena sazón, dones heredados de su madre, que ahora le dan la posibilidad de generar dinero. Sus clientes ya saben que cada fin de semana pueden saborear la comida de María y ella alegremente los atiende, ya que gracias a esa preferencia su negocio le es muy rentable. Lo que anhela para el futuro es  terminar de construir su casa y tener un espacio donde pueda acondicionar un pequeño restaurante.

Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, donde hace el compromiso de seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad. Ella forma un grupo solidario con una amiga, con la que se lleva muy bien y eso las mantiene unidas.

El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de los comestibles e insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Maria is a very caring wife and loving mother of four children. She is 61 years old and she lives in a humble home. It is half built in an area on the outskirts of town, south of Lima. She has worked in different businesses related to selling food her whole life. At present, she is making and selling tamales (a cornmeal based dish). Friday afternoons, she boils the corn and her husband helps her grind the grains while she prepares the tamale filling. She also sells a traditional soup from her land called "caldo de cabeza". Maria feels happy with what she does, since these earnings she helps cover the household expenses with her husband. She is a hardworking woman and a good cook. She inherited her gifts from her mother and now they give her the chance to make some money. Her clients know that every weekend they can taste Maria's food and she will serve them happily. Thanks to this preference her business is very profitable. What she longs for for the future is to be able to finish building her house and have space to put in a small restaurant. This is her eighth loan with MFP, where she is committed to keep working with the same responsibility. She is a member of a support group with a friend. She gets along with her very well and they stay close that way. They money she is asking for now is to buy the necessary foodstuffs and ingredients to prepare her food.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and ingredients for her food

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is the wife of M. R. and lives in a city called Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband is an electrician but also sells electrical supplies in the community. He has been in this trade for the past 15 years. Shamshad has given birth to five children: three sons and two daughters. Her elder daughter helps her with household work. The eldest son goes with his father and helps him in his electric shop. The others don’t do anything.

Shamshad is applying for a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires, switches, and tube lights) to expand her husbands’ electrical supply-selling business. She has two other ladies in her loan group. Rafiqan and Mumtaz each want a loan to buy donkey carts for their loading businesses.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies to sell

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
