Chhay O., 54, is a humble villager living in Phnom Penh. A widowed mother, she cares for her five children, who are all single and attend school. To support the family's daily living, she sells a variety of groceries from her home, and also plants vegetables O. her farmland to sell. All of her children help her businesses when they are not studying.

Chhay O.'s investments are running smoothly and provide her with a suitable daily income. Because her businesses are growing, she hopes to increase her income by taking out a loan to use as extra capital to invest in her businesses. She will buy more fertilizers, seeds and other supplies for her crop-growing activity.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, seeds and other supplies

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn R.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies like ube jam, banana que and fried sweet potato in her community. She is 23 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. Ginalyn is just starting this business. In 2010, Ginalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ginalyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Composé des femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Sabougnouma ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et de 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans les familles conjugales polygames avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de Bougouni au quartier Torakabougou dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
A travers des relations  de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce du bois de chauffe, de la préparation et vente des beignets (tels Assétou C.) et  des céréales. 
Pour  augmenter leurs ressources financières afin de faire assez de stocks,  elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de groupe tous les  prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Pour la fabrication de 5 kg de céréales en beignets : après décorticage, on transforme les 5 kg en farine de céréales puis on ajoute à cette farine 3 litres d’eau, 3 pincés de sel, 2pincés de levure et 1/2kg de sucre et on malaxe correctement se mélange afin d’avoir une bonne pâte que l’on garde au moins 1heure. Après on met sur le feu une poêle contenant l’huile et on y trempe  la pâte par cuillerée. En 3 minutes la cuisson termine et on n’a des beignets ainsi le processus continu.
Pour faire ce travail, Madame Assétou C. compte acheter avec son prêt 500kg de petit mil, 10litres d’huile alimentaires, 1kg de levure et 10kg de sel et 20kg de sucre. Tous ces produits seront achetés dans le marché de Bougouni.
Assétou compte  obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 30000FCFA tandis que les autres membres du groupe prétendent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20000F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les frais de santé de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is composed of married women, who, on the average are 35 years of age and have four children. They live in polygamous families with their brothers, sisters, husbands, their husbands’ other spouses and children. These women live in the town of Bougoni in the Torakabougou district, in the third administrative region of Mali. The women have met through their commercial activities. They sell heating wood, cereals, and the beignets they cook themselves (which is what Assétou Colibaly does, for example). In order to boost their capital and maintain a sufficient level stock, they have decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their sixth group loan, all previous loans having been duly reimbursed. In order to process 5 kg [11 lbs] of cereal into beignets, this is what’s needed: first, the cereal is husked; then it is pounded into flour; then, 3 liters [a little under a gallon] of water, 3 pinches of salt, 2 pinches of leavening and 0.5 kg [about 1 lb] of sugar is added, the mixture is kneaded well in order to produce nice dough, which is left to rise for at least one hour. After that, a big frying pan containing oil is set on the stove and the dough is spooned out into the pan. In three minutes, the frying is finished, the beignets are removed, and the process begins again. In order to continue with this work, Mrs. Assétou C. plans to use her loan to purchase 500 kg [1100 lbs] of pearl millet, 10 liters [2.6 gallons] of cooking oil, 1 kg [2.2 lbs] of leavening, 10 kg [22 lbs] of salt and 20 kg [44 lbs] of sugar. These supplies will be purchased at the Bougoni market. Assétou plans to achieve a monthly income of 30,000 West African Francs, while other members of the group plan to achieve a monthly income of 20,000 West African Francs, which will be used to cover healthcare expenses for their children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing pearl millet, oil, salt, leavening and sugar

loans.name: Afi Hova

texts.en: This woman is 27 years old and runs a general store. She's been in business since 2008. To satisfy her customers, she is purchasing more water and drinks to sell in her shop. She has requested her first loan from WAGES of 400,000 XOF to purchase soft drinks, water, and to pay for transportation to her shop.

loans.use: To pay for water and transportation

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: M. Rashid is a hardworking businessman who is 47 years old and lives in the village of Kyakanda, which is located in Kyotera County in the Rakai district. He is blessed with 12 children, five of whom are in school. He makes a living raising passion fruit on his two-acre plantation, and supplements this income by renting out items from his video library. He has been in these lines of work for more than four years, and is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and prepare his land for a new crop. He dreams of expanding both his plantation and video-renting business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and prepare his land for a new crop

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: Madame Oumy F. est une femme de 58 ans. Elle habite a Ouakam,  elle  est sociétaire  de la caisse depuis 7 ans et évolue  dans le secteur de la couture et du commerce de thioup, wax, huile de palme, miel. Madame F. a l’habitude d’envoyer des habits confectionnes a Tambacounda  en échange  des produits qu’elle commercialise. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 400 000 frs destine a l’achat de tissus qui seront utilises pour la confection. Elle est mariée et mère  de 5 enfants. Ce financement  lui donnera l’opportunité  de développer  son activité.  L’accroissement de ses gains lui permettra  d’assurer la prise en charge des besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Oumy F. is a 58-year-old woman who lives in Ouakam.  She has been an associate of the credit association for seven years and has been advancing in the clothing sector and in the commerce of thioup (dyed fabrics), wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), palm oil, and honey.  Ms. F. usually sends finished clothing to Tambacounda in exchange for products that she sells.  She is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for buying cloth that will be made into clothing.  She is married and the mother of five children.  This financing will give her the opportunity to develop her business.  Growth in her profits will enable her to make sure her family has what it needs. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita M. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 45 years old. Anita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering and selling a variety of meats in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Anita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 25 years of age and a married woman. She currently resides in a medium-sized family home with other members. S. works as a sewing employee in a garment company located in the middle of Phnom Penh City and is able to earn a formal salary to support her family. Presently, S. has another financial earner in her husband who works on the farm planting various crops. 

S. is taking out this loan as capital towards purchasing fertilizer, insecticide, and seed to begin growing crops when the farming season comes. S. and her husband are pictured above at their house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seed to begin growing crops

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata M. is married to an active businessman, and has five children. All her children are students.

For the past ten years, Aminata has been selling colemans of different sizes, rubber dishes, and other utensils. Her business is located in the Silvanus market, Makeni town. With her long experience in the same type of business, Aminata now has a lot of loyal customers.

Aminata has a good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 4,000,000SLL to help her buy more stock for her stall. She hopes to use the proceeds of this loan to educate her children to university level, and buy a piece of land for building their family house, as she continues to reinvest in her business. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To add home utensils.

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassina O. a  plus 35 ans, marié et père de trois enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Wayerma II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur O. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au commerce de vente d’articles divers dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal dans lequel il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles tels les Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing-gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, etc) il plus de trois ans. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans. Il a déjà bénéficié  de 2  prêts  qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
Il sollicite ainsi ce troisième prêt pour pouvoir acheter 10 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 cartons du thé, 5 sacs du sucre, 5 paquets de bonbons, 10 paquets de Chewing-gum, 30 paquets d’allumette et 10 cartons de savons. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville avant de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique située à Wayerma I.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 170 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt .
texts.en:
Mr Lassine O. is more than 35 years old, married and father to three children. He lives with his family in Wayerma II, the central town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having had several unsuccessful businesses, Mr. O. launched himself into the business of selling various articles, and he has a shop in front of his marital home where he has been carrying out his business buying and selling articles such as cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap etc., for more than three years. In order to satisfy ever growing customer demand, he decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, around two years ago. he has already had two loans which were both repaid in full. He is requesting this third loan in order to buy ten cartons of different cigarettes, five cartons of tea, five sacks of sugar, five packets of candy, ten packs of chewing gum, thirty packs of matches and ten cartons of soap. His goods are bought from the town's wholesaler traders before being sold retail in his shop in Wayerma I. He is expecting to make a monthly profit of 170,000FCFA with this loan, and this will be used essentally to increase his business, contribute to family expenses and pay the interest on his loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy diverse articles (cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing-gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap etc.)

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo B. de 47 años de edad está casado hace 5 años con la señora Mercedes Samudio de 53 años, la pareja vivió en concubinato por el tiempo de 10 años y luego se casaron, cuenta con 2 hijos de los cuales uno  ya falleció cuando tenía 3 años y la otra tiene 13 años y está cursando el 8vo. Grado.
El señor Eduardo se dedica a la compra y ventas de hiervas medicinales desde hace 6 años, cuenta con varios proveedores que le entrega en cantidades y luego el señor tiene un comerciante que es mayorista que le compra todo sus productos.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de mercaderias debido a que la cascara de naranjas está en su época y sus clientes  cuenta con mucho stock y para poder comprar todo recurre a nosotros para poder cumplir con todos.
texts.en:
Sr. Eduardo Bogardo is 47 years old and has been married for five years to Sra. Mercedes Samudio, age 53. This couple lived together for ten years before getting married. Eduardo and his wife have two children, one of whom died at the age of three. Their surviving daughter is 13 years old and in the eighth grade.

Sr. Eduardo has been buying and selling medicinal herbs for six years. He has several suppliers who deliver inventory in quantity. Later he sells them to a wholesale merchant who buys all of his products.

He is requesting this loan to buy more inventory, such as orange peel, that is in season. His suppliers have plenty of stock and he wants to buy everything. Therefore, he has returned to Fundación Paraguaya so that he can place his orders and acquire all he can.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase orange peel

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	El Sr. Rogelio G. S., es un primer crédito el que será ocupado para la construcción de dos cuatros 4x4, el esta siendo beneficiado con financiamiento el que le permite mejor su vivienda, al mismo tiempo le permite a él tener la oportunidad de cubrir esta necesidad y solventar su proyecto. El es asalariado y es de gran importancia para él que nuestra institución abra sus puertas y podamos ser impulsadores de las innovaciones de nuestros clientes
texts.en: Profile of the client:  Sr. Rogelio G. S. will use this first loan for the construction of two rooms, 4 meters by 4 meters.  He is being benefited by the financing, which will allow him to improve his way of life by permitting him to have the opportunity of meeting this necessity and carrying out his project.  He is a wage earner, and it of great importance to him that our institution has opened its doors and that we can provide encouragement to our clients’ innovations.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Pheouk

texts.en: Pheouk S., 50, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for a business area with Vietnam. S. and her husband produce Cambodian noodles, earning an income of USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 44 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a machine to produce more noodles. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a machine to produce more noodles

loans.name: Koitamet

texts.en:
Koitamet M., aged 25 years, is a single man who has a retail shop in Enkaroni which is in Kajiado. He rents his shop.

He has been running this business for the past two years and his monthly profit is Kshs 20,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office which is the nearest to Enkaroni Market.

Koitamet will use Kshs 5,000 to buy rice, Kshs 5,000 for sugar, Kshs. 10,000 for mattresses, Kshs 5,000 for blankets, kshs 10,000 for plastic chairs and Kshs 5,000 to buy bags  for sale. His business is fast moving because Enkaroni market is crowded with livestock traders who buy his goods a lot.

If the loan boosts the business, Koitamet will have a big business which will enable him to generate enough income to buy a piece of land where he can build his own shop to do business in and buy a pickup. He will also build rental houses.

Koitamet dreams of becoming a big distributor owning a manufacturing company and opening a supermarket. Koitamet is honest, ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy rice, blankets, sugar, mattresses, plastic and bags

loans.name: Margaret Wawira

texts.en:
Margaret is a 32-year-old rice farmer. She was married but later separated from her husband, and they have two children. Margaret has been doing rice farming for the past 11 years with a monthly income of Kshs 10,000, which she uses to support her children. 

Margaret has applied for her second loan with KADET after successfully repaying her first loan. She plans to use the money to purchase farm items such as fertilizer and food for labourers on her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, Margaret intends to pay school fees to educate her children. 

She hopes to educate her children to the highest level possible, to construct a better house for her mother and expand the rice farming business.

loans.use: To purchase farming items like fertilizer.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 25 years old. He is married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old. Celestin's wife is a housewife. Both of them work to provide for their family. Celestin is a serious businessman and works hard to increase his profit. Normally Celestin sells different kinds of products such as flasks, plates, spoons, other cosmetic products and so forth.  His small shop is open from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day and he has been working in this business for 4 years.

Celestin is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more household products to sell. This loan will be important for him because he will be able to attract more customers by satisfying their demands. With this loan, Celestin believes he will obtain more profit, which he will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more household items to sell

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 6 children, none of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).    Annet has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days of every week. Annet sells her products as retail from home.     Annet has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.  She will use it to buy more bags of charcoal.  The main business challenges for Annet include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and also to build rental rooms.   Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and medication

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia M., aged 38, runs a poultry business in Tala. She is married to Cosmas M. and together they have three grown children: Mutisya aged 23, Charles aged 22, and Mbatha aged 20. Patricia was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Tala office. She has been running this business for five years and her monthly profit is Kshs. 6,000. With the loan of Kshs 17,500 which, is her second loan from KADET, she plans to buy chicks to raise and sell later at a profit. If this loan boosts her business, she will expand her poultry business and open a grocery store. This will make it easier to her pay school fees for her children. Patricia’s dream is to expand her poultry business. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Hermano Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Hermano Miguel esta formado por 8 mujeres que en su mayoría son familiares, se dedican a diferentes trabajos que les han permitido ayudar en la economía de sus hogares, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad  más importante del país. A esta ciudad le hace grande su gente, su gastronomía, su cultura y la belleza de su naturaleza.

La Señora. Narcisa Sigüenza es socia del banco comunal Hermano Miguel, vive por el sector del Salado en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 18 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su ultima hija le ayuda en su trabajo. Su esposo vive en el extranjero en busca de un mejor trabajo para mejorar la economía de su hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Narcisa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados, actividad que la realiza hace 18 años, vende recorriendo toda la ciudad y también tiene entregas, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde. 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más producto para la elaboración de sus helados. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno para construir su casa.

La Señora. Nancy C. es socia del banco comunal Hermano Miguel vive por el sector de Las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca. Nuestra socia se encuentra en su séptimo crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por su mamá a formar parte del banco comunal.
Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad la realiza hace 2 años, labora  tres días a la semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, por las noches  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y se encuentra en cuarto año. 
La Señora Nancy tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, su esposo también es comerciante de ropa, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir más su mercadería. Su meta es tener un vehiculo para poder trasladarse con su mercadería.
texts.en:
The 'Hermano Miguel' community bank is made up of 8 women, most of whom are family members.  They work in different businesses which have allowed them to help their households financially.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca which is the third most important city in the country.  This city's people, gastronomy, culture and the beauty of its nature make it great.

Narcisa Sigüenza is a member of the 'Hermano Miguel' community bank.  She lives in El Salado sector, in the city of Cuenca.  She is 43 years old, married, and has three children aged 23, 20 and 18.  Her eldest two children are married and live independently.  Her youngest daughter helps her in her work.  Narcisa's husband lives abroad, looking for a better job to improve their household finances.  Narcisa does not own her own home but rents instead. 

Narcisa makes and sells ice cream.  She has been in this business for 18 years.  She sells her products all over the city and also makes deliveries.  She works from Sunday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 1.00pm.  This is her fourth loan through her community bank.  She was invited to join the community bank by a friend and she will use her loan money to invest in buying more products with which to make her ice cream.  Narcisa's dream is to buy a plot of land on which to build her own house.

Nancy C. is a member of the 'Hermano Miguel' community bank.  She lives in Las Orquídeas sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This is Nancy's seventh loan through our foundation and she was invited by her mom to join the community bank.

Nancy sells all kinds of clothes.  She has been in this business for 2 years.  She works three days a week, from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  In the evenings, she studies at a school in the city where she is in her fourth year.

Nancy is 22 years old.  She lives with her partner and has a one year-old child.  Her husband also sells clothes.  They don't have their own home but rent instead.  Nancy will invest her money in buying clothes to better stock her business.  Her goal is to own a vehicle so that she can transport her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy products for making ice cream and to buy clothes

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
el sr. Andrés C. U. cuenta con un negocio de venta de abarrotería y productos lácteos, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de ”PULPERIA LAS COLINAS” tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, durante todo este tiempo a sido una fuente de generación de ingresos para su hogar, también se dedica a la caficultura lo que le a permitido contribuir y apoyar mas a su familia con los gastos familiares, El Sr. C. es muy conocido en la zona por ser una persona de buenas costumbres.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de granos básicos, abarroteria y productos lácteos como ser queso , mantequilla y quesillo, de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. 
Se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio a crecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Andres C. U. has a grocery store and milk sales business. The name of his business is "Pulperia Las Colinas". He has 5 years in the business and through all this time it has been a source of income for his household. He also has a coffee plantation and it has allowed him to provide for his family’s expenses. Mr. C. is very well known in his community, for being someone with good habits. 

His loan will be used to purchase basic grains, grocery merchandise and milk products, such as cheese, butter, and curds, in order to satisfy client demands. 

He is very happy because his business has grown.

loans.use: To purchase general store merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
Akmaljon is married with two children. He sells women's clothing at two places. He takes all his inventory with him by car and provides local clients with the clothing they need. Akmaljon has been in this business for 11 years. He sells women's clothing because women buy new clothing more often. Akmaljon is a hardworking person. His goal is to fix his house and take good care of his children. He wants to borrow 3000 USD to purchase seasonal inventory. The loan would help Akmaljon to increase his sales and reach his goals faster.  
                                                          
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan will allow her to purchase more corn and grow her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang R., as head of this group, obtained a loan of 1,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) to buy two pigs to be used as sows. Ni Komal R. finds it helpful to supplement the family's income with this effort. She works daily as a farmer with one child who is an adult. She hope the future cooperation is still running smoothly.

Pigy Lestari Group has received a loan for the third time from MUK. But the presence of only eight people is realized, because two members were attending a religious ceremony.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.ru: Elchin I. 23 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Elchin projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoim bratom. Elchin uje 2 qoda kak imeyet svoy magazin "Baybi shop" qde prodayet vse chto otnositsya detyam (detskuyu odejdu, detskuyu mebel, detskiye igrushki i t.d). Seychas Elchin nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit detskuyu mebel dlya pereprodaji. On ranshe rabotal v magazine dyadi qde i nauchilsya etomu biznessu.
texts.en: Elchin I. is 23 years old. He is single without children. Elchin lives in the city of Baku together with his brother. For the pas two years, he has been keeping a store called “Baby shop,” where he sells all kinds of children’s items (children’s clothing, furniture, toys, etc). At present Elchin needs to 2000 AZN in order to buy children’s furniture for resale. He used to work in his uncle store, which was how he learned this business.

loans.use: to purchase children's furniture

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es: Alicia como es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual no tiene nombre, ella tiene con ese negocio aproximadamente 10 años y dice que su papa comenzó con este negocio y después se lo dejo a ella para que lo trabajara ella dice “mi papa me dejo el negocio ya que el se desesperaba estar encerrado todo el día y yo como me pasaba todo el día en la casa decidió dejármelo a mi, también de que me gusta el comercio y me gusta estar atendiendo a la gente y también así estoy al pendiente de mi casa”. Ella es soltera, y comenta que el préstamo le ayudara a comprar cosas que le hacen falta dice que comprara jabón, huevo, leche, azúcar, papel higiénico etc. comprara un poco de todo ya que pidió poco préstamo para no quedar mal con la financiera y mas adelante pedirá un poco mas para seguir surtiendo, ella considera que los negocios van creciendo poco a poco y ella espera que le ira bien, dice que anteriormente estuvo con otra financiera y esta le cobraba muchos intereses y por eso no crecía su negocio. La meta que tiene Alicia es poner mas adelante una maquinitas (videojuegos) ya que muy cerca de su local hay una escuela para que los niños de su colonia se diviertan.
texts.en: Alicia, as she is known by her friends and neighbors, has a small grocery store with no name. She has operated this business for about 10 years. She says that her father began with this business and later gave it over to her so that she could run it. She says "My father gave me the business because he was tired of being indoors all day, and since I spent all day in our house, he decided to give it over to me, also because I like trade, and I like serving the customers and also in this way I know what is going on at home." She is single, and she comments that the loan will help her buy things that she needs. She says that she will buy soap, eggs, milk, sugar, bathroom tissue, etc. She will buy a small amount of each, since she requested a small loan so that she would not run into problems with the financial institution, and later she will request a little more so she can keep stocking her store. She thinks that businesses grow little by little, and she hopes that it will go well for her. She says that previously she had a loan from another financial institution, but it charged her a lot of interest, and so her business did not grow. Alicia's goal is to install some machines (video games) since there is a school very close to her store, and the children of her neighborhood can have fun with them.

loans.use: to buy items to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.es:
Liberata nació en el distrito de Taray provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Taray se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco), ella tiene 42 años edad y tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco. (La ciudad de Taray caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona ganadera y agrícola). 

Liberata se dedica a la venta de artesanía en el Mirador de Taray que está ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Taray, ella sale a trabajar desde las 8 de la mañana hasta el medio día los días martes, jueves y domingos. (El Mirador de Taray es el primer lugar donde se puede realmente apreciar la belleza del Valle Sagrado.). Liberata nos cuenta con mucha pena que en el mes de febrero del año 2010 la ciudad de Taray sufrió un desastre natural pues el rio se desbordo y los pobladores perdieron sus negocios y se cayeron sus casas. Liberata tenía 300 a 350 cuyes pero lo perdió todo y ahora quiere empezar de nuevo el negocio y por ese motivo requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.   

Liberata pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el cuarto y medio de año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Liberata was born in the district of Taray, Calca province, in the department of Cusco. Taray is 45 minutes from the city of Cusco and is known for having beautiful countrysides and for being a farming and ranching region. She is 42 years old and has 4 children. Currently, she lives in the city of Cusco. 

Liberata sells artisan crafts in the lookout of Taray which is located 10 minutes from the city of Taray. She goes to work at 8:00am until noon on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. The lookout at Taray is the first place where one can truly appreciate the beauty of the Sacred Valley. 

Liberata tells us with shame that in February 2010 the city of Taray suffered a natural disaster when the river overflowed and the population lost their businesses and their homes collapsed. Leberata had 300-350 guinea pigs but lost it all and now has to start her business anew. For this reason she has requested a loan to buy guinea pigs.

Liberata belongs to the village bank "Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, part of the Arariwa Assocation. The village bank has been around for 4 and a half years and it's going very well.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Felix Manuel

texts.es: Félix Manuel se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales comercializa en el mercado. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a esta actividad principalmente para ganarse la vida.  Poco a poco ella fue obteniendo la experiencia necesaria, hasta llegar a tener el negocio que ahora posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de frutas y verduras, entre lo que se destaca las naranjas, melones, sandias, bananos y repollos   ya que desea comprar ahorita que los precios han estado un poco bajos. Su sueño a corto plazo es invertir más en el negocio de tal forma que brinde mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Félix Manuel has sold fruits and vegetables in the market for over 21 years, work that has helped him earn a living. Little by little he worked to get the experience necessary until he was able to have the business that he now owns. The loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables, mainly oranges, melons, watermelons, bananas and cabbages since he wants to buy them now as the prices have been low. Félix Manuel’s short term dream is to invest in his business more so that he can have more profits.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, mainly oranges, melons, watermelons, bananas and cabbages.

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Sut, 45, is a humble woman and the mother of four children. One is married and lives in another house, while the other three are single, two of whom are employed in manufactoring as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Sut has had a job as a local farmer for a long time on her own farmland in Kompong Cham Province. She has a life partner, her husband, who has worked as a teacher in the local school for several years. She normally generates an average of $2.50 profit a day and uses her income to meet all her family’s needs. Presently, Sut doesn’t have funds to pay for things in the rainy season. For that reason, Sut decided to look for a loan from Kiva to pay for plowing, to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting on time.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting on time.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 38 years old and married to Philomena. The couple is blessed with two school-aged children. For the past 18 years, David has been in the stone mining industry in Ndunyu Njeru town. 

David was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff credit officer at the Ndunyu Njeru office and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to pay for land that he is going to lease and to add manpower for his stone mining.

In future, David hopes to use modern mining technology to become more efficient in his mining business.

loans.use: to pay for leased land and hire employees

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy things like a cooler and fishing net for her fishing business. 

Cayetana has been in this business for four years. Cayetana earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Cayetana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy material for fishing like a cooler, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
Sadek is a 44 year old married man and the father of 3 children.  Sadek has had experience as a blacksmith since 1979.  He started his own business in 1991 in order to provide his family with better living.

Sadek is a hardworking man and seeks the best for his customers and family, especially his wife and kids.  He insists on providing his children with the best education ever and that's why he requested a loan from Al  Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to pay his children's school fees.

Sadek is a man with a good standing history and he has been a Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles, and hopes to continue to be a good borrower.  He stated that the previous loans helped a lot in improving his family and business social and financial situation.
Sadek hopes to expand his business more and more in the future to insure covering his children's university education expanses.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school expenses

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana está casada, su esposo le ayuda económicamente, su hijo lo tiene estudiando, mujer trabajadora tiene su propio negoció desde hace tiempo vende ropa de variedad, iniciándolo con fondos de micro créditos.  Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y su nivel de vida.
Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: blusas, para damas, niños y caballeros, pantalones, camisolas, ropa interior entre otros productos de uso personales.  Obtendrá mayor variedad captando nuevas clientelas.  
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is married and she splits household expenses with her husband.  Her son is in school.  She is a hard-working woman who has operated her own clothing business for several years, a business she started with microloans.  Her goal is to improve her house and her standard of living.  She will use this loan to buy clothing for men, women and children--blouses, trousers, camisoles and underwear--and other merchandise that she will resell.  A wider range of products will allow her to pick up new customers.
She is grateful to the bank for supporting the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Esther;  la socia es soltera y tiene 39 años de edad, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 18 años de edad; la socia trabaja en una institución y ella específicamente cuida a adultos mayores, la socia disfruta mucho de la compañía de los adultos mayores y de toda la experiencia enriquecedora que vivieron y que comparten con ella, la socia suele trabajar para dar lo mejor a su hijo y en esta ocasión ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en los pagos de estudio de sus hijo, la socia pagara la universidad de sus hijo para esto la socia desea poder contar con el crédito, ella tiene un hijo que estudia psicología en la universidad privada en la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de los estudios en la universidad de su hijo. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sra. Esther is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old, single, and has an 18-year-old son. Esther works at an institution where she takes care of older adults. She greatly enjoys being in the company of elderly people and being enriched by all of the life experiences that they have shared with her. Esther works in order to provide the best for her son and on this occasion she is requesting a loan to invest in his studies. She wants to obtain this loan so that she can pay for his university classes. Her son is studying psychology at a private university in the city of Cusco, so she is requesting this loan so that she can invest in his studies.

Esther is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university studies.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib is a 47-year-old man who runs his own café. He has six years of experience in this field. Sahib's brother helps him. He serves clients with tea and dinner -- the most popular is the national meal made of meat. Sahib would like to improve his café and applied for a 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan.

loans.use: to make renovations to his café.

loans.name: Las Semillitas Group

texts.es: El Sr. Raúl   es divorciado, tiene 1 hijo, Raúl tiene 48 años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Semillitas” grupo  conformado por  7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Raúl trabaja desde hace 9 años en un negocio de planchado y pintura para vehiculos junto con un amigo que es su socio, este negocio surge a raiz de que raul se quedo sin trabajo la situacion era preocupante ya quetenia que mantener a su menor hijo es asi que junto a su amigo forman su negocio con mucho entusiasmo Raul nos cuenta que trabajo muy duro para conseguir lo que hoy en dia tiene gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacion a logrado mejores ingresos economicos, hoy en dia le paga  asu hijo la universidad y cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercaderia (pintura y todos los instrumentos que se necesitan para planchar un vehiculo) .Sabemos que Raùl  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos deaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Sr. Raúl is divorced and has 1 son. He is 48 years old and is currently a member of “Las Semillitas” communal bank, which is made up of 7 members who are involved in different businesses.

Raúl has been working for 9 years in a business doing bodywork and painting vehicles, together with a friend, who is his business partner. This business began when Raúl was unemployed and worried because he had a young son to support. That is when he got together with his friend and they very enthusiastically started their own business.

Raúl tells us that he has worked very hard to obtain what he has today. Thanks to his effort and dedication, he has succeeded in increasing his income and now he can pay for his son to attend the university and for himself to have a better quality of life. His goal is to continue growing. He has requested a new loan to buy merchandise (paint and all the instruments needed to do vehicle bodywork). We know that Raúl will achieve his goals with a lot of work and effort and that the loan from Edaprospo will help him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (paint, etc.)

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is married and blessed with 8 children with her husband. She is 48 years old and lives in Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental.

Magdalina sells snacks like banana cue and barbecue(chicken feet) to earn an income. She enjoys this kind of business, meeting different kinds of people. Problems come along but she has been able to solve them. She is able to earn a net income PHP 3000 a month. She has been in this business for a year.

Magdalina is asking for a loan of PHP 10000 to purchase additional banana for banana cue and also to purchase chicken legs for barbecue. Magdalina has been a member of GDMPC for about a year. She is looking forward to being able to renovate her house and send her children to college in the future.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and materials to make snacks

loans.name: Antonio Alfonso

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Antonio Alfonso se dedica arduamente  a laborar como ayudante  de fontanero, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace sietes años. Es acompañado y con tres personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen en el futuro.

La señor Antonio Alfonso ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como bloque, cemento, cinz y madera, para reparación de su techo, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Antonio Alfonso works hard as a plumber's assistant.  He has been in this line of work for seven years.  He lives with his partner and has three people in his care.  He provides them with the conditions they need to develop in the future.

Antonio Alfonso has come to Ceprodel to request a loan so that he can improve the condition of his home.  He will buy construction supplies such as blocks, cement, metal sheets and wood with which to repair his roof.  By carrying out this work, he will provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Misael Anani

texts.es:
Don Misael tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos.

Él se dedica a la albañilería ya tiene treinta años de experiencia, empezó como ayudante de un albañil, y hoy en día él tiene mucho conocimiento en la actividad que realiza. Al mismo tiempo le esta enseñando a sus hijos este oficio para que puedan defenderse en la vida.

Don Misael esta solicitando un préstamo  a Fundación Campo, para instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa, ya que nunca la han tenido de forma propia, al tenerla él junto con su esposa pretenden poner una pequeña tienda, ya que su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas y le seria de mucha ayuda el tener energía en su casa. De esta manera mejoran su condición de vida, él en un futuro desea ampliar su casa y construirla de ladrillo, ya que actualmente es de lámina, pero con la ayuda del préstamo y su familia dice don Misael que lo pueden lograr.
texts.en:
Misael is 46 years old, lives with his life partner and their three children.

He makes a living as a mason and already has thirty years of experience. He began as an assistant to a mason and now has extensive knowledge about his livelihood. At the same time, he is teaching his children this trade so that they can fend for themselves in life.

Misael is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to install electricity in their home, as they have never had their own means to do so.  Once they get electricity, he intends to start a small shop together with his wife. His wife already makes a living selling tortillas and it would be a great help to have energy in the house. In this way, they will improve their living conditions. In the future he wants to expand his house and construct it with brick, as currently it is made of sheet metal. With the help of the loan and his family Misael says that they will be able to achieve this.

loans.use: to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and then sell

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Francisco tiene 54 años, esta casado y es padre de 4 hijos, Juan tiene una experiencia de 15 años en la caficultura, muchas personas de esta zona se dedican a este tipo de actividad, la tierra y el ambiente son aptos para el cultivo del cafe, esta es una de las 3 mejores zonas en donde se producen los mejores granos de cafe de Honduras. Don Juan utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel solar, pues en su comunidad no cuentan con energía eléctrica, nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que podra eliminar los candiles y las candelas que son dañinas para las vias respiratorias.
Juan aprovechara mas la noche para realizar actividades ya sean personales o de trabajo.
texts.en:
54-year old Sr. Juan Francisco is married and has four children. He has worked in the coffee-growing business for fifteen years, like many people in the area. The land and the climate are very suitable for growing coffee, and the area is one of the three best parts of Honduras for quality grains.

Juan plans to use the loan to buy a solar panel as his community does not have electricity. He says he’d be very happy to get rid of his oil lamps and candles which are harmful to the respiratory system. As well, he’d be able to take advantage of the evenings to do other personal or work-related activities.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: 3.2.64 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mùi operates a food stall selling beverages. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refeshment bar (a small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks and fast food).

Mùi is 31 years-old and she is married with two children.  She is the leader of a five member group, the 3.2.64 Quảng Hưng solidarity group.  Mùi lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Mùi joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mùi has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Mùi has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Mùi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mùi hopes to build a new house in order for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain a refreshment stand.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is a 44-year-old Lebanese single man who lives alone. He is working to satisfy his own needs and to be capable of covering his life expenses. He has been involved in the tailoring field for the past 15 years. Eight years ago he decided to open his own factory. He loves his work and is always looking for new, different and originA. designs. 

He will use a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase tailoring supplies such as textiles and other items, which he notes will increase his sales by 20%. In the future, he plans to enlarge his factory and hire new designers.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles and other items.

loans.name: Teyson

texts.es: Teyson de 19 años es soltero, vive en casa de su madre, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Él es un joven estudiante quien se esmera con la finalidad de ser algo en la vida, el único sostén que Teyson tiene son los kekes que él y su madre preparan, por lo que cuenta con un horno y local propio. Sin embargo uno de los repuesto de su horno se malogro, por lo que Teyson recurre a MFP, con la finalidad de adquirir un préstamo. Ya que se vio en la necesidad de arreglarlo porque es el único sostén de donde sale la economía para la inversión en su estudio. Ahora el único inconveniente que Teyson tiene es abastecerse de insumos para elaborar su producto. En un futuro Teyson después de terminar sus estudios piensa ampliar el negocio con maquinarias y equipos de vanguardia. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará repuesto para solucionar el problema del horno.
texts.en:
Teyson is 19 years old and lives in his mother’s home, located in the Pichari district.  He’s a young student who wants to be someone in life.  His only source of income is from the cakes that he and his mother prepare.  They have their own oven and shop, however one of the parts in the oven went bad, so Teyson approached MFP to request a loan.  He needs to fix it because it’s their only means of support and from where he gets money to pay for his studies.

Now, Teyson’s only incontinence is stocking up on supplies to make their product.  In the future he wants to finish his studies and plans to expand the business with vanguard equipment and machines.  This will be his first loan through MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the 1,500 PEN ($575) to buy repair parts to fix the oven.

loans.use: to fix his oven.

loans.name: Tip

texts.en: Tip is 69 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and three grandchildren in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She and her husband are farmers.  Her grandson is a construction worker and her granddaughters are garment workers.  Tip is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her granddaughters to drive to work.  In the future, she would like to improve her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her granddaughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing and embroidery business. She started her business few years ago to financially support her husband, who is a clerk in an organization and was not able to fulfill the basic needs of the family.
 
Now she is well established in her business and has gained a lot of experience and skills. 

With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has become old and she is unable to use it effectively. By purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to complete the orders on time and increase her income. 

Naseem has given birth to three children. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education.  

She is confident that by improving her business, she will be able to earn more income and her children will be able to continue getting their education. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for the sewing business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 48, is married with two children, aged 15 and 20. She runs a tailoring business to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and  employs two people. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Grace has been able to improve her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. Grace has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy cloth materials.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 26-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Ana has a shop that sells vegetables, spices and food seasonings. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy vegetables, spices and food seasonings.

Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices and food seasonings.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 20 year old married woman who supports 1 family member from AL Nasser Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for materials for making sweets she wants to increase her income.In the future she would like to expand her project through opening a shop and she hopes to buy a home.
Since Haya is under 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan

loans.use: to pay for materials for making sweets

loans.name: Ragiatu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Ragiatu. She is widowed and has 2 children aged 17 and 8 years old. 

In 2002 Ragiatu established her palm oil, junk, water, and cosmetics business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her children since she is a single parent. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,300,000 every month from this business.   She faces high competition, but her wealth of experience in business enable her to excel.

She would like a loan to the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy more gallons of palm oil, bundles of pure water, etc. to improve her business. 

In the future, she still plans to educate her children up to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil, bundles of pure water, etc. to improve her business.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe has worked in her grocery store for 10 years, to help her husband with their houshold expenses. As her partner is much older than she, he cannot share in the labor.

\"Because my husband stopped working due to his old age, I decided to start my own business. This has allowed us to sustain a basic level of living for 10 years. Nevertheless, as times passes, needs increase, illnesses are more frequent, and this places us under higher medical bills.

Because of this, I would like to expand my business, expand my clientel and supply my business with more merchandise, to offer better service with higher return. To do this, it is fundamental that I obtain a loan for $1,500.00 dollars, which will help greatly to resolve our basic necesities. I this I will repay the loan in 12 months.

Español

La Sra. Guadalupe tiene 10 años dedicándose al negocio de abarrotes, cuya finalidad es apoyar en todo a su esposo en los gastos de ambos. Como su compañero es una persona de edad avanzada, no puede desempeñar una labor. “Desde que mi esposo dejó de trabajar debido a su edad avanzada decidí iniciar mi propio negocio. Esto nos permitió durante 10 años tener el sustento básico para vivir. Sin embargo a medida que pasa el tiempo las necesidades aumentan, las enfermedades son más frecuentes, y esto supone mayor gasto de medicamentos. Por esta razón, quisiera aumentar mi negocio, ampliar mi local y surtirla con más mercancía, para brindar un mejor servicio con mayor rendimiento. Para lograrlo, es fundamental obtener un apoyo de 1,500 dólares, que ayudaría en gran manera a resolver nuestras necesidades básicas. Pienso pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy more merchandise and repair my commercial location.

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Kpomé, Miss Massan A. is single and has no children. Very dynamic but not having learned a profession, she invested herself in the sale of yams, palm nuts, and fruits in the market in Nukafu in Lomé.

In order to increase her buying power, to go herself to the villages where production is abundant, and to realiize maximum profit, she is asking, for the first time, for a loan of $400. This young woman, who has no one to come to her aid, deserves to be supported financially in order to allow her to succeed in life.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1981 à Kpomé, Mademoiselle A. Massan est célibataire sans enfant. Très dynamique mais n’ayant appris aucun métier, elle s’est investie dans le commerce d’ignames, des noix de palme et des fruits au marché de Nukafu à Lomé.

En vue d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat, d’aller elle-même dans les villages où la production est abondante et réaliser un profit maximum, elle sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit de $400. Cette jeune femme qui n’a personne pour lui venir en aide mérite d’être appuyée financièrement pour lui permettre de se lancer dans la vie.

loans.use: To stock up on foodstuffs

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina has a rice peeling operation in Salitre. She hopes to invest the loan in buying rice from the local farmers so she can sell it to distributors. She has three children, two males and a female. She lives in her home with two of her kids who are still in school. She hopes that she can save enough money to send her kids to school in Guayaquil.

She is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Buena Suerte de Salitre Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Buena Suerte Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture, which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices, and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Buy rice wholesale

loans.name: Marhamathon

texts.en:
Marhamathon is 58 years old. She and her husband have been on pension for a long time. She has three children: 2 sons and one daughter. Two of her children already have families and live separately. She and her husband live with their eldest son.

Marhamathon can’t sit without doing business and has had a small shop near their house for some years. Her trading day begins in the evening, and she trades till late at night. She spends the received income for herself and her husband and on sweets for the grandsons. One year ago she received a small loan from MicroInvest and has increased her working capital. After receiving new loans, she gradually expanded her assortment of goods. Now you will find everything in her shop that is necessary in life. Now she wants to get the next loan for further expansion.

loans.use: To expand assortment of goods

loans.name: Muminjion

texts.en: Muminjon is an experienced person in the Ckalovsk market, in Khujand. He works here since 1994. He started his business from trade of national bread and watermelons. He has big family: his wife, 5 children and his old parents. For supporting his family he tried every day to develop his business. Gradually he increased his turnover and changed his business to trade of different kind of meat product such as sausages, ground meat and meat loaf. He has an agreement with several workshops of meat product. His business is going well. He has good turnover of his working capital. In future he plans to increase the number of his product and for this action he needs in additional refrigeration.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Fatima Yesenia

texts.es:
Fatima is married and has three children. Her husband travels constantly due to his job as a truck driver. As a result of his job, and the long periods of time in which he was absent from the home, Fatima found it difficlut to receive the money he would send while he was away, and which they used to survive. Three years ago, Fatima decided she would sell shoes, in order to avoid the troubles of not having money during her husband's absence. Like most businesses, some times she has work and others she does not.

Currently, Fatima is low on inventory due to her lack of money to invest in her business. Because of this, Fatima would like to borrow US $525 to re-pay in 6 month installments, in order to have a better selection for her clients and to place orders some clients have made. With your help, Fatima will be able to help her family with their expenses and help her children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Wendy Wise

Fátima está casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo viaja constantemente puesto que trabaja como trailero. Y el hecho de que el señor se encuentra fuera de la ciudad por días semanas y en ocasiones por meses, a Fátima se le complica mucho estar recibiendo el dinero que a él le pagan y con el que normalmente sobrevivían. Pero un día con las necesidades que pasaban al no estar su esposo, decidió vender zapatos por catálogo, lo que viene haciendo los últimos 3 años sin embargo y como todos los negocios en unas ocasiones hay mucho trabajo y en otras no.

Actualmente Fátima se encuentra en una baja en su comercio, puesto que no cuenta con dinero para invertir en el negocio y en visitar clientes, por lo que hoy está solicitando un crédito de US $ 525 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses para poder surtir de mercancía y comprar algunos pedidos que le han hecho con tu ayuda Fátima podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudará a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase an assortment of shoes for the coming season

loans.name: Khanoglan

texts.en:
Khanoglan is a married man with two children. He was born in 1961. He lives in Salyan region, in the Yenikand village.

He has his own farming business. Because Khanoglan wants to improve his business, he is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en: We are Rehema M., Anna M., Abas K., James M., Lucas S., and Edani T., six members of UMOJA WA SITA group. We have been together with Youth Self Employment Foundation as a group for the past 9 months. We are engaged in running various businesses  ranging from charcoal sales to running small restaurants and kiosks.  We are each in need of US$ 400 to help us expand our individual businesses so that our families may prosper.

loans.use: expand our individual businesses so that our families may prosper

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti J., 29, is the mother of 2 children and has a grocery store at her house earning about $10 a day. Her husband, Ardianto, is a public transportation driver who earns a very small income which is not enough to cover the family's needs. Now Siti is asking for a loan of $125 to buy more inventory for her store and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Zohra's Group

texts.en:
I am Zohra B. from Lahore, Pakistan. I have five boys and two girls. My husband is a rickshaw driver and earns minimum income. I am requesting a second loan for my son to purchase additional inventory for his shoe business and thus improve the family's income.

The other women in my group would use the loan in the following ways: Farzana B. wants to purchase a rickshaw; Fozia B. will buy cloth; Nomi B. will use her loan to repair her family’s rickshaw (a local three-wheeled taxi); Rukhsana B. will also use the loan to repair her husband’s rickshaw. All of these women are friends and dream of a successful life.

loans.use: Expand shoe business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth was born in 1953, married with two children. She works hard and strives higher for herself and the family. With the death of her husband and first daughter, who was more like a sister, she was obliged to work very hard to carter for the second son. Her plans for her son could only be realized with more income which, triggered her to joined GHAPE.

With the loan she plans to do mixed farming and increase her business of cooked food. Her business especially with Koki beans provide the community with lunch and ceremonial food at a cheap cost. With the profit from this business she plans to buy a plot and build a house for herself and her son. She plans to pay the loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement

loans.use: Purchase of food items such as koki beans and farm seedlings

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es:
Hilda is a 46 year old married woman. She lives with her husband in the “Spring” neighborhood. Her husband is a refrigerator technician how works in La Curacao. Hilda has three children. Her children are 10, 6 and 2.

Hilda is a domestic worker. She earns the majority of her wages in one specific home, and these wages are a major factor in covering the needs of her family.

Hilda requests a loan so that she can redo the roof of her home. The roof is currently in serious need of repair. She hopes that in the future her children will have good educations so that they can better their living standards and so that life will not be as hard on them.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Hilda tiene 46 años de edad, casada y habita en el barrio primavera, su esposo es técnico de refrigeración y trabaja en la expresa La Curacao. Ella tiene tres hijos de 2, 6 y 10 años de edad. Doña Hilda es domestica que se gana la vida trabajando en casa particular para salir adelante con las necesidades del hogar el préstamo lo quiere para cambiar el techo de su casa ya que esta en mal estado. En el futuro anhela que sus hijos tengan una buena educación para que mejoren el nivel de vida y no les toque tan difícil.

loans.use: Repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Mrs. Nidia is 36, and is married to Mr. Cristino Espínola. More than ten years ago she migrated from the interior of the country to the city of Luque, where she sells meals for workers of a known factory that is meters away from her home.

Nidia’s family is made up of two school-aged children and her husband, who has worked as a fireman in the city airport for more than 8 years.

The requested loan is for the expansion of her business, which will allow her to work more comfortably and provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nidia tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Cristino Espínola. Hace más de 10 años migró del interior de país a la ciudad de Luque, donde se dedica a la venta de comidas para empleados de una conocida fábrica que se encuentra a metros de su domicilio.

La familia de Nidia esta constituida por sus 2 hijos que están en edad escolar y su marido, quien trabaja como bombero en el aeropuerto de la ciudad hace más de 8 años.

El préstamo que solicita es para la ampliación de su negocio, así de esa forma poder trabajar cómodamente y brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Expansion of commercial space

loans.name: Berta

texts.en: Berta is a member of the Village Bank Tarpuy. She is 54 years old, married, and has 7 children ranging in age from 15 to 33 years old. She uses her loans from FINCA toward her business of selling fish in the Nery García market. She goes to Lima once every week, Thursday to Saturday, to buy the fish that she sells at the market in Ayacucho. Berta needs a loan to invest in the growth of her business and buy more fish. Berta dreams that her business will grow with the help of the loans from FINCA, and that she will be successful.

loans.use: To invest in the growth of her business and to buy more fish.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a village close to Saida, in the southern part of Lebanon. Hussein is a hair designer for men. He has been a microcredit client of A. Majmoua for the past three years.

Hussein first requested a loan for $500 and repaid it on-time over 6 months. He used it to purchase new equipment to expand his business. The second loan was to pay the school fees of his children. The third loan, for $1500, was used to purchase new carpets for his home. Hussein now needs a loan for $1200 to pay the school fees of his children for next year. Hussein is a very hardworking person and is determined to make a difference in his family life.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees for next year.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. started her local restaurant nine years ago in Goaso where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 35 years old and married with one kid and two step kids who are currently in school. Ama serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and taken with hot pepper or soup.

Ama wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: Ama would like to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood for her popular food stand.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
