Filomena nació el 11 de Agosto de 1,952, no estudió, sólo asistió al programa de alfabetización, es separada y tiene un hijo varón de 21 años de edad. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.

Es una de las socias antiguas del Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” en Yunguyo, lo integró durante 04 años y lo dejó por motivos familiares, reingresando después nuevamente al Banco Comunal. 

Con este crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, aumentará el capital para comprar 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno para engorde con S/.800, también se dedicará al engorde de porcinos, ovinos, los cuales vende en la feria de Yunguyo.

 Doña Filomena quedó huérfana de padre a los 08 años de edad, ellos son seis hermanos, su madre tuvo que enfrentar la responsabilidad sola para salir adelante. Por falta de medios económicos no pudo estudiar porque tenía que ayudar a su madre en el cuidado y crianza del ganado vacuno y ovinos. A los 20 años de edad se fue a trabajar de empleada a la ciudad de Ilo, regresó al campo a los 28 años de edad debido a que su madre se encontraba mal de salud y llegó a fallecer. Formó su hogar a los 30 años de edad, lamentablemente su pareja la abandonó cuando su hijo tenia apenas 03 meses de nacido, desde entonces ella asumió el rol de padre y madre, sólo educó a su hijo hasta quinto de secundaria, el se fue a trabajar a la ciudad de Lima y hasta la fecha es quien la apoya económicamente.

Su sueño es comprar más ganado vacuno para engorde y tener un pequeño establo.
texts.en:
Filomena was born on August 11, 1952. She didn’t go to school, she only attended a reading program. She is separated and has a 21 year old son. She lives in Centro Poblado of Acari in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. She is one of the older members of the Communal Bank “Fe y Alegria” (Faith and Happiness) in Yunguyo, she has been a member for 4 years and left for family reasons, returning recently to the Communal Bank. With this loan for S/.500 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will increase her capital to buy 1 head of cattle to fatten. With S/.800 she will fatten pigs and sheep which she will sell in the Yunguyo market. Filomena lost her father when she was 8 years old, and she is one of 6 children. Her mother had to take responsibility to raise the children alone and move forward. For lack of economic means she could study because she had to help her mother care for and raise cattle and sheep. At 20 years old she went to work in the city of Ilo, returned to the countryside at 28 years old as her mother was in ill health and later passed away. She married at 30 years old, sadly her husband abandoned her when her son was only 3 months old. Since then she has assumed the role of father and mother, educating her son through the 5th year of secondary school, then he went to work in Lima and today it is he who supports her economically. Her dream is to buy more cattle to fatten and have a small stable.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira T. is married and has four children.  Together with her husband, she makes bread in her house and sells it at the local market.  Because they use good ingredients, their bread has become very popular in their region and they have many cients.  But the increasing price of flour and other ingredients has made it difficult for them to market their bread at prices that satisfy their customers.  Therefore, Munira is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: Purchasing flour and other bread ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mr. Sokheng K. lives in Chek village in Kandal Province. He is a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Sok Sokkim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Sokheng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support his wife’s field, and he will use the rest of money to buy rice seeds for the field. He hopes to increase income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is 27 years old and the father of three children, who all stay at home.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his wife’s field and to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Raquel Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sr. Raquel tiene 30 años de edad, habita en Villa Reconciliación, casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil desde hace tres años. Tiene tres hijos de 8, 11 y 13 años de edad todos están estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Con el apoyo económico de su esposo ha empezado ido cambiando poco apoco su casita pero falta mas detalles que dentro de sus planes están la construcción total y parcial de su vivienda. Requieren de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque, madera, puerta entre otros. Gracia a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra culminar su proyecto que una mayor seguridad y protección para su familia, con comodidad y un patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel is 30 years old, lives in Villa Reconciliación, and is married. Her husband has been a bricklayer for three years. She has three children, who are 8, 11, and 13 years old. All of them are studying in the high school in the capital. With the financial support of her husband, she has begun renovating her house little by little, but she lacks more materials that are major components of the construction, based on her plans. They need a loan to buy construction materials like cement, iron, blocks, wood, and doors, among other things. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, they will be able to complete their project, which will give them more security and protection for their family. The home will give them more comfort and will be an asset for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish her house

loans.name: Amlato

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Mr D. Amlato est père de huit (08) enfants et réside actuellement à Gapé au Sud du Togo.  Après avoir abandonné les études, li s’est adonné à la vente de produits alimentaires de premières nécessités et autres. Doué et expérimenté dans ce genre de commerce, il sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage. Ceci lui permettra de venir à bout de ses problèmes financiers et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie sur le plan économique et social.
texts.en:
Thirty-two years old, Mr. Amlato D. is the father of eight children and lives in Gapé in the South of Togo. After leaving school, he began selling staples and other foodstuffs. Talented and experienced in this type of business, he is asking for a loan to expand his merchandise. He will thus put an end to his financial problems and improve his living conditions both economically and socially.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino la señora Juana Evangelista se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras especialmente tomates ofrecidos con mucho entusiasmo en su localidad el cual atiende desde hace 30 largos años habiéndose ganado el aprecio de sus clientes

La razón por la cual ella hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los tomates ya que al habérsele agotado requiere nuevamente llenar sus estantes para continuar con este negocio que es de mucho beneficio para ella.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Sandino, Juana Evangelista dedicates herself to the sale of fresh vegetables especially tomatoes that are very popular in her region, where she has been providing service for the past 30 long years, winning over the appreciation of her clients.

The reason why today she is seeking the support of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) is to be the recipient of a loan to purchase tomatoes, especially now that she has exhuasted her supply and she requires to replenish her stands to continue with her business, being a great benefit to her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan L. regrets her marriage that lasted for almost a decade and ended because her husband broke her trust, having an affair with another woman. Though her husband has realized his fault, Joan is not yet ready to forgive her husband. For many months she remained calm with what happened. She just focused on raising her two children, Althea Vianca - 4 years old, and John Denver who is 2 years old already, alone. Her children served as her inspiration in struggling with life’s difficulties.

St. Tomas village located in Alicia, Isabela is where her family is currently living, Joan manages her village store business. Prior to her village store, Joan was first engaged in selling vegetables for almost a year and later on decided to shift to managing a village store to raise her children continuously without depending on any support from her husband. Her hopes to improve her current business led Joan to seek additional capital from lenders amounting to PHP 8,000. Her determination to succeed also motivated her to pursue her business alone.

Joan says that she is much blessed in her life for in spite of the trials and challenges, she has managed to overcome those through committing her troubles to God. She just prays that her children will grow up with a good attitude that she will be proud of in the future.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Nurija

texts.ru: Нурия женщина 63 лет ,мать семерых детей,занимается торговлей мелких товаров первой необходимости для дома.Её муж работает строителем на заказ.За товаром Нурия ездит самостоятельно в Истаравшан.Также ей поставляют  сами поставщики.Нурия кредитуется уже третий год.Для завоза нового товара она подала заявку.Нурия благодарна инвесторам за финансирование.
texts.en:
Nurija is 63 years old, the mother of seven children, and trades in basic items for the home. Her husband works as a builder for hire. To obtain products for her trade, Nurija travels on her own to Istaravshan, where she gets her goods from the suppliers. Nurija has been taking out loans already for three years. To deliver new goods, she has submitted an application for credit. She is grateful to investors for financing.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: small trade

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca F. R. tiene mas de 26 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion de venta de rosquillas y pan, actividades que realiza desde su casa de habitacion, ella tiene la ayuda de dos empleadas para sacar su producto, este lo distribuyen en diferentes lugares aledaños a la ciudad de Danli, tambien lo vende en muchos negocios en dicha ciudad, esto le ayuda con los gastos y compromisos que tiene de su hogar, tiene una hija a su cargo, la mayor parte de los habitantes donde ella vive son todos adultos ya que la mayoria de los jovenes han meigrado al exterior del pais en busca de nuevos horizontes. este trabajo viene de generacion en generacion. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas material para producir mucho pan.
texts.en:
For more than 26 years Francisca F. R. has been making and selling rosquillas (a regional cookie specialty) and bread. She does this from her home. She has the help of two employees to take the baked goods and distribute them in different places surrounding the city of Danli. She also sells to many businesses in Danli. This helps with the household expenses and commitments. She takes care of a daughter. Most of the people where she lives are adults. The majority of the young people have moved to the exterior of the country looking for new horizons. This work has been handed down from generation to generation. She needs a loan to buy more supplies in order to make a lot of bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese, corn, lard, flour, sweets, wood.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат - женщина 48 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей детских аксессуаров, сумочек, фотоальбомов, и прочих аксессуаров. Саломат закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она торгует на Рынке "Панчшанбе" на втором этаже магазин № 197. Саломат хочет расширить свой ассортимент и закупить партию детской одежды. Поэтому Саломат взяла кредит чтобы закупить новую партию.
texts.en:
Salomat is a 48 year old woman. She is married and has 3 children. She sells children’s accessories – purses, photo albums and other accessories. Salomat purchases her products from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. She sells at the “Panchshanbe” market on the second floor, store #197. Salomat would like to grow her product assortment and purchase a stock of children’s clothing. This is why Salomat took out a loan in order to purchase a new stock of products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's products

loans.name: Iris Wuvaldina

texts.es: La Sra. B. tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años, la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "EDUARDO" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. ella es casada y madre de 2 hijos, de los cuales ya solo depende uno,  el otro ya se hizo su vida y esta casado, su esposo se dedica al Transporte el realiza fletes dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Doña Iris nos comento muy alegre que su negocio le ha sido de gran bendición, ya que con los ingresos que le ha generado el mismo ella ha ido invirtiendo mas en su negocio y cumpliendo con los compromisos adquiridos. ella necesita el credito porque necesita capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio y comprar granos basicos ya que estos se estan escaseando y encareciendo en esta epoca y los vendedores lo ponen a un precio alto que es dificil comprarlo.
texts.en:
For the past 10 years Iris has had a small grocery store, which is called the “EDUARDO” grocery store. Her business is located in her home. Iris is married and has 2 sons; one of her sons still lives with her, while the other is married and no longer lives at home. Iris’s husband works in transport and provides a charter service both inside and outside the city. Iris tells us very happily that her business has been a great blessing, since with the income it has generated she has invested more in her business and fulfilled her financial obligations. She is requesting a loan because she needs working capital so she can re-supply her business and purchase basic grains. Basic grains are currently scarce and becoming more expensive, since the vendors are putting a high price on them and making them difficult to purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks, churros, cookies, candies, coffee, bread, rice, beans, lard, oil, tortillas, toilet paper, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 30 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children. Hanan has owned a hairdressing salon for five years. She also does makeup and sells some beauty products. Hanan requested a loan of 800 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for her. This is her second cycle and she has always on time. 
Her previous loan helped her diversify her merchandise and improve her salon. Hanan is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her work because she wanted to depend on herself and supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hanan will use the loan to purchase beauty products for her.

loans.name: Murtaza

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Муртаза - мужчина 45 лет. Женат, имеет четырёх детей. Муртаза занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой молока, сметаны и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Муртаза в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота и рад, что кредитуется у нас.
texts.en:
Murtaza is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has four children. Murtaza is involved in feeding and sales of cattle and small livestock. He buys the livestock at a market and, having fed them for 2-3 months, resells it at the market. His wife processes milk and makes sour-cream and sells it at the market. She also helps out with the household. She helps her husband to improve their family budget. Murtaza wants to increase the quantity of his livestock and is happy to be our client.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la calle Carlos Medinacelli de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja en una agencia de viajes y el esposo trabaja con un auto de su propiedad  como radio taxi.  El crédito que solicita es para reparar la movilidad ( ajuste de frenos, cambio de aceites, etc.) y de esta manera mantener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia estable.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro; la actividad que desempeña la califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel lives at her parents' house with her husband and two children on Carlos Medinacelli Street in the Alto Sopocachi zone of La Paz; she works at a travel agency and her husband drives a car that she owns as a radio taxi. The loan that she is requesting is to repair the car (break adjustment, oil-change, etc.) and thereby maintain her income and keep her family stable. It is the first time that she is requesting a loan from Impro; the work that she performs qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cost of maintenance of a radio taxi that she owns and that her husband drives for a living

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and poultry food

loans.name: Ipogolo C Group

texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Ipogolo C borrower group,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 10,7 years .

Cristina started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tsh.

This is Cristina`s first loan from BRAC.she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Cristina hopes to save money and expand her business.

Anna is another member of the same borrower group,she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her own clothing business

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Monsefú, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años vende flores en el vivero municipal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, las flores se las envían desde la ciudad de Caraz (ubicada en la región Ancash) y todos los dias se levanta temprano para ofrecer el producto a sus clientes.

El tuvo que empezar este negocio debido a que sus hijos ya terminaban sus estudios secundarios en el colegio y deseaba brindarles algún tipo de educación superior, ahora el desea ampliar su negocio para seguir educando a sus hijos motivo por el cual esta solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mas flores que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Felipe es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran una persona trabajadora y que da todo de si para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe is 44 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in the city of Monsefú, which is located 20 minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, he has been selling flowers at the municipal nursery in the city of Chiclayo. The flowers are shipped in from the city of Caraz (located in the Ancash region) and every day he wakes up early so that he can offer these products to his customers.

Felipe started his business because his children are about to finish high school and he wants to provide them the opportunity to pursue some type of higher education. He wants to expand his business so that his children can continue their studies. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from our Institution in the amount of 1000 soles so that he can buy more flowers to sell to his customers.

Felipe is well-known and respected among his colleagues. They consider him to be a hardworking person who wants to do everything in order for his family to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flowers for resale

loans.name: The Blood Of Jesus Group

texts.en: Dorothy is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Dorothy is a baker. She is the leader of a trust bank group called The Blood of Jesus. The group members are engaged in farming and/or trading activities. They sell to and supply their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Cartas

texts.en:
Cartas M. was born in 1969,married with two children aged between 6 and 8.
She lives in Nyarugenge district, Kigali province capital of Rwanda .
Cartas owns a small shop of loin clothes since 2003 and employs one person in her business.

Before doing this business she was fultime house wife and she could not get all needs for her family.
With this new loan requested in vision finance company ,she plans to purchase more loinclothes in order to earn more profit so that she will be able to save money for the future of her family.

loans.use: Clothes sale

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
Rosejean B. is a 33-year-old transport service operator living in a populous village in Dasmarinas, Cavite. Her husband, Zacarias, 32, is a tricycle driver. Their only child is now in high school.

Rosejean has been managing a transport fleet for six years now.  She owns a passenger jeepney and two units of motorized tricycles plying varied routes around town. She employs a neighbor as a driver along with her husband.

She has just finished paying off her latest loan from CCT. She is now applying for a new loan in the amount of P10,000.00 to have enough funds for the mechanical maintenance of her fleet.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: For the mechanical maintenance of tricycles

loans.name: Juan Daniel

texts.es: El señor  Juan T.  tiene 34 años de edad, es Casado Presta sus servicios,   habita junto  a su esposa  e hijos, su residencia que se encuentra en el Sector 2 Cantón Chuixchimal, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente Por la necesidad de poder de comprar un vehículo, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para Cubrir su Compra, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan T. is 34 and married. He offers his services. He lives with his wife and children. His home is located in Sector 2 Cantón Chuixchimal in the department and municipality of Totonicapán, Guatemala. He currently needs to be able to buy a vehicle, but the economic conditions in which he finds himself are not sufficient to cover the cost. That is why he came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. He will buy raw material to be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to get his family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vehicle

loans.name: Obellie

texts.en:
Mrs. Obellie A. M., 36 years of age, is married and is a resident of 54-D Mabini-Laurel St.,  Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is blessed with three children of whom two are now in their high school years and the other one is still in the elementary grades. Although separated from her husband, she is still full of hope about her ability to support her three children.

For her source of income, Obellie engaged in a business dealing in RTW (ready-to-wear clothes), bags and imported perfumes. She started this kind of business ten years ago and has been able to sustain her family even in time of crisis. At this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than P15,000 from her business activity which is sufficient to support the family needs.

Aside from that, Obellie also earns an income from a newspaper publication called “Misamis Weekly” which has ten years of existence already in this city. They started this business with a capitalization of P15,000 only.

As a new member of Paglaum MPC under the regular loan program, Obellie is privileged enough to obtain her first loan of P20,000 to add to her revolving capital for her RTW, bags and imported perfumes business. The proceeds of this loan will be used to support her family’s food needs, educational needs and as savings for preparing for the education of her three children in college in the near future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes loves to be a farmer. She does rice farming for a living. The 2-hectare (5-acre) piece of land they have is where they get their source of living. With proper maintenance and land preparation, they will reap a good harvest.

Lourdes requested a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to support her business. She asked for 15,000 Php which will be used to buy farm supplies.

Lourdes is married to Victor and they have two children. Her eldest is 17 years old.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Pita

texts.en:
Pita S. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local beer. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal to sell.  Pita is 28 years old and married.  Her husband is a driver.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

 
 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila S. is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives in a single-family home with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Min S., works in a hardware store and her son is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. S. opened a grocery shop five years ago and sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family.

Now, Mrs. S. is requesting Rs 15,000 to increase the necessary stock of food items in her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits (cookies) and other items. She wishes to use her income to provide a better education for her son.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Julia Elida

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Julia P. se dedica a laborar arduamente para llevar a cabo su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por varios años ha estado en malas condiciones pero que hoy requiere ser mejorada. Ella ha solicitado un crédito con el fin de utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para así llevar a cabo esta obra que le urge realizar para beneficio de toda su familia.
Ella es madre soltera y con un hijo en edad escolar al que debe mantener y brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo y un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Julia P. works arduously in the department of León to achieve her dream of improving the conditions of her house. It has been in bad condition for several years, and it now needs to be fixed. She has asked for a loan to buy construction materials. That way she can accomplish this job that urgently needs to be done for the benefit of the whole family. She is a single mother with a school-age child. She needs to support him and give him the conditions necessary in life for him to develop, and she needs to give him a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Née le 03 juin 1971 à karimama au Nord du BENIN, T. Félicienne vit depuis maintenant 12ans à Lom-Nava, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Mariée à BABA TOUNDE Joachim, un chauffeur, Félicienne est mère de 4 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Félicienne se joint à son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Félicienne exerce comme activité la vente de tubercules d’igname, de patate douce et de l’oignon. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN, que Félicienne se ravitaille. Félicienne effectue la vente des produits à son domicile. Félicienne n’a pas été à l’école mais exerce son activité depuis 7 ans. Félicienne a déjà bénéficié de 4 crédits, auprès de ALIDé, qui ont tous été bien remboursé. Félicienne souhaite renforcer et élargir ses activités mais dispose de très peu de moyens pour y arriver, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
Born June 3, 1971 in Karimama (North of Benin), Félicienne T. has lived for the past twelve years in Lom-Nava, a neighbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Joachim BABA TOUNDE, a chauffeur, Félicienne is the mother of four children who all attend school. She joins forces with her husband to make ends meet. Félicienne sells yams, sweet potatoes and onions. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and sells her products from her home. Félicienne has not attended school, but has been commercially active for the past seven years. She was already granted four loans from ALIDé, all of which were repaid in full. Félicienne wants to strengthen and broaden her activities, but has very little means to do so, which is why she is requesting a fifth loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of yams and onions
